c

ca 1

ind. and; both ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning and; both
Sanskrit ca

Examples

dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati

AN 2.135 āyācanavaggo

n'atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa,
paññā n'atthi ajhāyato,
yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.

DHP 372 bhikkhuvaggo
ca 2

ind. but; although; and if ✓

Grammar ind, conj
Meaning but; although; and if
Sanskrit ca

Example

na hi verena verāni,
sammant'īdha kudācanaṃ,
averena ca sammanti,
esa dhammo sanantano.

DHP 5 yamakavaggo
ca 3

ind. (gram) and; as well as; but; terms and conditions apply to a rule ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning (gram) and; as well as; but; terms and conditions apply to a rule
Sanskrit ca

Examples

317, 332. tesaṃ vibhattiyo lopā ca.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 317

496, 497. simhi ca.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 496
ca 4

letter. (gram) letter c; 14th letter of the alphabet; palatal consonant ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter c; 14th letter of the alphabet; palatal consonant
Sanskrit ca

Examples

byañjan'antassa dhātussa co hoti chapaccayesu paresu. jigucchati, tikicchati, jighacchati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 472

kvaci caādese, paradvebhāvo ṭhāne'ti

bālāvatāra sarasandhi
ca 5

ind. 6th item in a numerical list; lit. letter c ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning 6th item in a numerical list; lit. letter c
Sanskrit ca

Example

(ca) katamo eko dhammo visesabhāgiyo? yoniso manasikāro. ayaṃ eko dhammo visesabhāgiyo.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ
cakāra 1

masc. (gram) letter c; 14th letter of the alphabet; palatal consonant [ca + kāra] ~

Grammar masc, letter, comp
Meaning (gram) letter c; 14th letter of the alphabet; palatal consonant
Construction ca + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (ca + kāra)
Sanskrit cakāra

masc. the word "and" [ca + kāra] ~

Grammar masc, letter, comp
Meaning the word "and"
Construction ca + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (ca + kāra)
Sanskrit cakāra
cakita

adj. disturbed, afraid ✗
cakora

masc. francolin partridge ✗
cakka 1

nt. wheel ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning wheel
Notes folk etymology suggests √car (move) + √kar (make) + a
Sanskrit cakra

Examples

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃ'va vahato padaṃ.

DHP 1 yamakavaggo

heṭṭhā kho pana tassa bhoto gotamassa pādatalesu cakkāni jātāni sahass'ārāni sanemikāni sanābhikāni sabb'ākāraparipūrāni, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
cakka 2

nt. vehicle; lit. wheel ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning vehicle; lit. wheel
Notes folk etymology suggests √car (move) + √kar (make) + a
Sanskrit cakra

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhayaṃ hoti aṭavisaṅkopo, cakkasamārūḷhā jānapadā pariyāyanti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho asamayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ

atha naṃ āha, amma, kāḷi imasmiṃ nagare pañca sakaṭasatāni paccūsakāle uṭṭhāya vāṇijjāya gacchanti, tvaṃ imaṃ netvā cakkamagge nipajjāpehi, goṇā vā naṃ maddissanti, cakkā vā chindissanti, pavattiṃ c'assa ñatvāva āgaccheyyāsī'ti.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wheel-size; disk sized
Construction cakka + matta

cakkayuga

nt. pair of wheels [cakka + yuga] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning pair of wheels
Construction cakka + yuga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cakkūnaṃ + yuga)
Sanskrit cakra + yuga

Example

sovaṇṇamayo pabhassaro,
uppanno rathapañjaro mama,
tassa cakkayugaṃ na vindāmi,
tena dukkhena jahāmi jīvitan'ti.

DHPa 1.1.2 maṭṭhakuṇḍalī vatthu
cakkaratana

nt. jewelled wheel; wheel treasure; one of the seven treasures of a universal ruler [cakka + ratana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning jewelled wheel; wheel treasure; one of the seven treasures of a universal ruler
Construction cakka + ratana
Compound kammadhāraya (cakka + ratana)
Sanskrit cakraratna

Examples

addasā kho, bhikkhave, so puriso bahunnaṃ vassānaṃ bahunnaṃ vassasatānaṃ bahunnaṃ vassasahassānaṃ accayena dibbaṃ cakkaratanaṃ osakkitaṃ ṭhānā cutaṃ

DN 26.2 cakkavattisuttaṃ

idh'ānanda, rañño mahāsudassanassa tadah'uposathe pannarase sīsaṃ nhātassa uposathikassa uparipāsādavaragatassa dibbaṃ cakkaratanaṃ pāturahosi sahass'āraṃ sanemikaṃ sanābhikaṃ sabbākāraparipūraṃ.

cakkavattisukha

nt. ease of an emperor; comfort of monarch; lit. wheel turner ease [cakkavattī + sukha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning ease of an emperor; comfort of monarch; lit. wheel turner ease
Construction cakkavattī + sukha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cakkavattino + sukha)
Commentary (KPa) cakkavattisukhaṃ piyan'ti iṭṭhaṃ kantaṃ manāpaṃ cakkavattisukhaṃ. iminā cāturantacakkavattirajjaṃ dasseti.
Sanskrit cakravartin + sukha

Example

padesarajjaṃ issariyaṃ,
cakkavattisukhaṃ piyaṃ,
devarajjam'pi dibbesu,
sabbam'etena labbhati.

cakkavattī

masc. emperor; monarch; sovereign; lit. wheel turner [cakka + vattī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp

Construction cakka + vattī

Sanskrit cakravartin

Examples

sace agāraṃ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato. tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

idaṃ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṃ paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūp'āraho

masc. righteous sovereign ruler ✗

cakkavālapabbata

masc. (circular) rock supposed to encircle the earth ✗
cakkavāḷa

masc. world system; solar-system; lit. circle of animals; i.e. zodiac [cakka + vāḷa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning world system; solar-system; lit. circle of animals; i.e. zodiac
Construction cakka + vāḷa
Compound kammadhāraya (cakka + vāḷa)
Notes (MW) of a mythical range of mountains (encircling the orb of the earth and being the limit of light and darkness)
Sanskrit cakravāla, cakravāḍa

Example

evaṃ nisinne bodhisatte sakaladasasahassacakkavāḷadevatā sannipatitvā sādhukāraṃ datvā

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā

cakkavīriya

adj. with effort as wheels [cakka + vīriya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with effort as wheels
Construction cakka + vīriya
Commentary (SNa) cakkavīriyo'ti vīriyacakko, kāyikacetasika-saṅkhātāni dve vīriyāni assa cakkānī'ti attho.
cakkasamāruḷha

adj. having boarded vehicles; lit. mounted wheels [cakka + samāruḷha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having boarded vehicles; lit. mounted wheels
Construction cakka + samāruḷha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cakkāni + samāruḷha)
Variant cakkasamārūḷha
Commentary (ANa) cakkasamārūḷhā'ti ettha iriyāpathacakkam'pi vaṭṭati yānacakkam'pi. bhayasmiṃ hi sampatte yesaṃ yānakāni atthi, te attano parikkhārabhaṇḍaṃ tesu āropetvā palāyanti. yesaṃ n'atthi, te kājena vā ādāya sīsena vā ukkhipitvā palāyanti'y'eva. te cakkasamārūḷhā nāma honti.
Sanskrit cakra + samārūḍha
cakkasamārūḷha

adj. having boarded vehicles; lit. mounted wheels [cakka + samārūḷha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having boarded vehicles; lit. mounted wheels
Construction cakka + samārūḷha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cakkāni + samārūḷha)
Variant cakkasamāruḷha
Commentary (ANa) cakkasamārūḷhā'ti ettha iriyāpathacakkam'pi vaṭṭati yānacakkam'pi. bhayasmiṃ hi sampatte yesaṃ yānakāni atthi, te attano parikkhārabhaṇḍaṃ tesu āropetvā palāyanti. yesaṃ n'atthi, te kājena vā ādāya sīsena vā ukkhipitvā palāyanti'y'eva. te cakkasamārūḷhā nāma honti.
Sanskrit cakra + samārūḍha

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhayaṃ hoti aṭavisaṅkopo, cakkasamārūḷhā jānapadā pariyāyanti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho asamayo padhānāya.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbānī'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? cakkh'āyatanaṃ sot'āyatanaṃ ghān'āyatanaṃ jivh'āyatanaṃ kāy'āyatanaṃ man'āyatanaṃ

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
cakkhu 1

nt. eye [√cakkh + u] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning eye
Root Family √cakkh
Root √cakkh･1 a (see)
Construction √cakkh + u
Derivative kita (u)
Synonym akkha, akkhi, dassana, locana, nayana, netta
Sanskrit cakṣu
Sanskrit Root √cakṣ 1, 2 (see)

Examples

muttā ca tato sā bhikkhunī,
agamī buddhavarassa santikaṃ,
passiya varapuññalakkhaṇaṃ,
cakkhu āsi yathā purāṇakan'ti.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

yo'pi hetu yo'pi paccayo cakkhuviññāṇassa uppādāya, so'pi hetu so'pi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī. aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ cakkhuviññāṇaṃ kuto niccaṃ bhavissati!

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ
cakkhu 2

nt. eyesight; faculty of seeing [√cakkh + u] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning eyesight; faculty of seeing
Root Family √cakkh
Root √cakkh･1 a (see)
Construction √cakkh + u
Derivative kita (u)
Sanskrit cakṣu
Sanskrit Root √cakṣ 1, 2 (see)

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā paṭikūlā honti

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

yañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhave, cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvaraṃ asaṃvutassa viharato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvaraṃ saṃvutassa viharato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti

MN 2.3 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
cakkhu 3

nt. vision; insight; understanding [√cakkh + u] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning vision; insight; understanding
Root Family √cakkh
Root √cakkh･1 a (see)
Construction √cakkh + u
Derivative kita (u)
Commentary (MNa) ariyaṃ cakkhun'ti parisuddhaṃ vipassanāñāṇañ'c'eva maggañāṇañ'ca.
Sanskrit cakṣu
Sanskrit Root √cakṣ 1, 2 (see)

Example

tañ'hi te, māgaṇḍiya, ariyaṃ cakkhuṃ n'atthi yena tvaṃ ariyena cakkhunā ārogyaṃ jāneyyāsi, nibbānaṃ passeyyāsī'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
cakkhu 4

nt. spiritual vision; divine eye [√cakkh + u] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning spiritual vision; divine eye
Root Family √cakkh
Root √cakkh･1 a (see)
Construction √cakkh + u
Derivative kita (u)
Commentary (MNa) ariyaṃ cakkhun'ti parisuddhaṃ vipassanāñāṇañ'c'eva maggañāṇañ'ca.
Sanskrit cakṣu
Sanskrit Root √cakṣ 1, 2 (see)

Example

katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā cakkhunā sacchikaraṇīyā? sattānaṃ cut'ūpapāto, bhikkhave, cakkhunā sacchikaraṇīyo.

AN 4.189 sacchikaraṇīyasuttaṃ
cakkhuka 1

adj. (related to) eye; -eyed [√cakkh + u + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from cakkhu
Meaning (related to) eye; -eyed
Root Family √cakkh
Root √cakkh･1 a (see)
Construction √cakkh + u + ka
cakkhu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit cakṣuṣmat
Sanskrit Root √cakṣ 1, 2 (see)

Example

ubho khañjā ubho kuṇī,
ubho visamacakkhukā,
ubhinnaṃ piḷakā jātā,
n'āhaṃ passāmi illisan'ti.

DHPa 4.5 macchariya kosiyaseṭṭhi vatthu
cakkhuka 2

adj. having eyes [√cakkh] ✗
cakkhukaraṇa

adj. which produces vision; which creates clarity [cakkhu + karaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which produces vision; which creates clarity
Construction cakkhu + karaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cakkhuṃ + karaṇa)
Antonym acakkhukaraṇa
Synonym cakkhukaraṇī
Sanskrit cakṣus + karaṇa

Example

nekkhammavitakko, bhikkhave, anandhakaraṇo cakkhukaraṇo ñāṇakaraṇo paññāvuddhiko avighātapakkhiko nibbānasaṃvattaniko.

ITI 87 andhakaraṇasuttaṃ
cakkhukaraṇī

adj. which produces vision; which creates clarity [cakkhu + karaṇa + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, fem nom sg of cakkhukaraṇa
Meaning which produces vision; which creates clarity
Construction cakkhu + karaṇa + ī
cakkhukaraṇa + ī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cakkhuṃ + karaṇī)
Antonym acakkhukaraṇī
Synonym cakkhukaraṇa
Sanskrit cakṣu + karaṇa

Examples

lobhassa ca pahānāya dosassa ca pahānāya atthi majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ

ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
cakkhukūpa

masc. eye socket ✗
cakkhuda

adj. giving sight; who gives vision; lit. giving eye [cakkhu + da] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning giving sight; who gives vision; lit. giving eye
Construction cakkhu + da
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cakkhuṃ + da)
Commentary (SNa) cakkhudo'ti andhakāre cakkhumantānam'pi rūpadassan'ābhāvato dīpado cakkhudo nāma hoti, anuruddhatthero viya dibbacakkhu sampadam'pi labhati.
Sanskrit cakṣurdā

Examples

kiṃdado balado hoti,
kiṃdado hoti vaṇṇado,
kiṃdado sukhado hoti,
kiṃdado hoti cakkhudo,
ko ca sabbadado hoti,
taṃ me akkhāhi pucchito'ti.

SN 1.42 kiṃdadasuttaṃ

annado balado hoti,
vatthado hoti vaṇṇado,
yānado sukhado hoti,
dīpado hoti cakkhudo.

SN 1.42 kiṃdadasuttaṃ
cakkhudada

adj. who gives the eye (of understanding) ✗
cakkhudhātu

fem. vision; lit. eye element [cakkhu + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning vision; lit. eye element
Construction cakkhu + dhātu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cakkhuno + dhātu)
Commentary (SNa) cakkhudhātū'tiādīsu cakkhupasādo cakkhudhātu, rūpārammaṇaṃ rūpadhātu, cakkhupasādavatthukaṃ cittaṃ cakkhuviññāṇadhātu.
Sanskrit cakṣu + dhātu

Example

evaṃ, bhante. idaṃ kho, gahapati, dhātunānattaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā, cakkhudhātu, rūpadhātu, cakkhuviññāṇadhātu … manodhātu, dhammadhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu.

SN 41.2 paṭhamaisidattasuttaṃ
cakkhunissita

adj. dependent on the eye [cakkhu + nissita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on the eye
Construction cakkhu + nissita
cakkhundriya

nt. sense of sight; visual faculty; lit. eye power [cakkhu + indriya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning sense of sight; visual faculty; lit. eye power
Construction cakkhu + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (cakkhu + indriya)
Sanskrit cakṣu + indriya

Examples

tassa saṃvarāya paṭipajjatha, rakkhatha cakkhu'ndriyaṃ, cakkhu'ndriye saṃvaraṃ āpajjatha.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

pañc'imāni, bho gotama, indriyāni nānāvisayāni nānāgocarāni, na aññam'aññassa gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhonti. katamāni pañca? cakkhu'ndriyaṃ, sot'indriyaṃ, ghān'indriyaṃ, jivh'indriyaṃ, kāy'indriyaṃ.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ
cakkhundriyanirodha

masc. ending of the sense of sight [cakkhundriya + nirodha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of the sense of sight
Construction cakkhundriya + nirodha
cakkhundriyanirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the ending of the sense of sight [cakkhundriya + nirodhagāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the ending of the sense of sight
Construction cakkhundriya + nirodhagāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cakkhundriyanirodhaṃ + gāmī)
cakkhundriyasamudaya

masc. arising of the sense of sight [cakkhundriya + samudaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning arising of the sense of sight
Construction cakkhundriya + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cakkhundriyassa + samudaya)
cakkhundriyasaṃvara

masc. restraint of the sense of sight; lit. eye faculty restraint [cakkhundriya + saṃvara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning restraint of the sense of sight; lit. eye faculty restraint
Construction cakkhundriya + saṃvara
Compound sattamī tappurisa (cakkhundriye + saṃvara)
Sanskrit cakṣu + indriya + saṃvara

Example

yañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhave, cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvaraṃ asaṃvutassa viharato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvaraṃ saṃvutassa viharato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti.

MN 2.3 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
cakkhundriyasaṃvarasaṃvuta

adj. with the sense of sight restrained [cakkhundriya + saṃvara + saṃvuta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with the sense of sight restrained
Construction cakkhundriya + saṃvara + saṃvuta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (cakkhundriyasaṃvarena + saṃvuta)
Sanskrit cakṣu + indriya + saṃvara + saṃvṛta

Example

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... sot'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... ghān'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... jivh'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... kāy'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... man'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati.

fem. Theragāthā 95 (TH95) ✗
cakkhuppakāra

masc. components of the eye ✗

masc. arising of vision; restoring of sight; arising of insight [cakkhu + uppāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning arising of vision; restoring of sight; arising of insight

Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cakkhūnaṃ + samuppāda)
Sanskrit cakṣu + utpāda

Example

so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya. tassa saha cakkh'uppādā yo amusmiṃ telamalikate sāhuḷicīre chandarāgo so pahīyetha. tañ'ca naṃ purisaṃ amittato'pi daheyya, paccatthikato'pi daheyya

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
cakkhubhaṇḍa

adj. with eyelashes ✗
cakkhubhāga

masc. part of the eye ✗
cakkhubhūta

adj. who sees; who understands; lit. become the eye [cakkhu + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who sees; who understands; lit. become the eye
Construction cakkhu + bhūta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa > paṭhamā bahubbīhi (cakkhuno + bhūta)
Commentary (MNa) dassanapariṇāyak'aṭṭhena cakkhubhūto ... atha vā cakkhu viya bhūto'ti cakkhubhūto'ti evam'etesu padesu attho veditabbo.
Sanskrit cakṣu + bhūta

Examples

so h'āvuso, bhagavā jānaṃ jānāti, passaṃ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto, vattā pavattā, atthassa ninnetā, amatassa dātā, dhammassāmī tathāgato

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

cakkhuno bhūto cakkhubhūto, cakkhubhūto iva bhūto yo bhagavā so'yaṃ cakkhubhūto, bhagavā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 328
cakkhumant 1

adj. with eyes; who can see; who has vision; gifted with sight; lit. having eyes quality [√cakkh + u + mant] ✓

Grammar adj, from cakkhu
Meaning with eyes; who can see; who has vision; gifted with sight; lit. having eyes quality
Root Family √cakkh
Root √cakkh･1 a (see)
Construction √cakkh + u + mant
cakkhu + mant
Derivative taddhita (mant)
Sanskrit cakṣuṣmat
Sanskrit Root √cakṣ 1, 2 (see)

Examples

maggān'aṭṭh'aṅgiko seṭṭho,
saccānaṃ caturo padā,
virāgo seṭṭho dhammānaṃ,
dvipadānañ'ca cakkhumā.

DHP 273 maggavaggo

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso āpāthagatānaṃ rūpānaṃ adassanakāmo assa, so nimīleyya vā aññena vā apalokeyya.

Example

so suṇeyya cakkhumato bhāsamānassa, chekaṃ vata, bho, odātaṃ vatthaṃ abhirūpaṃ nimmalaṃ sucī'ti!

cakkhulola

adj. greedy to see many things ✗

cakkhuviññāṇa

nt. seeing; eye consciousness; visual awareness; lit. eye knowing [cakkhu + viññāṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning seeing; eye consciousness; visual awareness; lit. eye knowing
Construction cakkhu + viññāṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (cakkhu + viññāṇa)
Sanskrit cakṣu + vijñāna

Examples

dvayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭicca viññāṇaṃ sambhoti. kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, dvayaṃ paṭicca viññāṇaṃ sambhoti? cakkhuñ'ca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṃ.

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, viññāṇakāyā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, sotaviññāṇaṃ, ghānaviññāṇaṃ, jivhāviññāṇaṃ, kāyaviññāṇaṃ, manoviññāṇaṃ.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cakkhuviññāṇadhātu

fem. eye consciousness element; visual awareness [cakkhuviññāṇa + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning eye consciousness element; visual awareness
Construction cakkhuviññāṇa + dhātu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cakkhuviññāṇassa + dhātu)
Commentary (SNa) cakkhudhātū'tiādīsu cakkhupasādo cakkhudhātu, rūpārammaṇaṃ rūpadhātu, cakkhupasādavatthukaṃ cittaṃ cakkhuviññāṇadhātu.
Sanskrit cakṣu + vijñāna + dhātu

Example

evaṃ, bhante. idaṃ kho, gahapati, dhātunānattaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā, cakkhudhātu, rūpadhātu, cakkhuviññāṇadhātu … manodhātu, dhammadhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu.

Examples

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

cakkhuṃ, āvuso channa, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ cakkhuviññāṇaviññātabbe dhamme etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti samanupassasi?

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

Meaning parts of the eye

majjhe pubbuḷakā sāssukā,

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
cakkhusaññita

masc. contact with the eye; visual impression; visual experience [cakkhu + samphassa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning contact with the eye; visual impression; visual experience
Construction cakkhu + samphassa
Compound kammadhāraya (cakkhu + samphassa)
Sanskrit cakṣu + saṃsparśa

Examples

yā kho, bhikkhave, imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ saṅgati sannipāto samavāyo, ayaṃ vuccati cakkhusamphasso. cakkhusamphasso'pi anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ

yam'p'idaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkham'asukhaṃ vā tam'pi suññaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā.

SN 35.85 suññatalokasuttaṃ

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning contact with the eye and the corresponding field of experience; visual impression and the associated dimension of knowing
Construction cakkhusamphassa + viññāṇāyatana
Commentary (SNa) cakkhusamphassaviññāṇāyatanan'ti cakkhuviññāṇena sampayutto cakkhusamphasso'pi viññāṇ'āyatanam'pi mam'evā'ti. ettha ca cakkhusamphassena viññāṇasampayuttakā dhammā gahitā, viññāṇ'āyatanena sabbāni'pi cakkhudvāre uppannāni āvajjan'ādiviññāṇāni. sotadvār'ādīsu'pi eseva nayo.

cakkhusota

nt. eye and ear; eyes and ears [cakkhu + sota] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning eye and ear; eyes and ears
Construction cakkhu + sota
Compound dvanda (cakkhu ca sota ca)
Sanskrit cakṣu + śrotas

Example

taṃ yathā? cakkhu ca sotañ'ca cakkhusotaṃ, mukhañ'ca nāsikā ca mukhanāsikaṃ, chavi ca maṃsañ'ca lohitañ'ca chavimaṃsalohitaṃ. evaṃ pāṇy'aṅg'atthe.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 322
cakkhusotaviññeyya

adj. visible and audible; lit. to be known by the eye and ear [cakkhu + sota + viññeyya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp, comp
Meaning visible and audible; lit. to be known by the eye and ear
Construction cakkhu + sota + viññeyya
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (cakkhusotena + viññeyya)
Commentary (MNa) idāni te dve dhamme dassento cakkhusotaviññeyyesū'ti āha. tattha satthu kāyiko samācāro vīmaṃsakassa cakkhuviññeyyo dhammo nāma. vācasiko samācāro sotaviññeyyo dhammo nāma.
Sanskrit cakṣu + śrotas + vijñeya

Example

vīmaṃsakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā parassa cetopariyāyaṃ ajānantena dvīsu dhammesu tathāgato samannesitabbo cakkhusotaviññeyyesu dhammesu, ye saṃkiliṭṭhā cakkhusotaviññeyyā dhammā, saṃvijjanti vā te tathāgatassa no vā'ti?

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
cakkhussa

adj. good looking; easy on the eye; (comm) good for the eyes; lit. for the eye [√cakkh + u + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from cakkhu
Meaning good looking; easy on the eye; (comm) good for the eyes; lit. for the eye
Root Family √cakkh
Root √cakkh･1 a (see)
Construction √cakkh + u + [s] + ya
cakkhu + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change +s
Antonym acakkhussa
Commentary (ANa) acakkhussan'ti na cakkhūnaṃ hitaṃ, cakkhuṃ visuddhaṃ na karoti.
Sanskrit cakṣuṣya
Sanskrit Root √cakṣ 1, 2 (see)

Example

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dantakaṭṭhassa khādane. katame pañca? cakkhussaṃ, mukhaṃ na duggandhaṃ hoti, rasaharaṇiyo visujjhanti, pittaṃ semhaṃ bhattaṃ na pariyonandhati, bhattam'assa chādeti.

AN 5.208 dantakaṭṭhasuttaṃ
cakkhūni uppādeti

idiom. is able to see; gains vision; lit. generates eyes ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr
Meaning is able to see; gains vision; lit. generates eyes
Sanskrit cakṣūṇi + utpādayati

Example

tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṃ kareyya, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ adhovirecanaṃ añjanaṃ paccañjanaṃ natthukammaṃ. so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
cakkhūni visodheti

idiom. is able to see clearly; gains focus; lit. purifies eyes ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr
Meaning is able to see clearly; gains focus; lit. purifies eyes
Sanskrit cakṣūṇi + viśodhayati

Example

tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṃ kareyya, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ adhovirecanaṃ añjanaṃ paccañjanaṃ natthukammaṃ. so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
cakkhūndriya

nt. sense faculty that is the eye ✗
caggahaṇa

nt. (gram) employing the word "and"; using the word "but" [ca + gahaṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning (gram) employing the word "and"; using the word "but"
Construction ca + gahaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (caṃ + gahaṇa)
Sanskrit ca + grahaṇa

Examples

caggahaṇena pañcamīvibhatti'pi hoti. mā gacchāhi.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 420

caggahaṇena āra āla'icc'ete paccayā honti. santaṃ karoti, santārati, upakkamaṃ karoti, upakkamālati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 439
caggimāsīno

sandhi. and seated (next to a) fire [ca + aggiṃ + āsīno] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + masc + adj
Meaning and seated (next to a) fire
Construction ca + aggiṃ + āsīno
Commentary (MNa) na c'aggim'āsino'ti aggim'pi na upagato.
Sanskrit ca + agnim + āsīna

Example

sotatto sosinno c'eva,
eko bhiṃsanake vane,
naggo na c'aggim'āsīno,
esanāpasuto munī'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
caṅkama 1

masc. walking meditation; walking up and down (in meditation) [√kam + a + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from caṅkamati, intens
Meaning walking meditation; walking up and down (in meditation)
Root Family √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + kam + a > caṅkama (intens)
Construction caṅkama + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change k > c
m > ṅ
Sanskrit caṅkrama
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

so eko gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisati eko paṭikkamati eko raho nisīdati eko caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ

divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhessāma

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
caṅkama 2

masc. walking meditation path [√kam + a + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from caṅkamati, intens
Meaning walking meditation path
Root Family √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + kam + a > caṅkama (intens)
Construction caṅkama + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change k > c
m > ṅ
Sanskrit caṅkrama
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

ahaṃ middhena pakato,
vihārā upanikkhamiṃ,
caṅkamaṃ abhiruhanto,
tatth'eva papatiṃ chamā.

TH 187 bhaguttheragāthā

pañcadosavivajjitan'ti, pañc'ime caṅkamadosā nāma, thaddhavisamatā, antorukkhatā, gahanacchannatā, atisambādhatā, ativisālatā'ti.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
caṅkamati

pr. walks up and down; walks in meditation [√kam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intens of kamati, intrans
Meaning walks up and down; walks in meditation
Root Family √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + kam + a > caṅkama (intens)
Construction caṅkama + ti
Phonetic Change k > c
m > ṅ
Sanskrit caṅkramyate
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, ṭhitassa taṃ bhayabheravaṃ āgacchati. so kho ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, n'eva tāva caṅkamāmi na nisīdāmi na nipajjāmi. yāva ṭhito'va taṃ bhayabheravaṃ paṭivinemi.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

abbhāse vattamānassa kavaggassa cavaggo hoti. cikicchati, jigucchati, jighacchati, jigīsati, jaṅgamati, caṅkamati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 462
caṅkamana 1

nt. walking meditation path; lit. walking continuously [√kam + a + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from caṅkamati, intens
Meaning walking meditation path; lit. walking continuously
Root Family √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + kam + a > caṅkama (intens)
Construction caṅkama + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change k > c
m > ṅ
Sanskrit caṅkramaṇa
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Example

puthulato pana diyaḍḍharatanaṃ dvīsu passesu ratanamatt'ānucaṅkamaṃ dīghato saṭṭhihatthaṃ mudutalaṃ samavippakiṇṇavālukaṃ caṅkamaṃ vaṭṭati cetiyagirimhi dīpappasādakamahindattherassa caṅkamanaṃ viya, t'ādisaṃ taṃ ahosi.

TH 227 sopākattheragāthā

thaddhavisamabhūmibhāgasmiñ'hi caṅkame caṅkamantassa pādā rujjanti, phoṭā uṭṭhahanti, cittaṃ ekaggaṃ na labhati, kammaṭṭhānaṃ vipajjati.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
caṅkamamāna

prp. walking in meditation [√kam] ✗
caṅkamasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 14.15 (SN14.15) ✗
caṅkamasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.29 (AN5.29) ✗
caṅkamādhigata

adj. achieved by walking meditation; acquired on the walking path [caṅkama + adhigata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning achieved by walking meditation; acquired on the walking path
Construction caṅkama + adhigata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (caṅkamena + adhigata)
Commentary (ANa) caṅkamādhigato samādhī'ti caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhahantena adhigato aṭṭhannaṃ samāpattīnaṃ aññatarasamādhi.
Sanskrit caṅkrama + adhigata

Example

addhānakkhamo hoti, padhānakkhamo hoti, app'ābādho hoti, asitaṃ pītaṃ khāyitaṃ sāyitaṃ sammā pariṇāmaṃ gacchati, caṅkam'ādhigato samādhi ciraṭṭhitiko hoti. ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca caṅkame ānisaṃsā'ti.

AN 5.29 caṅkamasuttaṃ
caṅkami

aor. walked up and down; walked in meditation [√kam + a + i] ✓

Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam

Construction caṅkama + i
Phonetic Change k > c
m > ṅ
Sanskrit caṇkram
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Example

gattāni parimajjitvā,
puna'p'āruyha caṅkamaṃ,
caṅkame caṅkamiṃ so'haṃ,
ajjhattaṃ susamāhito.

Sanskrit catvara

Example

Construction caja + ti

Sanskrit tyajati
Sanskrit Root √tyaj 1 (forsake)

Examples

na kāmakāmā lapayanti santo,
sukhena phuṭṭhā atha vā dukhena,
na ucc'āvacaṃ paṇḍitā dassayanti.

passe ce vipulaṃ sukhaṃ,

dak'ābhisecanā te'pi,
pāpakammā pamuccare.

Sanskrit caṇḍa

Examples

caṇḍā kho, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā, pharusā kho, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā. sace taṃ, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā akkosissanti paribhāsissanti, tatra te, puṇṇa, kinti bhavissatī'ti?

THI 73 sumedhātherīgāthā
caṇḍāla 2

nt. trick; amusement; entertainment ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning trick; amusement; entertainment

Sanskrit caṇḍāla

Example

SN 47.19 sedakasuttaṃ
caṇḍālakumāraka

Sanskrit caṇḍāla + kumāraka

Example

Example

evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, caṇḍālakumārakacaṇḍālakumārikāsamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.

Sanskrit caṇḍāla + kula

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti, caṇḍālakule vā venakule vā nesādakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde app'annapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati.

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, caṇḍālavaṃsiko caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ ussāpetvā medakathālikaṃ antevāsiṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, samma medakathālike, caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ abhiruhitvā mama uparikhandhe tiṭṭhāhī'ti.

SN 47.19 sedakasuttaṃ
caṇḍālasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.175 (AN5.175) ✗
caṇḍālivimānavatthu

nt. Vimānavatthu 21 (VV 21) ✗
caṇḍālī

fem. caṇḍāla woman ✗
caṇḍikka

nt. ferocity ✗
caṇḍikkalakkhaṇa

adj. having the characteristic feature of fierceness; with the salient feature of temper ✗
caṇḍī

adj. aggressive; fierce; violent; savage; hostile; rude [√caṇḍ + a + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, fem of caṇḍa
Meaning aggressive; fierce; violent; savage; hostile; rude
Root Family √caṇḍ
Root √caṇḍ×1 a (be fierce, violent)
Construction √caṇḍ + a + ī
caṇḍa + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Commentary (MNa) caṇḍī'ti asoratā kibbisā. iti yattakā guṇā, tato diguṇā dosā uppajjiṃsu. guṇā nāma saṇikaṃ saṇikaṃ āgacchanti, dosā ekadivasen'eva patthaṭā honti.
Sanskrit caṇḍa
Sanskrit Root √caṇḍ 10 (be angry)

Example

atha kho, bhikkhave, vedehikāya gahapatāniyā aparena samayena evaṃ pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchi, caṇḍī vedehikā gahapatānī, anivātā vedehikā gahapatānī, anupasantā vedehikā gahapatānī'ti.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
caṇḍīkata

adj. angered, enraged; in a temper ✗
catasso

card. four (4) [catu + asso] ✓

Grammar card, fem nom and acc pl of catu
Meaning four (4)
Construction catu + asso
Sanskrit catasṛ

Examples

catasso imā, bhikkhave, paṭipadā. katamā catasso? dukkhā paṭipadā dandh'ābhiññā, dukkhā paṭipadā khipp'ābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā dandh'ābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā khipp'ābhiññā. imā kho, bhikkhave, catasso paṭipadā.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

disā catasso vidisā catasso,
uddhaṃ adho dasa disā imāyo,
na tuyhaṃ adiṭṭhaṃ asutaṃ amutaṃ,
atho aviññātaṃ kiñcanam'atthi loke,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16
catu

card. four (4) ✓

Grammar card, masc fem and nt pl
Meaning four (4)
Sanskrit catur

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yv'āyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā'ti.

SN 34.1 samādhimūlakasamāpattisuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ? cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ.

Example

Examples

so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, ye te goṭṭhā paṭṭhitagāvo apagatagopālakā, tattha catukkuṇḍiko upasaṅkamitvā yāni tāni vacchakānaṃ taruṇakānaṃ dhenupakānaṃ gomayāni tāni sudaṃ āhāremi.

abhijānām'ahaṃ, aggivessana, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto catugguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ paññapetvā dakkhiṇena passena sato sampajāno niddaṃ okkamitā'ti.

catutthī 1

fem. the fourth [catuttha + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from catuttha
Meaning the fourth
Construction catuttha + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Sanskrit caturthī

Example

puna caparaṃ, gahapati, bhikkhu mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthiṃ.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ
catutthī 2

catutthītappurisa

masc. (gram) case compound in the dative case ✗

Examples

padarūpasiddhi kārakakaṇḍa 305

catuddisa

nt. four directions; four quarters (of the compass) [catu + disā + a] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning four directions; four quarters (of the compass)
Construction catu + disā + a
catuddisā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound digu (catasso + disā)
Sanskrit caturdiśam

Examples

tayo lokā tilokaṃ, tayo daṇḍā tidaṇḍaṃ, tīṇi nayanāni tinayanaṃ, tayo siṅgā tisiṅgaṃ. catasso disā catuddisaṃ, pañca indriyāni pañc'indriyaṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 321

sīho, bhikkhave, migarājā sāyanhasamayaṃ āsayā nikkhamati. āsayā nikkhamitvā vijambhati. vijambhitvā samantā catuddisaṃ anuviloketi. samantā catuddisaṃ anuviloketvā tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ nadati. tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ naditvā gocarāya pakkamati.

AN 10.21 sīhanādasuttaṃ
catuddisā

fem. four directions; four quarters (of the compass) [catu + disā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning four directions; four quarters (of the compass)
Construction catu + disā
Compound digu (catasso + disā)
Sanskrit catu + diśā

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cattāro daḷhadhammā dhanuggahā susikkhitā katahatthā kat'ūpāsanā catuddisā ṭhitā assu.

SN 20.6 dhanuggahasuttaṃ

sīho, bhikkhave, migarājā sāyanhasamayaṃ āsayā nikkhamati. āsayā nikkhamitvā vijambhati. vijambhitvā samantā catuddisaṃ anuviloketi. samantā catuddisaṃ anuviloketvā tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ nadati. tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ naditvā gocarāya pakkamati.

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ? cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ.

Sanskrit catuṣpada

Examples

catuppado ahaṃ samma,
tvam'pi samma catuppado,
ehi samma nivattassu,
kiṃ nu bhīto palāyasi.

bhikkhu sato sapariyantacārī,
ḍaṃs'ādhipātānaṃ sarīsapānaṃ,
manussaphassānaṃ catuppadānaṃ.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
catuppada 3

adj. four footed; four-legged [catu + pada] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning four footed; four-legged
Construction catu + pada
Compound kammadhāraya (catu + pada)
Antonym apada, dvipada, bahupada
Variant catuppāda
Commentary (ANa) catuppadā'ti hatthiass'ādayo.
Sanskrit catuṣpada

Examples

yāvatā, bhikkhave, sattā apadā vā dvipadā vā catuppadā vā bahuppadā vā rūpino vā arūpino vā saññino vā asaññino vā n'evasaññin'āsaññino vā, tathāgato tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho.

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ

apādakehi me mettaṃ,
mettaṃ dvipādakehi me,
catuppadehi me mettaṃ,
mettaṃ bahuppadehi me.

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ

Example

catubbidhavacīkammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikāhetu vā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjanti

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
catubbidhavacīkammantasandosabyāpattiakusalasañcetanikāhetu

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
catubbipallāsavasa

masc. power of the four inversions; influence of the four hallucinations [catu + vipallāsa + vasa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning power of the four inversions; influence of the four hallucinations
Construction catu + vipallāsa + vasa

Sanskrit catur + viparyāsa + vaśa

Example

catubbipallāsavasaṃ adhiṭṭhitaṃ,
gāmaṇḍalaṃ'va parinesi citta maṃ,
nanu saṃyojanabandhanacchidaṃ,
saṃsevase kāruṇikaṃ mahāmuniṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
catubbīsati

card. twenty four (24) [catu + vīsati] ✓

Grammar card, fem sg, comp
Meaning twenty four (24)
Construction catu + [r] + vīsati
Phonetic Change +r
urv > ubb
Sanskrit catur + viṃśati

Example

imehi kho, sāriputta, sattahi niddasavatthūhi samannāgato bhikkhu dvādasa ce'pi vassāni paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carati, niddaso bhikkhū'ti alaṃ vacanāya, catubbīsati ce'pi vassāni paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carati, niddaso bhikkhūti alaṃ vacanāya,

AN 7.42 paṭhamaniddasasuttaṃ
catubbhāga

masc. fourth part; quarter ✗
catubbhi

card. with four; by four [catu + ūbhi] ✓

Grammar card, masc fem and nt instr pl of catu
Meaning with four; by four
Construction catu + ūbhi
Variant catuhi, catūhi
Sanskrit catubhiḥ

Example

yath'indakhīlo pathavissito siyā,
catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo,
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi,
yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

cūḷavaggo 1

Construction catu + bhāga
Compound digu (cattāro + bhāgo)
Commentary (VINa) catubhāgaṃ khādanan'ti odanassa catutthabhāgappamāṇaṃ khādanaṃ, taṃ hatthahāriyassa muggasūpassa vasena veditabbaṃ.
Sanskrit caturbhāga

Examples

ukkaṭṭho nāma patto aḍḍh'āḷhak'odanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.1 pattasikkhāpadaṃ

majjhimo nāma patto nāḷik'odanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.1 pattasikkhāpadaṃ
catubhāgameti

sandhi. is worth a quarter; lit. comes to a fourth part [catu + bhāgaṃ + eti] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + masc + pr
Meaning is worth a quarter; lit. comes to a fourth part
Construction catu + bhāgaṃ + eti
Sanskrit catur + bhāga + eti

Example

yaṃ kiñci yiṭṭhaṃ va hutaṃ va loke,
saṃvaccharaṃ yajetha puññapekkho,
sabbam'pi taṃ na catubhāgam'eti,
abhivādanā ujugatesu seyyo.

DHP 108 sahassavaggo
catubhūmaka

adj. having four storeys or stages ✗
catumaṭṭhajātaka

nt. Jātaka 187 (JA 187) ✗
catumadhura

nt. four sweets, ghee, honey, sugar and sesemum oil ✗
catumahāpatha

masc. four-way intersection; crossroads; meeting of four great roads [catu + mahāpatha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning four-way intersection; crossroads; meeting of four great roads
Construction catu + mahāpatha
Compound digu (cattāro + mahapathā)
Variant cātumahāpatha, cātummahāpatha
Commentary (ANa) catumahāpathe'ti dvinnaṃ mahāmaggānaṃ vinivijjhitvā gataṭṭhāne.
Sanskrit caturmahāpatha

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, subhūmiyaṃ catumahāpathe ājaññaratho yutto assa ṭhito odhastapatodo.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā gāviṃ vadhitvā catumahāpathe bilaso vibhajitvā nisinno assa

DN 22.6 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
catumahāpadesakathā

fem. discussion about the four great references ✗
catumahārājasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.37 (AN3.37) ✗
catumāsa

nt. season; four months [catu + māsa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning season; four months
Construction catu + māsa
Compound digu (cattāro + māsā)
Variant catummāsa, cātumāsa
Sanskrit caturmāsa

Examples

agilānena bhikkhunā catumāsappaccayapavāraṇā sāditabbā aññatra punapavāraṇāya, aññatra niccapavāraṇāya. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 47 mahānāmasikkhāpadaṃ

gāmo nāma ekakuṭiko'pi gāmo, dvikuṭiko'pi gāmo, tikuṭiko'pi gāmo, catukuṭiko'pi gāmo, samanusso'pi gāmo, amanusso'pi gāmo, parikkhitto'pi gāmo, aparikkhitto'pi gāmo, gonisādiniviṭṭho'pi gāmo, yo'pi sattho atirekacatumāsaniviṭṭho so'pi vuccati gāmo.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
catumāsattha

masc. (+gen) sake of four months (of); purpose of four months (of) [catumāsa + attha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+gen)
Meaning sake of four months (of); purpose of four months (of)
Construction catumāsa + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (catumāsassa + attha)
Sanskrit caturmāsa + artha

Example

vassikasāṭikā nāma vassānassa catumās'atthāya.

agilānena bhikkhunā catumāsappaccayapavāraṇā sāditabbā aññatra punapavāraṇāya, aññatra niccapavāraṇāya. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

catur

ind. four (4) [catu + [r]] ✓

Grammar ind, card, in comps, masc fem and nt pl
Meaning four (4)
Construction catu + [r] > catur
Phonetic Change +r
Sanskrit catur

Example

sāmantā sugatavidatthi ādātabbā dubbaṇṇakaraṇāyā'ti thirabhāvāya vaṭṭaṃ vā caturassaṃ vā chinditvā ekadese vā santharitabbaṃ vijaṭetvā vā santharitabbaṃ.

VIN 1.4.2.5 nisīdanasanthatasikkhāpadaṃ
catura

adj. clever, skilled, shrewd [cāṭu] ✗
caturaṅga

nt. four factors; four parts [catu + aṅga] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning four factors; four parts
Construction catu + [r] + aṅga
Phonetic Change +r
Compound digu (cattāri + aṅgāni)
Sanskrit caturaṅga

Example

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, caturaṅgasamannāgataṃ brahmacariyaṃ caritā, tapassī su'daṃ homi paramatapassī, lūkho su'daṃ homi paramalūkho, jegucchī su'daṃ homi paramajegucchī, pavivitto su'daṃ homi paramapavivitto.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
caturaṅgika

adj. consisting of four divisions ✗
caturaṅginisenā

fem. army consisting of four divisions [caturaṅgini + senā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning army consisting of four divisions
Construction caturaṅgini + senā
caturaṅgī

adj. (of an army) consisting of four divisions; (comm) elephants, cavalry, chariots and infantry [catu + aṅga + inī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of an army) consisting of four divisions; (comm) elephants, cavalry, chariots and infantry
Construction catu + [r] + aṅga + inī
caturaṅga + inī
Phonetic Change +r
Compound kammadhāraya (catu + aṅgī)
Commentary (SNa) catur'aṅginin'ti hatthi-assa-ratha-patti-saṅkhātehi catūhi aṅgehi samannāgataṃ.
Sanskrit catur + aṅgin

Examples

yasmiṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, padese cakkaratanaṃ patiṭṭhāsi, tattha rājā cakkavattī vāsaṃ upagacchi saddhiṃ catur'aṅginiyā senāya

DN 26.4 cakkavattisuttaṃ

assosi kho rājā pasenadi kosalo, rājā kira māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto catur'aṅginiṃ senaṃ sannayhitvā mamaṃ abbhuyyāto yena kāsī'ti.

SN 3.14 paṭhamasaṅgāmasuttaṃ
caturaṅgula

adj. measuring four fingers; four fingers long [catu + aṅgula] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning measuring four fingers; four fingers long
Construction catu + [r] + aṅgula
Phonetic Change +r
Compound kammadhāraya (catu + aṅgula)
Sanskrit caturaṅguliḥ

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso yaṃ imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ taṃ chetvā ekajjhaṃ saṃharitvā caturaṅgulaṃ caturaṅgulaṃ ghaṭikaṃ katvā nikkhipeyya

SN 15.1 tiṇakaṭṭhasuttaṃ

vuṭṭhamhi deve caturaṅgule tiṇe,
saṃpupphite meghanibhamhi kānane,
nag'antare viṭapisamo sayissaṃ,
taṃ me mudū hehiti tūlasannibhaṃ.

VIN 1.4.2.5 nisīdanasanthatasikkhāpadaṃ
caturassa 2

adj. four-sided; square; rectangular [catu + assa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning four-sided; square; rectangular
Construction catu + [r] + assa
Phonetic Change +r
Compound kammadhāraya (catu + assa)
Sanskrit caturaśra

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, same bhūmibhāge caturassā pokkharaṇī assa āḷibandhā pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āḷiṃ muñceyya āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
caturassa 3

adj. (sutta) which discusses the qualities of the bad cowherd and the bad monk, the good cowherd and the good monk; lit. four corners [catu + assa] ~

Construction catu + [r] + assa
Phonetic Change +r
Commentary (ANa) apaṇḍitagopālakaṃ dassetvā, apaṇḍitabhikkhuṃ dassetvā, paṇḍitagopālakaṃ dassetvā, paṇḍitabhikkhuṃ dassetvā'ti catukkaṃ bandhitvā kathanaṃ caturassā nāma.
Notes three kinds of discourses 1. ekanāḷika, 2. caturassa, 3. nisinnavattika
Sanskrit caturaśra
caturassaka

Compound kammadhāraya (catu + aṃsa)
Sanskrit catur + aṃsa

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, same bhūmibhāge pokkharaṇī caturaṃsā ālibaddhā pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āliṃ muñceyya, āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ
caturādhiṭṭhāna

adj. with four bases; having four foundations; established in four things [caturo + adhiṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with four bases; having four foundations; established in four things
Construction caturo + adhiṭṭhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (caturo + adhiṭṭhāna)
Sanskrit caturaḥ + adhiṣṭhāna

Examples

chadhāturo ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso chaphass'āyatano aṭṭhārasamano'pavicāro catur'ādhiṭṭhāno, yattha ṭhitaṃ maññ'assavā nappavattanti, maññ'assave kho pana nappavattamāne muni santo'ti vuccati.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

catur'ādhiṭṭhāno ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? paññ'ādhiṭṭhāno, sacc'ādhiṭṭhāno, cāg'ādhiṭṭhāno, upasam'ādhiṭṭhāno.

caturāsīti

card. eighty four (84) [catu + asīti] ✓

Grammar card, fem sg, comp
Meaning eighty four (84)
Construction catu + [r] + asīti
Phonetic Change +r

Variant cūḷāsīti, cullāsīti
Sanskrit caturaśīti

Examples

alatthuṃ kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipāṇasahassāni vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṃ alatthuṃ upasampadaṃ

DN 14.4 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bodhisatto aparena samayena eko gaṇamhā vūpakaṭṭho vihāsi, aññen'eva tāni caturāsīti pabbajitasahassāni agamaṃsu, aññena maggena vipassī bodhisatto.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
caturāsītinagarasahassāni

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
caturāsītipabbajitasahassa

nt. eighty four thousand renunciates ✗
caturāsītipallaṅkasahassāni

nt. eighty four thousand couches [caturāsīti + pallaṅka + sahassa + āni] ✓

Grammar nt pl, comp
Meaning eighty four thousand couches

caturāsītipallaṅkasahassa + āni
Compound digu (caturāsītipallaṅka + sahassa)
Sanskrit caturaśīti + palyaṅka + sahasra

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītipallaṅkasahassāni ahesuṃ dantamayāni sāramayāni sovaṇṇamayāni goṇak'atthatāni paṭik'atthatāni paṭalik'atthatāni kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇāni sauttaracchadāni ubhatolohitak'ūpadhānāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
caturāsītipāṇasahassa

nt. eighty four thousand beings ✗
caturāsītipāsādasahassāni

Construction caturāsīti + pāsāda + sahassa + āni
caturāsītipāsādasahassa + āni
Compound digu (caturāsītipāsāda + sahassa)
Sanskrit caturaśīti + prāsāda + sahasra

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītipāsādasahassāni ahesuṃ dhammapāsādappamukhāni.

caturitthivimānavatthu

nt. Vimānavatthu 45 (VV 45) ✗
caturo

card. four (4) [catu + o] ✓

Grammar card, masc nom and acc pl of catu
Meaning four (4)
Construction catu + [r] + o
Phonetic Change +r
Sanskrit caturaḥ, caturam

Examples

maggān'aṭṭh'aṅgiko seṭṭho,
saccānaṃ caturo padā,
virāgo seṭṭho dhammānaṃ,
dvipadānañ'ca cakkhumā.

DHP 273 maggavaggo

paññaṃ purakkhatvā kalyāṇapīti,
vikkhambhaye tāni parissayāni,
aratiṃ sahetha sayanamhi pante,
caturo sahetha paridevadhamme.

saddho mudū saṃvibhāgī vadaññū,
etesu dhammesu ṭhito catūsu,
dhamme ṭhito paralokaṃ na bhāye'ti.

catta

pp. given up; abandoned; left behind [√caj + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of cajati
Meaning given up; abandoned; left behind
Root Family √caj
Root √caj･1 a (give up, let go)
√ In Comps ccaj
Construction √caj + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change j > t
Sanskrit tyakta
Sanskrit Root √tyaj 1 (forsake)

Example

yathodhi kho pan'assa cattaṃ hoti vantaṃ muttaṃ pahīnaṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, so buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgatomhī'ti labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamm'ūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
cattāri ariyasaccāni

idiom. four noble truths ✗
cattāri 1

card. four (4) [catu + āri] ✓

Grammar card, nt nom pl of catu
Meaning four (4)
Construction catu + āri
Sanskrit catūni

Examples

imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī'ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṃkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī'ti. iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttan'ti.

AN 3.62 titthāyatanādisuttaṃ

katamo c'āvuso, rūp'upādānakkhandho? cattāri ca mahābhūtāni, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ.

Grammar card, nt acc pl of catu
Meaning four (4)
Construction catu + āri
Sanskrit catūni

Examples

cattāri ṭhānāni naro pamatto,
āpajjati paradār'ūpasevī,
apuññalābhaṃ na nikāmaseyyaṃ,
nindaṃ tatīyaṃ nirayaṃ catutthaṃ.

DHP 309 nirayavaggo

yo ca buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca,
saṅghañ'ca saraṇaṃ gato,
cattāri ariyasaccāni,
sammappaññāya passati.

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ

dasa'pi, bhante, purisā, vīsam'pi, bhante, purisā, tiṃsam'pi, bhante, purisā, cattārīsam'pi, bhante, purisā, paññāsam'pi, bhante, purisā nappahonti yāvatikā imissā nāḷandāya pāṇā te ekena khaṇena ekena muhuttena ekaṃ maṃsakhalaṃ ekaṃ maṃsapuñjaṃ kātuṃ.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ? cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ.

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ
cattālīsaaviraḷadantalakkhaṇāni

nt. auspicious marks of having forty teeth and gapless teeth [cattālīsā + aviraḷadanta + lakkhaṇa + āni] ~

Grammar nt pl, comp
Meaning auspicious marks of having forty teeth and gapless teeth
Construction cattālīsā + aviraḷadanta + lakkhaṇa + āni
cattālīsaaviraḷadantalakkhaṇa + āni
cattālīsaka

nt. group of 40 ✗
cattālīsati

card. forty (40) ✗
cattālīsadanta

adj. with forty teeth; twenty-third of the thirty-two marks of a great man [cattālīsā + danta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with forty teeth; twenty-third of the thirty-two marks of a great man
Construction cattālīsā + danta
Compound kammadhāraya (cattālīsā + danta)
Commentary (MNa) cattālīsadanto'tiādīsu uparimahanuke patiṭṭhitā vīsati, heṭṭhime vīsatīti cattālīsa dantā assā'ti cattālīsadanto.
Sanskrit catvāriṃśat + danta, catvāriṃśaddanta (bsk)

Example

cattālīsadanto kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

2. akkharā'p'ādayo ekacattālīsaṃ.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa

Sanskrit tyakta +
Sanskrit Root √tyaj 1 (forsake)
cattāḷisā

card. forty (40) ✗
cattāḷīsā

card. forty; 40 ✗

catthāya

sandhi. (+gen) and for the purpose (of); and for the sake (of); and for the good (of) [ca + atthāya] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + masc (+gen)
Meaning and for the purpose (of); and for the sake (of); and for the good (of)
Construction ca + atthāya
Sanskrit ca + arthatas

Example

te upārambh'ānisaṃsā c'eva dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti itivādappamokkh'ānisaṃsā ca. yassa c'atthāya dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti tañ'c'assa atthaṃ n'ānubhonti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
catthi

sandhi. and there is [ca + atthi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pr
Meaning and there is
Construction ca + atthi
Sanskrit ca + asti

Example

supupphit'aggaṃ upagamma bhikkhuni,
ekā tuvaṃ tiṭṭhasi sālamūle,
na c'atthi te dutiyā vaṇṇadhātu,
bāle na tvaṃ bhāyasi dhuttakānan'ti.

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ
cana

suffix. particle used to express a portion of a whole: kudācana, sometimes ✗
canaṃ

suffix. particle used to express a portion of a whole: kudācana, sometimes ✗
canekāyatanappavutto

sandhi. and with many bases (has been) proclaimed [ca + aneka + āyatana + pavutto] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adj + nt + pp
Meaning and with many bases (has been) proclaimed
Construction ca + aneka + āyatana + pavutto
Commentary (SNa) maggo c'anek'āyatanappavutto'ti aṭṭhatiṃs'ārammaṇavasena anekehi kāraṇehi kathito.
Sanskrit ca + aneka + āyatana + prayukta

Example

kiṃsū'dha bhītā janatā anekā,
maggo c'anek'āyatanappavutto,
pucchāmi taṃ gotama bhūripañña,
kismiṃ ṭhito paralokaṃ na bhāye'ti.

SN 1.75 bhītāsuttaṃ
cantalikkhasmiṃ

sandhi. and in the sky; also in the air [ca + antalikkhasmiṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + nt
Meaning and in the sky; also in the air
Construction ca + antalikkhasmiṃ
Commentary (SNa) c'antalikkhasmiṃ pabhāsavaṇṇā'ti ye antalikkhe cand'obhāsa-sūriy'obhāsa-sañjhārāga-indadhanu-tārakarūpānaṃ pabhāsavaṇṇā.
Sanskrit ca + antarikṣe

Example

ye keci rūpā idha vā huraṃ vā,
ye c'antalikkhasmiṃ pabhāsavaṇṇā,
sabb'eva te te namucippasatthā,
āmisaṃ'va macchānaṃ vadhāya khittā'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
canda 1

masc. moon [√cand + a] ✓

Meaning moon
Root Family √cand
Root √cand×1 a (glow, be bright)
Construction √cand + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym candima
Sanskrit candra

Examples

candaṃ'va vimalaṃ suddhaṃ,
vippasannam'anāvilaṃ,
nandībhavaparikkhīṇaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 413 brāhmaṇavaggo

tathāgataṃ arahantaṃ,
candimā saraṇaṃ gato,
rāhu candaṃ pamuñcassu,
buddhā lok'ānukampakā'ti.

sabbā disā sappuriso pavāyati.

dibbāni'pi candanacuṇṇāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṃ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.

masc. name of a layman ✓

Meaning name of a layman

AN 9.26 silāyūpasuttaṃ
candima 1

masc. moon; lit. bright [√cand + ima] ✓

Sanskrit Root √cand √ścand 1 (shine)

Examples

tasmā hi
dhīrañ'ca paññañ'ca bahussutañ'ca,
dhorayhasīlaṃ vatavantam'ariyaṃ,
taṃ t'ādisaṃ sappurisaṃ sumedhaṃ,
bhajetha nakkhattapathaṃ'va candimā.

DHP 208 sukhavaggo

yo ca pubbe pamajjitvā,
pacchā so nappamajjati,
so'maṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti,
abbhā mutto'va candimā.

candobhāsa

masc. light of the moon; moon's radiance [canda + obhāsa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning light of the moon; moon's radiance
Construction canda + obhāsa
Commentary (ANa) obhāsanavasena cando'va cand'obhāso.
caparaṃ

sandhi. and further; and what is more [ca + paraṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adv
Meaning and further; and what is more
Construction ca + paraṃ
Sanskrit ca + param

Examples

puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā purime ca pāde saṃharitvā pacchime ca pāde saṃharitvā tatth'eva cattāro pāde abhinisīdati.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ
capala

adj. unsteady; wavering; fickle; moving to and fro [pa + √cal + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning unsteady; wavering; fickle; moving to and fro
Root Family pa √cal
Root √cal･1 a (shake, tremble)
Construction pa + √cal > capal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change pa + √cal > capal (metathesis)
Antonym acapala
Commentary (SNa) capalā'ti pattacīvaramaṇḍan'ādinā cāpallena yuttā.
Sanskrit capala
Sanskrit Root √cal 1 (stir)

Examples

phandanaṃ capalaṃ cittaṃ,
dūrakkhaṃ dunnivārayaṃ,
ujuṃ karoti medhāvī,
usukāro'va tejanaṃ.

DHP 33 cittavaggo

ayoniso manasikārā,
maṇḍanaṃ anuyuñjisaṃ,
uddhato capalo c'āsiṃ,
kāmarāgena aṭṭito.

TH 139 nandattheragāthā
capalatā

fem. fickleness [pa + √cal] ✗
capalī

adj. disrespectful term of address; lit. fickle person [pa + √cal + a + ī] ~

Grammar adj, from capala
Meaning disrespectful term of address; lit. fickle person
Root Family pa √cal
Root √cal･1 a (shake, tremble)
Construction pa + √cal > capal + a + ī
capala + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change pa + √cal > capal (metathesis)
Variant vasala, vasalī, vasali
Sanskrit capala
Sanskrit Root √cal 1 (stir)
capucapu

ind. chomping sound; munching sound; lip-smacking sound [capu + capu] ✓

Grammar ind, onom
Meaning chomping sound; munching sound; lip-smacking sound
Construction capu + capu
Sanskrit cuścuṣā, cuccu (bsk)

Example

na capucapukārakaṃ bhuñjissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 50 capucapukārakasikkhāpadaṃ
capucapukārakasikkhāpada

nt. Sekhiya 50; lit. rule about making a chomping sound [capucapukāraka + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Sekhiya 50; lit. rule about making a chomping sound
Construction capucapukāraka + sikkhāpada
capucapukārakaṃ

ind. making a chomping sound; munching loudly; smacking the lips; lit. making capucapu sound [capucapu + kāraka + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of capucapukāraka
Meaning making a chomping sound; munching loudly; smacking the lips; lit. making capucapu sound
Construction capucapu + kāraka + aṃ
capucapukāraka + aṃ
Commentary (VINa) capucapukārakan'ti capu capū'ti evaṃ saddaṃ katvā katvā.
Sanskrit cuścuṣā + kāraka, cuccukārakam (bsk)

Examples

na capucapukārakaṃ bhuñjissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 50 capucapukārakasikkhāpadaṃ

na capucapukārakaṃ bhuñjitabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca capucapukārakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

campā

fem. name of a town in Aṅga ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a town in Aṅga
Commentary (MNa) campāyan'ti evaṃnāmake nagare. tassa hi nagarassa ārāmapokkharaṇī'ādīsu tesu tesu ṭhānesu campakarukkhā'va ussannā ahesuṃ, tasmā campā'ti saṅkham'agamāsi.
Sanskrit campā

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā campāyaṃ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.

campeyyajātaka

nt. Jātaka 506 (JA 506) ✗
camma 1

nt. inner skin; skin ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning inner skin; skin
Sanskrit carman

Examples

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṭṭhañ'ca paṭicca valliñ'ca paṭicca tiṇañ'ca paṭicca mattikañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito agāraṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati, evam'eva kho, āvuso, aṭṭhiñ'ca paṭicca nhāruñ'ca paṭicca maṃsañ'ca paṭicca cammañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito rūpaṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

tassa sīghena javena dhāvato chavim'pi ḍayhati, cammam'pi ḍayhati, maṃsam'pi ḍayhati, nhārum'pi ḍayhati, aṭṭhīni'pi sampadhūpāyanti, ubbhataṃ t'ādisam'eva hoti.

camma 4

cammayodhī

masc. armored warrior; knight; (comm) (or) who carries a shield; lit. leather soldier [camma + yodhī] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning armored warrior; knight; (comm) (or) who carries a shield; lit. leather soldier
Construction camma + yodhī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (cammena + yodhī)
Commentary (ANa) cammayodhino'ti ye cammakañcukaṃ vā pavisitvā saraparittāṇacammaṃ vā gahetvā yujjhanti.
Sanskrit carman + yodhin

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño paccantime nagare bahubalakāyo paṭivasati, seyyath'idaṃ, hatth'ārohā ass'ārohā rathikā dhanuggahā celakā calakā piṇḍadāyakā uggā rājaputtā pakkhandino mahānāgā sūrā cammayodhino dāsakaputtā.

cammasāṭakajātaka

nt. Jātaka 324 (JA 324) ✗
camhi 1

Meaning and I am
Construction ca + amhi
Sanskrit ca + asmi

Example

so ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhugaṇassa majjhe vikatthati, bhuttāvī c'amhi yāva'd'attho, nimantito c'amhi svātanāya, piṇḍapāto ca my'āyaṃ pūro, lābhī c'amhi cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
camhi 2

sandhi. but I am [ca + amhi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning but I am
Construction ca + amhi
Sanskrit ca + asmi

Example

imesu khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu na kiñci attaṃ vā attaniyaṃ vā samanupassāmi, na c'amhi arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo, api ca me, āvuso, pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu asmī'ti adhigataṃ, ayam'aham'asmī'ti na ca samanupassāmī'ti.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
caya 1

masc. heap; pile; assortment [√ci + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from cināti
Meaning heap; pile; assortment
Root Family √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)

Phonetic Change i > ay
Sanskrit caya

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, bālo abyatto akusalo sūdo rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattaṃ vā nānaccayehi sūpehi paccupaṭṭhito assa.

patilīnacarassa bhikkhuno,
bhajamānassa vivittam'āsanaṃ,
sāmaggiyam'āhu tassa taṃ,
yo attānaṃ bhavane na dassaye.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
cara 2

imp. (+acc) go on!; begone!; run along! [√car + a] ✓

Meaning go on!; begone!; run along!
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (move, walk)
Construction √car + a
Sanskrit cara
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Examples

ajja't'agge te, āvuso, samaṇ'uddesa na c'eva so bhagavā satthā apadisitabbo, yam'pi c'aññe samaṇ'uddesā labhanti bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ dirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ, sā'pi te n'atthi, cara'pi re, vinassā'ti.

VIN PAT PC 70 kaṇṭakasikkhāpadaṃ

micchāpaṭipanno tvam'asi, aham'asmi sammāpaṭipanno. sahitaṃ me, asahitaṃ te. purevacanīyaṃ pacchā avaca, pacchāvacanīyaṃ pure avaca. adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattaṃ. āropito te vādo, cara vādappamokkhāya. niggahito'si, nibbeṭhehi vā sace pahosī'ti.

SN 56.9 viggāhikakathāsuttaṃ

masc. spy; lit. going around [√car + a] ✓

Construction √car + a

Sanskrit cara

Example

ete, bhante, mama purisā carā ocarakā janapadaṃ ocaritvā āgacchanti. tehi paṭhamaṃ ociṇṇaṃ ahaṃ pacchā osāpayissāmi.

Examples

yā vutti vinipātena,
adhammacaraṇena vā.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo
caraṇa 1.2

adj. having such behaviour; with such conduct; lit. behaving [√car + aṇa] ~

Grammar adj, in comps, from carati
Meaning having such behaviour; with such conduct; lit. behaving
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction √car + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Sanskrit caraṇa
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)
caraṇa 2.1

nt. animation; moving picture; (comm) artwork which was carried around; lit. moving [√car + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, from carati
Meaning animation; moving picture; (comm) artwork which was carried around; lit. moving
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (move, walk)
Construction √car + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Commentary (SNa) caraṇaṃ nāma cittan'ti vicaraṇacittaṃ. saṅkhā nāma brāhmaṇapāsaṇḍikā honti, te paṭakoṭṭhakaṃ katvā tattha nānappakārā sugatiduggativasena sampattivipattiyo lekhāpetvā, imaṃ kammaṃ katvā idaṃ paṭilabhati, idaṃ katvā idan'ti dassentā taṃ cittaṃ gahetvā vicaranti.
Sanskrit caraṇa
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

diṭṭhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, caraṇaṃ nāma cittan'ti? evaṃ, bhante. tam'pi kho, bhikkhave, caraṇaṃ nāma cittaṃ citten'eva cittitaṃ. tena'pi kho, bhikkhave, caraṇena cittena cittaññ'eva cittataraṃ.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
caraṇa 2.2

nt. foot; lit. moving [√car + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, from carati
Meaning foot; lit. moving
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (move, walk)
Construction √car + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Commentary (ANa) caraṇā nāgassa ty'āpare'ti te buddhanāgassa apare dve pacchimapādā.
Sanskrit caraṇa
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

sati ca sampajaññañ'ca,
caraṇā nāgassa tepare,
saddhāhattho mahānāgo,
upekkhāsetadantavā.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā
caraṇa 2.3

nt. going; walking; moving about; lit. moving [√car + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from carati
Meaning going; walking; moving about; lit. moving
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (move, walk)
Construction √car + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Sanskrit caraṇa
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

paṭipadāya na saṇṭhātī'ti paṭipattiyaṃ na tiṭṭhati, vattaṃ ajānitvā apucchitabbaṭṭhāne pucchatī'ti attho. ayaṃ pañho nāma cetiy'aṅgaṇe pucchitena na kathetabbo, tathā bhikkhācāramagge gāmaṃ piṇḍāya caraṇakāle.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā
caraṇagilāna

adj. suffering from foot disease; lit. going illness [caraṇa + gilāna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning suffering from foot disease; lit. going illness
Construction caraṇa + gilāna
Commentary (VINa) caraṇagilānā'ti pādarogena samannāgatā. (PYt) carati anenā'ti caraṇaṃ pādo, tasmiṃ uṭṭhito gilāno etissā'ti caraṇagilānā'ti dassento āha pādarogena samannāgatā'ti.
caraṇavant

adj. moral; of good behaviour; of good conduct; lit. having behaviour quality [√car + aṇa + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from caraṇa
Meaning moral; of good behaviour; of good conduct; lit. having behaviour quality
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction √car + aṇa + vant
caraṇa + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Sanskrit caraṇavat
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Examples

kiṃ pattinam'āhu sottiyaṃ,
ariyaṃ kena kathañ'ca caraṇavā'ti.
paribbājako kin'ti nāma hoti,
puṭṭho me bhagavā byākarohi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

yo idha caraṇesu pattipatto,
kusalo sabbadā ājānāti dhammaṃ,
sabbattha na sajjati vimuttacitto,
paṭighā yassa na santi caraṇavā so.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
caraṇavanta

adj. of good conduct ✗
caraṇavipanna

adj. whose behaviour is wrong; failing in good conduct ✗
caraṇasampadā

fem. successful attainment of ethical conduct; fulfilment of morality ✗
caraṇasampanna

adj. endowed with conduct; accomplished in action; perfect in moral conduct [caraṇa + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning endowed with conduct; accomplished in action; perfect in moral conduct
Construction caraṇa + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (caraṇena + sampanna)
Commentary (MNa) caraṇasampanno iti'pī'ti pañcadasahi dhammehi caraṇasampanno iti'pi.
Sanskrit caraṇa + sampanna

Example

ayaṃ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako vijjāsampanno iti'pi caraṇasampanno iti'pi vijjācaraṇasampanno iti'pi.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ
caraṇā

fem. wandering [√car] ✗
caraṇūpapanna

adj. having good conduct [caraṇa + upapanna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having good conduct
Construction caraṇa + upapanna
Commentary (ANa) caraṇ'ūpapannesū'ti pañcadasahi caraṇadhammehi samannāgatesu.
caraṇenantakara

adj. who makes an end through ethical conduct; lit. end making by behaviour [caraṇena + antakara] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who makes an end through ethical conduct; lit. end making by behaviour
Construction caraṇena + antakara
carati 1.1

pr. (+acc) walks; wanders; goes around; travels; fares on [√car + a + ti] ✓

Base √car + a > cara
Construction cara + ti
Sanskrit carati
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Examples

paccati munino bhattaṃ,
thokaṃ thokaṃ kule kule,
piṇḍikāya carissāmi,
atthi jaṅghābalaṃ mamā'ti.

ye ca kho keci kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti manasā duccaritaṃ caranti tesaṃ appiyo attā

visenikatvā pana ye caranti,
diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,
tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra,
yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.

aṭṭhakavaggo 8

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
carapire

sandhi. just go!; begone with you!; away with you! [cara + api + re] ✓

Meaning just go!; begone with you!; away with you!
Construction cara + api + re
Sanskrit cara + api + re

Example

ajja't'agge te, āvuso, samaṇ'uddesa na c'eva so bhagavā satthā apadisitabbo, yam'pi c'aññe samaṇ'uddesā labhanti bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ dirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ, sā'pi te n'atthi, cara'pi re, vinassā'ti.

caravagga

Sanskrit tarhi + āyusmanto

Example

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
carahi

ind. then; therefore; now ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning then; therefore; now
Sanskrit tarhi

Examples

handa carahi te, mārisa, passa antaradhāyāmī'ti. handa carahi me tvaṃ, brahme, antaradhāyassu, sace visahasī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

te ce n'ātariṃsu yājayogā,
yaññehi jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
atha ko carahi devamanussaloke,
atāri jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

Antonym acaritvā

Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

eko pubbe caritvāna,

hīnam'āhu puthujjanaṃ.

SNP 45 tissametteyyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 7

Meaning last; final; end
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (move, walk)
Construction √car + a + ima
cara + ima
Derivative taddhita (ima)
Antonym pubba
Sanskrit carama
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

ahañ'c'amhi adhammiko, yo'haṃ itthiyā kāraṇā rañño ambaṃ avaharāmi. sabbam'idaṃ carimaṃ katan'ti tatth'eva paripati.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo
carimaka

adj. last; final [√car + a + ima + ka] ✓

Meaning last; final

Root √car･1 a (move, walk)

carima + ka

Synonym pacchima, pariyanta
Sanskrit carama
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

evaṃ bhāvitāya, rāhula, ānāpānassatiyā, evaṃ bahulīkatāya ye'pi te carimakā assāsā te'pi viditā'va nirujjhanti no aviditā'ti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 7

anagāriy'upetassa,
bhikkhācariyaṃ jigīsato,
muni pabrūhi me puṭṭho,
moneyyaṃ uttamaṃ padaṃ.

Construction cariyā + anuyoga
cariyāpiṭaka

nt. Book 13 of the Khuddaka Nikāya; The Basket of Conduct ✗
cariyāpiṭakaaṭṭhakathā

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning commentary to the Cariyāpiṭaka
Construction cariyāpiṭaka + aṭṭhakathā
cariyāvidhānasahita

adj. complete with the rules of conduct ✗

Meaning distinction in conduct

care

opt. should go about; should lead (one’s life); should conduct oneself [√car + e] ✓

Grammar opt of carati, intrans
Meaning should go about; should lead (one’s life); should conduct oneself
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction √car + e
Sanskrit caret
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Examples

sīlabbataṃ v'āpi pahāya sabbaṃ,
kammañ'ca sāvajj'anavajjam'etaṃ,
suddhiṃ asuddhin'ti apatthayāno,
virato care santim'anuggahāya.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13

adhisīlaṃ adhicittaṃ,
adhipaññañ'ca vīriyavā,
thāmavā dhitimā jhāyī,
sato guttindriyo care.

AN 3.91 dutiya sikkhattayasuttaṃ
cala

adj. unsteady; unstable; shaky; fickle [√cal + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from calati
Meaning unsteady; unstable; shaky; fickle
Root Family √cal
Root √cal･1 a (shake, tremble)
Construction √cal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym acala
Sanskrit cala
Sanskrit Root √cal 1 (stir)

Examples

mam'eva etaṃ na hi tvaṃ paresaṃ,
sannāhakāle paridevitena kiṃ,
sabbaṃ idaṃ calam'iti pekkhamāno,
abhinikkhamiṃ amatapadaṃ jigīsaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

cakkhu aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi. rūpā aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino. itth'etaṃ dvayaṃ calañ'c'eva byathañ'ca aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ
calaka 1

masc. military officer; captain; major; lit. shaker [√cal + aka] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning military officer; captain; major; lit. shaker
Root Family √cal
Root √cal･1 a (shake, tremble)
Construction √cal + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Commentary (ANa) calakā'ti idha rañño ṭhānaṃ hotu, idha asukamahāmattassā'ti evaṃ senābyūhakārakā.
Sanskrit Root √cal 1 (stir)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño paccantime nagare bahubalakāyo paṭivasati, seyyath'idaṃ, hatth'ārohā ass'ārohā rathikā dhanuggahā celakā calakā piṇḍadāyakā uggā rājaputtā pakkhandino mahānāgā sūrā cammayodhino dāsakaputtā.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

ādibhūtānaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ ekassarānaṃ kvaci dvebhāvo hoti. titikkhati, jigucchati, tikicchati, vīmaṃsati, bubhukkhati, pivāsati, daddallati, dadāti, jahāti, caṅkamati. kvacī'ti kim'atthaṃ? kampati, calati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 458
calana

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 441
cavati 1

pr. (+abl) moves; shifts; falls away (from) [√cu + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+abl)
Meaning moves; shifts; falls away (from)
Root Family √cu
Root √cu･1 a (shift, fall away, die)
√ In Comps ccu
Base √cu + a > cava
Construction cava + ti
Phonetic Change u > av
Sanskrit cyavate
Sanskrit Root √cyu 1 (move, stir)

Examples

tiṭṭhe ce so tattha anānuyāyī,
pūgam'pi vassānaṃ samantacakkhu,
tatth'eva so sītisiyā vimutto,
cavetha viññāṇaṃ tathāvidhassa.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6

n'atthi koci bhavo nicco,
saṅkhārā v'āpi sassatā,
uppajjanti ca te khandhā,
cavanti apar'āparaṃ.

cassa 1

sandhi. and there would be; but there would be; and there might be [ca + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + opt
Meaning and there would be; but there would be; and there might be
Construction ca + assa
Sanskrit ca + syāt

Examples

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

yassa siyā sabbadā sati,
satataṃ kāyagatā upaṭṭhitā,
no c'assa no ca me siyā,
na bhavissati na ca me bhavissati,
anupubbavihāri tattha so,
kālen'eva tare visattikan'ti.

UD 68 kaccānasuttaṃ
cassa 2

sandhi. if there would be; but if it could be [ce + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + opt
Meaning if there would be; but if it could be
Construction ce + assa
Commentary (VINa) no c'assa pāripūrī'ti no ce pāripūrī bhaveyya
Sanskrit ced + syāt

Example

no c'assa pāripūri, māsaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā taṃ cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ ūnassa pāripūriyā satiyā paccāsāya. tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya satiyā'pi paccāsāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 3 akālacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ
cassa 3

sandhi. and for him [ca + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning and for him
Construction ca + assa
Sanskrit ca + asmai

Examples

ekam'antaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ, daḍḍhaṃ, bhante, bāhiyassa dārucīriyassa sarīraṃ, thūpo c'assa kato. tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo'ti?

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

evaṃdiṭṭhino, bhikkhave, etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, yā c'āyaṃ bhave appaṭikulyatā, sā c'assa na bhavissati. yā c'āyaṃ bhavanirodhe pāṭikulyatā, sā c'assa na bhavissatī'ti.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
cassa 4

Meaning and of this; and of him; and his; but his
Construction ca + assa
Sanskrit ca + asya

akaronto'pi ce pāpaṃ,

saṅkiyo hoti pāpasmiṃ,
avaṇṇo c'assa rūhati.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
cāga 1

masc. giving up; relinquishing; abandoning [√caj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from cajati
Meaning giving up; relinquishing; abandoning
Root Family √caj
Root √caj･1 a (give up, let go)
√ In Comps ccaj
Construction √caj > cāg + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Sanskrit tyāga
Sanskrit Root √tyaj 1 (forsake)

Examples

tasmā evaṃ samannāgato bhikkhu iminā paramena cāg'ādhiṭṭhānena samannāgato hoti. eso hi, bhikkhu, paramo ariyo cāgo yadidaṃ, sabb'ūpadhipaṭinissaggo.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, dukkhanirodhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ? yo tassā'y'eva taṇhāya asesavirāganirodho cāgo paṭinissaggo mutti anālayo

DN 22.17 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

masc. generosity; sharing; liberality [√caj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from cajati
Meaning generosity; sharing; liberality
Root Family √caj
Root √caj･1 a (give up, let go)
√ In Comps ccaj
Construction √caj > cāg + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Sanskrit tyāga
Sanskrit Root √tyaj 1 (forsake)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, cāgadhanaṃ.

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ

saddhāya vaḍḍhati, sīlena vaḍḍhati, sutena vaḍḍhati, cāgena vaḍḍhati, paññāya vaḍḍhati.

Meaning develops generosity; fosters sharing; cultivates charity
Construction cāgaṃ + anubrūheti
cāgavant

adj. generous; open-handed; lit. having relinquishing quality [√caj + *a + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from cāga
Meaning generous; open-handed; lit. having relinquishing quality
Root Family √caj
Root √caj･1 a (give up, let go)
√ In Comps ccaj
Construction √caj > cāg + *a + vant
cāga + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Sanskrit tyāgavat
Sanskrit Root √tyaj 1 (forsake)

Example

ottappī, bhikkhave, hatthako āḷavako, bahussuto, bhikkhave, hatthako āḷavako, cāgavā, bhikkhave, hatthako āḷavako, paññavā, bhikkhave, hatthako āḷavako.

AN 8.23 paṭhamahatthakasuttaṃ
cāgavanta

adj. liberal, generous ✗
cāgasampadā

fem. attainment of generosity; success in charitableness [cāga + sampadā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning attainment of generosity; success in charitableness
Construction cāga + sampadā
cāgasampanna

adj. full of generosity [cāga + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of generosity
Construction cāga + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (cāgena + sampanna)
Sanskrit tyāga + sampanna

Example

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo saddhāsampanno hoti, sīlasampanno hoti, cāgasampanno hoti, paññāsampanno hoti.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
cāgādiṭṭhāna 1

adj. having resolve for liberality and/or abandoning ✗
cāgādiṭṭhāna 2

nt. fixing the mind on abandoning, giving up and/or on giving; resolution for liberality and/or for abandoning ✗
cāgādhiṭṭhāna

adj. having abandoning as a basis; with giving up as foundation; established in relinquishing [cāga + adhiṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having abandoning as a basis; with giving up as foundation; established in relinquishing
Construction cāga + adhiṭṭhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (cāga + adhiṭṭhāna)
Sanskrit tyāga + adhiṣṭhāna

Examples

catur'ādhiṭṭhāno ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? paññ'ādhiṭṭhāno, sacc'ādhiṭṭhāno, cāg'ādhiṭṭhāno, upasam'ādhiṭṭhāno.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

tasmā evaṃ samannāgato bhikkhu iminā paramena cāg'ādhiṭṭhānena samannāgato hoti. eso hi, bhikkhu, paramo ariyo cāgo yadidaṃ, sabb'ūpadhipaṭinissaggo.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
cāgānussati

fem. recollection of one's generosity [cāga + anussati] ✓

Meaning recollection of one's generosity
Construction cāga + anussati

Sanskrit tyāga + anusmṛti

Example

ayaṃ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṃ samāpanno cāg'ānussatiṃ bhāveti.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
cāgī 1

adj. who abandons; who gives up [√caj + *ī] ✓

Meaning who abandons; who gives up

Sanskrit tyāgin
Sanskrit Root √tyaj 1 (forsake)

jhāyīnaṃ kāmacāginaṃ,
tato hiriñ'ca saddhañ'ca,
bhiyyo kubbetha māmako.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

gaṇḍo'ti kho, bhikkhave, imass'etaṃ cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa adhivacanaṃ mātāpettikasambhavassa odanakummās'ūpacayassa anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsanadhammassa.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ
cātuddasa 1

masc. uposatha observance on the fourteenth day (of a lunar fortnight) ✗

adj. on the 14th day (of a lunar fortnight) ✗

nt. 14th day (of a lunar fortnight) ✗

catuddasa + *ī

Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) cātuddasī'ti pakkhassa paṭhamadivasato pabhuti catuddasannaṃ pūraṇī ekā ratti.
Sanskrit caturdaśī

Examples

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ yā tā rattiyo abhiññātā abhilakkhitā, cātuddasī pañcadasī aṭṭhamī ca pakkhassa, tathārūpāsu rattīsu yāni tāni ārāmacetiyāni vanacetiyāni rukkhacetiyāni bhiṃsanakāni salomahaṃsāni tathārūpesu sen'āsanesu vihareyyaṃ app'eva nām'āhaṃ bhayabheravaṃpasseyyan'ti.

tīsu uposathadivasesu cātuddasī, paṇṇarasī, sāmaggīsu, ajj'uposatho ko uposatho?

cātumasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 67 (MN67) ✗
cātumahāpatha

masc. four-way intersection; crossroads; meeting of four great roads [catu + mahā + patha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning four-way intersection; crossroads; meeting of four great roads
Construction catu + mahā + patha
Phonetic Change a > ā
Compound digu (cattāro + mahapathā)
Variant catumahāpatha, cātummahāpatha
Sanskrit caturmahāpatha

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī cātumahāpathe nikkhittā assa. atha cha purisā āgaccheyyuṃ byābhaṅgihatthā. te yavakalāpiṃ chahi byābhaṅgīhi haneyyuṃ. evañ'hi sā, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī suhatā assa chahi byābhaṅgīhi haññamānā.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, poṭṭhapāda, puriso cātumahāpathe nisseṇiṃ kareyya pāsādassa ārohaṇāya.

VIN 2.5.1.10 pathavīkhaṇanasikkhāpadaṃ
cātumāsinī

fem. full moon of the fourth month; full moon marking the transition of one season to another [catu + māsa + *inī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning full moon of the fourth month; full moon marking the transition of one season to another
Construction catu > cātu + māsa + *inī
catumāsa + *inī
Derivative taddhita (*inī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) komudiṃ cātumāsinin'ti pacchimakattikacātumāsapuṇṇamaṃ. sā hi kumudānaṃ atthitāya komudī, catunnaṃ vassikānaṃ māsānaṃ pariyosānattā cātumāsinī'ti vuccati.
Notes (MW) full-moon day at the Cāturmāsya sacrifices. cāturmāsya, 3 sacrifices performed at the beginning of the 3 seasons of 4 months
Sanskrit cāturmāsī

Examples

idh'ev'āhaṃ sāvatthiyaṃ komudiṃ cātumāsiniṃ āgamessāmī'ti. assosuṃ kho jānapadā bhikkhū, bhagavā kira tatth'eva sāvatthiyaṃ komudiṃ cātumāsiniṃ āgamessatī'ti.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ

kattikapuṇṇaman'ti kattikacātumāsinī vuccati.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
cātummahārājikaparisā

fem. assembly of gods in the realm of the four great kings ✗
cātuyāma

masc. fourfold restraint; four types of self-control [catu + yāma + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fourfold restraint; four types of self-control
Construction catu > cātu + yāma + *a
catuyāma + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (SNa) cātuyāmasusaṃvuto'ti cātuyāmena susaṃvuto. cātuyāmo nāma sabbavārivārito ca hoti sabbavāriyutto ca sabbavāridhuto ca sabbavāriphuṭo cā'ti ime cattāro koṭṭhāsā.
Sanskrit catur + yāma

Example

jegucchī nipako bhikkhu,
cātuyāmasusaṃvuto,
diṭṭhaṃ sutañ'ca ācikkhaṃ,
na hi nūna kibbisī siyā'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
cātuyāmasaṃvara

masc. control in regards to the four restraints ✗
cātuyāmasaṃvarasaṃvuta

adj. restrained by the fourfold restraint; controlled by the four types of control [cātuyāma + saṃvara + saṃvuta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning restrained by the fourfold restraint; controlled by the four types of control
Construction cātuyāma + saṃvara + saṃvuta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (cātuyāmasaṃvarena + saṃvuta)
Commentary (MNa) cātuyāmasaṃvarasaṃvuto'ti na pāṇam'atipāteti, na pāṇam'atipātayati, na pāṇam'atipātayato samanuñño hoti. na adinnaṃ ādiyati, na adinnaṃ ādiyāpeti, na adinnaṃ ādiyato samanuñño hoti. na musā bhaṇati, na musā bhaṇāpeti, na musā bhaṇato samanuñño hoti. na bhāvitam'āsīsati, na bhāvitam'āsīsāpeti, na bhāvitam'āsīsato samanuñño hotī'ti iminā catukoṭṭhāsena saṃvarena saṃvuto.
Sanskrit catur + yāma + saṃvara + saṃvṛta

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, idh'assa nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto cātuyāmasaṃvarasaṃvuto sabbavārivārito sabbavāriyutto sabbavāridhuto sabbavāriphuṭo.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
cātuyāmasusaṃvuta

adj. well restrained by the fourfold restraint; completely controlled by the four types of control [cātuyāma + susaṃvuta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning well restrained by the fourfold restraint; completely controlled by the four types of control
Construction cātuyāma + susaṃvuta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (cātuyāmena + susaṃvuta)
Commentary (SNa) cātuyāmasusaṃvuto'ti cātuyāmena susaṃvuto. cātuyāmo nāma sabbavārivārito ca hoti sabbavāriyutto ca sabbavāridhuto ca sabbavāriphuṭo cā'ti ime cattāro koṭṭhāsā.
Sanskrit catur + yāma + saṃvṛta

Example

jegucchī nipako bhikkhu,
cātuyāmasusaṃvuto,
diṭṭhaṃ sutañ'ca ācikkhaṃ,
na hi nūna kibbisī siyā'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
