Sanskrit cātura +
cāturanta

masc. four points of the compass; four corners of the world; the entire world; lit. four ends [catu + anta + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning four points of the compass; four corners of the world; the entire world; lit. four ends
Construction catu > cātu + [r] + anta + *a
caturanta + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
+r
Commentary (ANa) cāturanto'ti puratthimasamudd'ādīnaṃ catunnaṃ samuddānaṃ vasena cāturantāya pathaviyā issaro.
Sanskrit caturanta

Example

sace agāraṃ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato. tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti

Construction cātura + iya

cāpa

Grammar masc
Meaning bow (and arrow)

senti cāpa-atikhīṇā'va,
purāṇāni anutthunaṃ.

DHP 156 jarāvaggo

ahaṃ nāgo'va saṅgāme,
cāpato patitaṃ saraṃ,
ativākyaṃ titikkhissaṃ,
dussīlo hi bahujjano.

DHP 320 nāgavaggo
cāpanataṃ

sandhi. and disinclined; and averse; (comm) and accompanied with aversion; lit. and bent back [ca + apanataṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pp
Meaning and disinclined; and averse; (comm) and accompanied with aversion; lit. and bent back
Construction ca + apanataṃ
Antonym cābhinataṃ
Variant cāpanato
Commentary (ANa) rāg'ānugataṃ pana cittaṃ abhinataṃ nāma hoti, dos'ānugataṃ apanataṃ. tadubhayapaṭikkhepena na c'ābhinataṃ na c'āpanatan'ti āha
Sanskrit ca + apanatam

Example

atha kho aparā devatā bhagavato santike imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi, passa samādhiṃ subhāvitaṃ cittañ'ca suvimuttaṃ, na c'ābhinataṃ na c'āpanataṃ na ca sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagataṃ.

SN 1.38 sakalikasuttaṃ
cāpanato

sandhi. and disinclined; and averse; (comm) and accompanied with aversion; lit. and bent back [ca + apanato] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pp
Meaning and disinclined; and averse; (comm) and accompanied with aversion; lit. and bent back
Construction ca + apanato
Antonym cābhinato
Variant cāpanataṃ
Commentary (ANa) rāg'ānugataṃ pana cittaṃ abhinataṃ nāma hoti, dos'ānugataṃ apanataṃ. tadubhayapaṭikkhepena na c'ābhinataṃ na c'āpanatan'ti āha
Sanskrit ca + apanataḥ

Example

yāyaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi na c'ābhinato na c'āpanato na ca sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato, vimuttattā ṭhito, ṭhitattā santusito, santusitattā no paritassati. ayaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi kiṃphalo vutto bhagavatā'ti?

cāpalasuṇa

masc. kind of (garlic or) onion; (a spring onion(?)) ✗
cāpalya

nt. fickleness ✗
cāpalla

nt. fickleness [pa + √cal] ✗

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of arrow) shot from a bow; spent
Construction cāpa + atikhīṇa
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (cāpato + atikhīṇa)
Commentary (DHPa) cāp'ātikhīṇāvā'ti cāpato atikhīṇā, cāpā vinimuttā'ti attho.

cāpātherīgāthā

Commentary (UDa) cāpālaṃ cetiyan'ti pubbe cāpālassa nāma yakkhassa vasitaṭṭhānaṃ cāpālacetiyan'ti paññāyittha. tattha bhagavato katavihāro'pi tāya ruḷhiyā cāpālacetiyan'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit cāpāla + caitya

Example

vesāliyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi, gaṇhāhi, ānanda, nisīdanaṃ. yena cāpālacetiyaṃ ten'upasaṅkamissāma divāvihārāyā'ti.

AN 8.70 bhūmicālasuttaṃ
cāpālavagga

masc. Chapter 1 of the Iddhipādasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 5 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
cāpi

sandhi. or even; and even; as well as [ca + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning or even; and even; as well as
Construction ca + api
Sanskrit ca + api

Examples

na vissase ekatiyesu evaṃ,
agārisu pabbajitesu c'āpi,
sādhū'pi hutvā na asādhu honti,
asādhu hutvā puna sādhu honti.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

te c'āpi nūnappajaheyyu dukkhaṃ,
ye tvaṃ muni aṭṭhitaṃ ovadeyya,
taṃ taṃ namassāmi samecca nāga,
app'eva maṃ bhagavā aṭṭhitaṃ ovadeyya.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
cāpime

sandhi. or even these; and even these; as well as these [ca + api + ime] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + pron
Meaning or even these; and even these; as well as these
Construction ca + api + ime
Sanskrit ca + api + ime

Example

pakudhako kātiyāno nigaṇṭho,
ye c'āp'ime makkhalipūraṇāse,
gaṇassa satthāro sāmaññappattā,
na hi nūna te sappurisehi dūre'ti.

na kho mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ khemakaṃ vihes'āpekhā pucchimha, api c'āyasmā khemako pahosi tassa bhagavato sāsanaṃ vitthārena ācikkhituṃ desetuṃ paññāpetuṃ paṭṭhapetuṃ vivarituṃ vibhajituṃ uttānīkātuṃ.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
cāyaṃ

sandhi. and this; but this; than this [ca + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning and this; but this; than this
Construction ca + ayaṃ
Sanskrit ca + ayam

Examples

yo c'āyaṃ bhikkhu saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpanno tassa'pi kāyasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, vacīsaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, cittasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, āyu na parikkhīṇo, usmā avūpasantā, indriyāni vippasannāni.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

paṭipadāya na saṇṭhātī'ti paṭipattiyaṃ na tiṭṭhati, vattaṃ ajānitvā apucchitabbaṭṭhāne pucchatī'ti attho. ayaṃ pañho nāma cetiy'aṅgaṇe pucchitena na kathetabbo, tathā bhikkhācāramagge gāmaṃ piṇḍāya caraṇakāle.

Sanskrit cārikām + carati

Example

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
cārikaṃ caramāna

idiom. (+loc) wandering on tour (in); walking about (among) [cārikaṃ + caramāna] ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + prp, prp of cārikaṃ carati (+loc)
Meaning wandering on tour (in); walking about (among)
Construction cārikaṃ + caramāna
Commentary (MNa) cārikaṃ caramāno'ti addhānagamanaṃ gacchanto.
Sanskrit cārikā + caramāṇa

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā mallesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena thūṇaṃ nāma mallānaṃ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā kapilavatthusmiṃ yath'ābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi. anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.

VIN 4.1.41 rāhula vatthu
cārikaṃ pakkamati

idiom. sets out on walking journey; set out on foot ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + pr
Meaning sets out on walking journey; set out on foot
Sanskrit cārikām + prakrāmati

Examples

atha kho sabhiyo paribbājako yena rājagahaṃ tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi. anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena rājagahaṃ veḷuvanaṃ kalandakanivāpo, yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyya.

VIN PAT PC 46 cārittasikkhāpadaṃ

tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu ativelaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjati. tam'enaṃ bhikkhū evam'āhaṃsu, m'āyasmā ativelaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjī'ti.

SN 20.10 biḷārasuttaṃ
cārittaṃ āpajjita

idiom. (+loc) engaged closely (with); visited; engaged in intercourse (with); lit. engaged in walking ✗
cārī 1.1

Grammar adj, in comps, from carati
Meaning living; acting; behaving; conducting oneself; lit. walking
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction √car > cār + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit cārin
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Examples

attadantassa posassa,
niccaṃ saññatacārino,
n'eva devo na gandhabbo,
na māro saha brahmunā,
jitaṃ apajitaṃ kayirā,
tathārūpassa jantuno.

DHP 104-105 sahassavaggo

manujassa pamattacārino,
taṇhā vaḍḍhati māluvā viya,
so plavatī hurā huraṃ,
phalam'icchaṃ'va vanasmi vānaro.

DHP 334 taṇhāvaggo
cārī 2.1

masc. (+gen) roaming (of); wandering (of); lit. walking [√car + *ī] ✓

Grammar masc, from carati (+gen)
Meaning roaming (of); wandering (of); lit. walking
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (move, walk)
Construction √car > cār + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (SNa) cārī'ti sañcāro.
Sanskrit cārin
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

atthi, bhikkhave, himavato pabbatarājassa duggā visamā desā, yattha n'eva makkaṭānaṃ cārī na manussānaṃ.

SN 47.7 makkaṭasuttaṃ
cārī 2.2

adj. grazing [√car] ✗
cāru

adj. beautiful; lovely; pretty ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning beautiful; lovely; pretty
Commentary (THIa) cārudassanā'ti piyadassanā manoharadassanā.
Sanskrit cāru

Example

uppāṭiya cārudassanā,
na ca pajjittha asaṅgamānasā,
handa te cakkhuṃ harassu taṃ,
tassa narassa adāsi tāva'd'e.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
cārudassana

adj. beautiful to behold; lovely to look at [cāru + dassana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning beautiful to behold; lovely to look at
Construction cāru + dassana
Compound kammadhāraya (cāru + dassana)
Commentary (THIa) cārudassanā'ti piyadassanā manoharadassanā.
Sanskrit cāru + darśana

Example

uppāṭiya cārudassanā,
na ca pajjittha asaṅgamānasā,
handa te cakkhuṃ harassu taṃ,
tassa narassa adāsi tāva'd'e.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

masc. name of a monk; lit. shock [√cal + *a] ✓

Example

AN 10.72 kaṇṭakasuttaṃ
cālayamāna

prp. causing to shake, shaking [√cal] ✗
cālātherīgāthā

fem. Therīgāthā 59 (THI59) ✗
cālāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 5.6 (SN5.6) ✗
cālikā

fem. name of a town; lit. shaking; unsteady [√cal + a + *ikā] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a town; lit. shaking; unsteady
Root Family √cal
Root √cal･1 a (shake, tremble)
Construction √cal > cāl + a + *ikā
cala + *ikā
Derivative taddhita (*ikā)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (UDa) cālikāyan'ti evaṃ nāmake nagare. tassa kira nagarassa dvāraṭṭhānaṃ muñcitvā samantato calapaṅkaṃ hoti, taṃ calapaṅkaṃ nissāya ṭhitattā olokentānaṃ calamānaṃ viya upaṭṭhāti, tasmā cālikā'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit Root √cal 1 (stir)

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā cālikāyaṃ viharati cālikāpabbate. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā meghiyo bhagavato upaṭṭhāko hoti.

√ In Comps ccu

Construction cāve + ana

Commentary (VINa) cāvan'ādhippāyo'ti sāsanato cāvetu'kāmo.
Sanskrit cyāvana
Sanskrit Root √cyu 1 (move, stir)
cāvana 2

nt. causing to move or fall, moving; causing to fall away (from) or abandon [√cu] ✗
cāvanā

Sanskrit cyāvana
Sanskrit Root √cyu 1 (move, stir)

Example

vissaṭṭhī'ti ṭhānato cāvanā vuccati vissaṭṭhī'ti.

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhisikkhāpadaṃ
cāvanādhipāya

adj. intending or wishing to cause (someone) to fail away (from) or abandon ✗

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning intending to cause (somebody) to disrobe
Construction cāvana + adhippāya
Commentary (VINa) cāvan'ādhippāyo'ti sāsanato cāvetu'kāmo.
cāvayamāna

prp. (+acc and +abl) causing to move down (from); taking down (from) [√cu + *aya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of cāvayati, caus, trans (+acc and +abl)
Meaning causing to move down (from); taking down (from)
Root Family √cu
Root √cu･1 *aya (shift, fall away, die)
√ In Comps ccu
Base √cu + *aya > cāvaya (caus)
Construction cāvaya + māna

Phonetic Change u > āv
Sanskrit cyāvayamāna
Sanskrit Root √cyu 1 (move, stir)

Example

ādiyamāno'ti ādiyamāno haramāno avaharamāno iriyāpathaṃ vikopayamāno ṭhānā cāvayamāno saṅketaṃ vītināmayamāno.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
cāvita

pp. brought to fall, driven away [√cu] ✗
cāvuso

sandhi. and friend; and brothers [ca + āvuso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + masc
Meaning and friend; and brothers
Construction ca + āvuso
Sanskrit ca + āyusmanto

Examples

yā c'āvuso, paññā yañ'ca viññāṇaṃ, ime dhammā saṃsaṭṭhā udāhu visaṃsaṭṭhā? labbhā ca pan'imesaṃ dhammānaṃ vinibbhujitvā vinibbhujitvā nānākaraṇaṃ paññāpetun'ti?

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

katamā c'āvuso, animittā cetovimutti? idh'āvuso, bhikkhu sabbanimittānaṃ amanasikārā animittaṃ cetosamādhiṃ upasampajja viharati. ayaṃ vuccat'āvuso, animittā cetovimutti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
cāveti 1

pr. (+acc and +abl) makes fall (from); causes downfall (from) [√cu + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of cavati, trans (+acc and +abl)
Meaning makes fall (from); causes downfall (from)
Root Family √cu
Root √cu･1 *e (shift, fall away, die)
√ In Comps ccu
Base √cu + *e > cāve (caus)
Construction cāve + ti
Phonetic Change u > āv
Sanskrit cyāvayati
Sanskrit Root √cyu 1 (move, stir)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ duṭṭho doso appatīto amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya app'eva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan'ti

VIN PAT SA 8 duṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ

app'eva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan'ti bhikkhubhāvā cāveyyaṃ, samaṇadhammā cāveyyaṃ, sīlakkhandhā cāveyyaṃ, tapoguṇā cāveyyaṃ.

VIN 1.2.8 duṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
cāveti 2

pr. (+acc and +abl) makes move (from); makes shift; disturbs (from); disrupts; lit. causes to fall [√cu + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of cavati, trans (+acc and +abl)
Meaning makes move (from); makes shift; disturbs (from); disrupts; lit. causes to fall
Root Family √cu
Root √cu･1 *e (shift, fall away, die)
√ In Comps ccu
Base √cu + *e > cāve (caus)
Construction cāve + ti
Phonetic Change u > āv
Commentary (VINa) pañcamaṃ thale nikkhitt'ādivasena
Sanskrit cyāvayati
Sanskrit Root √cyu 1 (move, stir)

Example

theyyasaṅkhātan'ti ādiyeyyā'ti ādiyeyya hareyya avahareyya iriyāpathaṃ vikopeyya ṭhānā cāveyya saṅketaṃ vītināmeyya.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
cāvetukāma

adj. (+abl) wanting to make fall (from); wanting to make leave (from) [cāvetuṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+abl)
Meaning wanting to make fall (from); wanting to make leave (from)
Construction cāvetuṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (cāvetuṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit cyāvayatuṃ + kāma

Examples

atha kho māro pāpimā uppalavaṇṇāya bhikkhuniyā bhayaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃsaṃ uppādetu'kāmo samādhimhā cāvetu'kāmo yena uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī ten'upasaṅkami

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ

siyā kho pana te, nigrodha, evam'assa, uddesā no cāvetu'kāmo samaṇo gotamo evam'āhā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, nigrodha, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. yo eva vo uddeso so eva vo uddeso hotu.

Meaning and one said
Construction ca + āha
Sanskrit ca + āha

Examples

abhūtavādī nirayaṃ upeti,
yo v'āpi katvā na karomi c'āha,
ubho'pi te pecca samā bhavanti,
nihīnakammā manujā parattha.

DHP 306 nirayavaggo

yen'eva bālo'ti paraṃ dahāti,
ten'ātumānaṃ kusalo'ti c'āha,
sayam'attanā so kusalo vadāno,
aññaṃ vimāneti tadeva pāva.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12

Meaning and I; but I
Construction ca + ahaṃ
Sanskrit ca + aham

Examples

na c'āhaṃ, āvuso, appatvā'va lokassa antaṃ dukkhassa antakiriyaṃ vadāmi.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

atha kassa c'āhaṃ, bho gotama, imaṃ pāyasaṃ dammī'ti?

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning if I
Construction ce + ahaṃ
Synonym ahañce, sacāhaṃ
Sanskrit ce + aham

Example

na kho pana so, sāriputta, saṃsāro sulabharūpo yo mayā asaṃsaritapubbo iminā dīghena addhunā, aññatra suddh'āvāsehi devehi. suddh'āvāse c'āhaṃ, sāriputta, deve saṃsareyyaṃ, na'y'imaṃ lokaṃ punarāgaccheyyaṃ.

na c'āhu na ca bhavissati,
na c'eta'r'ahi vijjati,
ek'antaṃ nindito poso,
ek'antaṃ vā pasaṃsito.

Meaning and they said
Construction ca + āhu
Sanskrit ca + āhuḥ

evam'pi viggayha vivādayanti,
bālo paro akusalo'ti c'āhu,
sacco nu vādo katamo imesaṃ,
sabb'eva h'īme kusalā vadānā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
ci

ind. some; any ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning some; any
Sanskrit cid

Example

saṅkhāya lokasmiṃ paroparāni,
yass'iñjitaṃ n'atthi kuhiñ'ci loke,
santo vidhūmo anīgho nirāso,
atāri so jātijaran'ti brūmī'ti.

AN 4.41 samādhibhāvanāsuttaṃ
cikicchati

pr. (+loc) has doubt (about); is uncertain (about); lit. wants to think [√cit + cha + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, desid of ceteti, intrans (+loc)
Meaning has doubt (about); is uncertain (about); lit. wants to think
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 cha (think, intend)
Base √cit + cit + sa > cikiccha (desid)
Construction cikiccha + ti
Synonym kaṅkhati, vicikicchati
Sanskrit cikitsati
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

abbhāse vattamānassa kavaggassa cavaggo hoti. cikicchati, jigucchati, jighacchati, jigīsati, jaṅgamati, caṅkamati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 462

māna kita'icc'etesaṃ dhātūnaṃ abbhāsagatānaṃ vakāra takārattaṃ hoti vā yathāsaṅkhyaṃ. vīmaṃsati, tikicchati. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? cikicchati.

ciṅgulaka

nt. (comm) toy windmill; small spinning wheel; lit. spinning [ciṅgula + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, dimin of ciṅgula
Meaning (comm) toy windmill; small spinning wheel; lit. spinning
Construction ciṅgula + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (MNa) ciṅgulakaṃ vuccati tālapaṇṇ'ādīhi kataṃ vātappahārena paribbhamanacakkaṃ.

Example

sa kho so, bhikkhave, kumāro vuddhim'anvāya indriyānaṃ paripākam'anvāya yāni tāni kumārakānaṃ kīḷāpanakāni tehi kīḷati, seyyath'idaṃ, vaṅkakaṃ ghaṭikaṃ mokkhacikaṃ ciṅgulakaṃ patt'āḷhakaṃ rathakaṃ dhanukaṃ.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
ciṅgulayitvā

abs. (+acc) having turned or whirled around [ciṅgula] ✗
ciṅgulāyati

pr. (+acc) revolves round [ciṅgula] ✗
ciṅgulāyitvā

abs. (+acc) having rolled around; having circled; having spun [ciṅgula + āya + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of ciṅgulāyati, deno, trans (+acc)
Meaning having rolled around; having circled; having spun
Construction ciṅgula + āya + itvā
ciṅgulika

nt. (comm) toy windmill; small spinning wheel [ciṅgula] ✗
cicciṭa

ind. hiss; sizzle; fizzle; crackling sound [ciṭi + ciṭa] ✓

Grammar ind, onom
Meaning hiss; sizzle; fizzle; crackling sound
Construction ciṭi + ciṭa
Synonym ciṭiciṭi
Sanskrit ciṭiciṭi (bsk)

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma phālo divasasantatto udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati, evam'eva so habyaseso udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ

saṅgho pabbatam'iva attānam'ācarati, pabbatāyati. taḷākaṃ samuddam'iva attānam'ācarati, samuddāyati, saddo cicciṭam'iva attānam'ācarati, cicciṭāyati, vasiṭṭhassa apaccaṃ vāsiṭṭho. evam'aññe'pi yojetabbā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 432
cicciṭāyati

pr. hisses; sizzles; fizzles; crackles; lit. makes a cicciṭa sound [ciṭi + ciṭa + āya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, onom, deno of cicciṭa, intrans
Meaning hisses; sizzles; fizzles; crackles; lit. makes a cicciṭa sound
Construction ciṭi + ciṭa + āya + ti
Sanskrit ciṭiciṭāyate

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma phālo divasasantatto udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati, evam'eva so habyaseso udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ

saṅgho pabbatam'iva attānam'ācarati, pabbatāyati. taḷākaṃ samuddam'iva attānam'ācarati, samuddāyati, saddo cicciṭam'iva attānam'ācarati, cicciṭāyati, vasiṭṭhassa apaccaṃ vāsiṭṭho. evam'aññe'pi yojetabbā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 432
cicciṭi

ind. hissing sound ✗
ciccheda

perf. (+acc) cut; severed [√chid + *a + a] ✓

Grammar perf of chindati, trans (+acc)
Meaning cut; severed
Root Family √chid
Root √chid･2 *a (cut, steal)
√ In Comps cchid
Base √chid + chid + *a > ciccheda (perf)
Construction ciccheda + a
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cicheda
Sanskrit Root √chid 7, 9 (cut off)

Example

abbhāsagatānaṃ dutiyacatutthānaṃ paṭhamatatiyā honti. ciccheda, bubhukkhati, babhūva, dadhāti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 461
ciñcā

fem. tamarind ✗
ciṭiciṭāyati

pr. hisses; sizzles; fizzles; crackles; splutters; lit. makes a ciṭiciṭa sound [ciṭi + ciṭi + āya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, onom, deno of ciṭiciṭi, intrans
Meaning hisses; sizzles; fizzles; crackles; splutters; lit. makes a ciṭiciṭa sound
Construction ciṭi + ciṭi + āya + ti
Sanskrit ciṭiciṭāyati

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma phālo divasasantatto udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati, evam'eva so habyaseso udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, tindukālātaṃ kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭitaṃ bhiyyosomattāya cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
ciṭiciṭi

ind. hiss; sizzle; fizzle; crackling sound [ciṭi + ciṭi] ✓

Grammar ind, onom
Meaning hiss; sizzle; fizzle; crackling sound
Construction ciṭi + ciṭi
Synonym cicciṭa
Sanskrit ciṭiciṭi (bsk)

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma phālo divasasantatto udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati, evam'eva so habyaseso udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, tindukālātaṃ kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭitaṃ bhiyyosomattāya cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
ciṇṇa 1

pp. performed; practised [√car + na] ✓

Grammar pp of carati
Meaning performed; practised
Root Family √car
Root √car･1 a (move, walk)
Construction √car > cir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change a > i
rn > ṇṇ
Sanskrit cīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

app'icchatā sappurisehi vaṇṇitā,
makkhappahānaṃ vūpasamo dukhassa,
iti'ssu maṃ citta tadā niyuñjasi,
idāni tvaṃ gacchasi pubbaciṇṇaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

Root √car･1 a (move, walk)
Construction √car > cir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change a > i
rn > ṇṇ
Sanskrit cīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Examples

maggo c'āpi subhāvito,
maraṇe me bhayaṃ n'atthi,
rogānam'iva saṅkhaye.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

parivutthaparivāsena bhikkhunā uttari chārattaṃ bhikkhumānattāya paṭipajjitabbaṃ, ciṇṇamānatto bhikkhu yattha siyā vīsatigaṇo bhikkhusaṅgho, tattha so bhikkhu abbhetabbo.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
cito

sandhi. to there ✗
citta 1.1

nt. mind; heart [√cit + ta] ✓

Meaning mind; heart
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Construction √cit + ta

yatthakāmanipātino,

yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.

Meaning decorated; beautiful; adorned

Root √citt･8 *e (paint, design)
Construction √citt + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym citra
Sanskrit citra
Sanskrit Root √cit √citraya 10 (make variegated)

Example

cittaṃ rājarath'ūpamaṃ,

n'atthi saṅgo vijānataṃ.

DHP 171 lokavaggo

Grammar adj, from citteti
Meaning varied; different; diverse
Root Family √citt
Root √citt･8 *e (paint, design)
Construction √citt + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym citra
Sanskrit citra
Sanskrit Root √cit √citraya 10 (make variegated)

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekanikāyam'pi samanupassāmi evaṃ cittaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā, te'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā citten'eva cittitā, tehi'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatehi pāṇehi cittaññ'eva cittataraṃ.

Meaning painting; picture; artwork; illusion

Root √citt･8 *e (paint, design)

Sanskrit citra
Sanskrit Root √cit √citraya 10 (make variegated)

Meaning decorated spread
Construction citta + attharaka
Commentary (MNt) hatth'attharaṇā hatthirūpavicittā. ass'attharakasīh'attharak'ādayo'pi assasīharūp'ādivicittā eva attharakā, citt'attharakaṃ nānārūpehi c'eva nānāvidhamālākamm'ādīhi ca vicittaṃ attharakaṃ.
Sanskrit citra + āstara
cittadubbhaka

masc. mind that is an injurer; treacherous mind? ✗
cittanibbāpana

nt. cooling the mind [citta + nibbāpana] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning cooling the mind
Construction citta + nibbāpana
cittanissita

adj. dependent on the mind [citta + nissita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on the mind
Construction citta + nissita
Synonym cittappaṭibaddha, manonissita
cittantara

adj. having the interval of a thought moment ✗
cittanvaya

adj. conforming to the mind; subject to the mind; subservient to the mind; lit. following the mind [citta + anvaya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning conforming to the mind; subject to the mind; subservient to the mind; lit. following the mind
Construction citta + anvaya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cittaṃ + anvaya)
Antonym kāyanvaya
Commentary (MNa) kāy'anvayaṃ hotī'ti kāy'ānugataṃ hoti kāyassa vasavatti.
Sanskrit citta + anvaya

Example

tassa kho eso, bho gotama, citt'anvayo kāyo hoti, cittassa vasena vattati. taṃ kissa hetu? abhāvitattā kāyassa.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
cittapaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing the mind; conscious of psyche; sensitive to the mind [citta + paṭisaṃvedī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning experiencing the mind; conscious of psyche; sensitive to the mind
Construction citta + paṭisaṃvedī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cittaṃ + paṭisaṃvedī)
Variant cittappaṭisaṃvedī
Commentary (VISM) tatiyacatukke'pi catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ vasena cittapaṭisaṃveditā veditabbā.
Sanskrit citta + pratisaṃvedin

Example

cittapaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, cittapaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati. abhippamodayaṃ cittaṃ assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, abhippamodayaṃ cittaṃ passasissāmī'ti sikkhati.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
cittaparikkhāra 1

adj. equipping, making fit the thinking ✗
cittaparikkhāra 2

adj. which equips, makes fit the thinking ✗
cittaparikkhāratthaṃ

ind. to support the mind; lit. for the purpose of helping the mind [citta + parikkhāra + attha + aṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning to support the mind; lit. for the purpose of helping the mind
Construction citta + parikkhāra + attha + aṃ
cittaparikkhārattha + aṃ
cittapassaddhi

fem. mental calmness; mental tranquillity; (comm) stilling of distress in the aggregates of consciousness [citta + passaddhi] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning mental calmness; mental tranquillity; (comm) stilling of distress in the aggregates of consciousness
Construction citta + passaddhi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cittassa + passaddhi)
Commentary (SNa) cittapassaddhī'ti viññāṇakkhandhassa darathapassaddhi.
Sanskrit citta + praśrabdhi

Example

atthi, bhikkhave, kāyapassaddhi, cittapassaddhi. tattha yonisomanasikārabahulīkāro, ayam'āhāro anuppannassa vā passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ
cittapāṭalī

fem. kind of tree ✗
cittapārisuddhi

fem. purification of mind; purity of heart [citta + pārisuddhi] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning purification of mind; purity of heart
Construction citta + pārisuddhi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cittassa + pārisuddhi)
Sanskrit citta + pariśuddhi

Example

iti evarūpiṃ cittapārisuddhiṃ aparipūraṃ vā paripūressāmi paripūraṃ vā tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmī'ti, yo tattha chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca, idaṃ vuccati, byagghapajjā, cittapārisuddhipadhāniy'aṅgaṃ.

AN 4.194 sāmugiyasuttaṃ
cittapārisuddhipadhāniyaṅga

nt. factor related to striving for the purification of mind [citta + pārisuddhi + padhāniya + aṅga] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning factor related to striving for the purification of mind
Construction citta + pārisuddhi + padhāniya + aṅga
Compound catutthī tappurisa (cittapārisuddhiyā + padhāniyaṅga)
Sanskrit citta + pariśuddhi + prahāṇika (bsk) + aṅga

Example

iti evarūpiṃ cittapārisuddhiṃ aparipūraṃ vā paripūressāmi paripūraṃ vā tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmī'ti, yo tattha chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca, idaṃ vuccati, byagghapajjā, cittapārisuddhipadhāniy'aṅgaṃ.

AN 4.194 sāmugiyasuttaṃ
cittappakopana

masc. agitating the mind; disturbing the mind [citta + pakopana] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning agitating the mind; disturbing the mind
Construction citta + pakopana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cittaṃ + pakopana)
Commentary (ITIa) cittappakopano'ti cittasaṅkhobhano. lobho hi lobhanīye vatthusmiṃ uppajjamāno cittaṃ khobhento pakopento vipariṇāmento vikāraṃ āpādento uppajjati, pasād'ādivasena pavattituṃ na deti.
Sanskrit citta + prakopana

Example

anatthajanano kodho,
kodho cittappakopano,
bhayam'antarato jātaṃ,
taṃ jano n'āvabujjhati.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
cittappaṭibaddha

adj. dependent on the mind [citta + paṭibaddha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on the mind
Construction citta + paṭibaddha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (citte + paṭibaddha)
Synonym cittanissita, manonissita
Commentary (MNa) cittappaṭibaddhā'ti cittanissitā, citte sati honti, asati na honti.
Sanskrit citta + pratibandha

Example

saññā ca vedanā ca cetasikā. ete dhammā cittappaṭibaddhā, tasmā saññā ca vedanā ca cittasaṅkhāro'ti.

SN 41.6 dutiyakāmabhūsuttaṃ
cittappaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing the mind; conscious of psyche; sensitive to the mind [citta + paṭisaṃvedī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning experiencing the mind; conscious of psyche; sensitive to the mind
Construction citta + paṭisaṃvedī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cittaṃ + paṭisaṃvedī)
Variant cittapaṭisaṃvedī
Sanskrit citta + pratisaṃvedin

Example

cittappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, cittappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
cittappamaddī

adj. crushing the thoughts ✗
cittappamāthī

adj. troubling, harassing the thoughts ✗
cittappasāda

masc. clarity of mind; mental brightness [citta + pasāda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning clarity of mind; mental brightness
Construction citta + pasāda
cittappassaddhi

fem. mental calmness; mental tranquillity; (comm) tranquillity of consciousness [citta + passaddhi] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning mental calmness; mental tranquillity; (comm) tranquillity of consciousness
Construction citta + passaddhi
Commentary (SNa) cittappassaddhī'ti viññāṇakkhandhassa darathapassaddhi.
cittabyañjana

adj. well-worded; ornately expressed; lit. adorned letters [citta + byañjana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning well-worded; ornately expressed; lit. adorned letters
Construction citta + byañjana
Compound kammadhāraya (citta + byañjana)
Variant cittavyañjana
Sanskrit citra + vyañjana

Example

ye pana te suttantā kavikatā kāveyyā citt'akkharā cittabyañjanā bāhirakā sāvakabhāsitā, tesu bhaññamānesu sussūsissanti, sotaṃ odahissanti

SN 20.7 āṇisuttaṃ
cittabhāvanā

fem. development of the mind; mental cultivation; (comm) stilling the mind [citta + bhāvanā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning development of the mind; mental cultivation; (comm) stilling the mind
Construction citta + bhāvanā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (citassa + bhāvanā)
Antonym kāyabhāvanā
Commentary (MNa) cittabhāvanā'ti'pi samatho vuccati, samādhiyuttassa ca puggalassa ūrukkhambh'ādayo nāma n'atthi, iti nigaṇṭho idaṃ abhūtam'eva āha.
Sanskrit citta + bhāvanā

Examples

santi, bho gotama, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kāyabhāvan'ānuyogamanuyuttā viharanti, no cittabhāvanaṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

kin'ti pana te, aggivessana, cittabhāvanā sutā'ti? cittabhāvanāya kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavatā puṭṭho samāno na sampāyāsi.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
cittabhāvanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. devoted to the practice of developing the mind; devoted to the practice of mental cultivation [citta + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the practice of developing the mind; devoted to the practice of mental cultivation
Construction citta + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (cittabhāvanānuyogaṃ + anuyutta)
Antonym kāyabhāvanānuyogamanuyutta
Sanskrit citta + bhāvanā + anuyoga + anuyukta

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, bho gotama, evaṃ hoti, addhā bhoto gotamassa sāvakā cittabhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharanti, no kāyabhāvanan'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
cittamaññāya

ger. knowing one's mind; reading one's thoughts [cittaṃ + aññāya] ✓

Grammar ger, comp vb
Meaning knowing one's mind; reading one's thoughts
Construction cittaṃ + aññāya
Compound comp verb (cittaṃ + aññāya)
Commentary (APAa) cittam'aññāya citt'ācāraṃ ñatvā
Sanskrit cittam + ājñāya

Example

atha kho āyasmato anuruddhassa etadahosi, aho vat'imā devatā sabbā'va nīlā assu nīlavaṇṇā nīlavatthā nīl'ālaṅkārā'ti. atha kho tā devatā āyasmato anuruddhassa cittam'aññāya sabbāva nīlā ahesuṃ nīlavaṇṇā nīlavatthā nīl'ālaṅkārā.

AN 8.46 anuruddhasuttaṃ
cittamana

adj. with (this) thought in mind; thinking (thus) [citta + mana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with (this) thought in mind; thinking (thus)
Construction citta + mana
Compound kammadhāraya (citta + mana)
Commentary (VINa) iti cittamano'ti yaṃ cittaṃ taṃ mano, yaṃ mano taṃ cittaṃ. (VINa) iti cittamano'ti iticitto itimano, mataṃ te jīvitā seyyo'ti ettha vuttamaraṇacitto maraṇamano'ti attho.
Sanskrit citta + manas

Example

iti cittamano cittasaṅkappo anekapariyāyena maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

VIN PAT PA 3 manussaviggahasikkhāpadaṃ
cittamassa

sandhi. his mind [citta + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + pron
Meaning his mind
Construction citta + assa
Sanskrit citta + asya

Example

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.

AN 5.202 dhammassavanasuttaṃ
cittamidaṃ

sandhi. this mind [citta + idaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + pron
Meaning this mind
Construction citta + idaṃ
Sanskrit citta + idam

Example

ropetva rukkhāni yathā phal'esī,
mūle taruṃ chettu tam'eva icchasi,
tath'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ karosi,
yaṃ maṃ aniccamhi cale niyuñjasi.

ind. as one's intentions; in accordance with one's thoughts; satisfactorily(?) ✗
cittalata

Grammar adj, comp, from cittalatā

cittalatā + a

Example

tapanīyakatā'va dhītikā,
vicarasi cittalat'eva accharā,
kāsikasukhumehi vaggubhi,
sobhasī suvasanehi n'ūpame.

masc. Chapter 2 of the Vimānavatthu (VV 18-28) ✗

Example

sakalaṃ lumbinīvanaṃ cittalatāvanasadisaṃ, mah'ānubhāvassa rañño susajjitaṃ āpānamaṇḍalaṃ viya ahosi.

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā
cittalatāvimānavatthu

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ
cittaviveka

masc. seclusion of the mind, mental solitude ✗
cittavisuddhattha

masc. for the sake of mental purity; for the purpose of purification of the mind [citta + visuddhi + attha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning for the sake of mental purity; for the purpose of purification of the mind
Construction citta + visuddhi + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cittavisuddhiyā + attha)
Sanskrit citta + viśuddhi + artha

Examples

kiṃ pan'āvuso, cittavisuddh'atthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, āvuso, sīlavisuddhi yāva'd'eva cittavisuddh'atthā, cittavisuddhi yāva'd'eva diṭṭhivisuddh'atthā, diṭṭhivisuddhi yāva'd'eva kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddh'atthā

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

fem. mental purity; purification of the mind [citta + visuddhi] ✓

Construction citta + visuddhi

Examples

kiṃ pan'āvuso, cittavisuddh'atthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

kiṃ pan'āvuso, cittavisuddhi anupādāparinibbānan'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

masc. mental distinction [citta + visesa] ~

Meaning mental distinction
Construction citta + visesa
cittavīthi

cittavūpakāsa

masc. mental seclusion; mental isolation [citta + vūpakāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mental seclusion; mental isolation
Construction citta + vūpakāsa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cittassa + vūpakāsa)

Sanskrit citta + vyavakarṣaṇa

Examples

tathārūpānaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena vūpakaṭṭho viharati, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena sampādeti, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
cittavūpasama

masc. calming the mind; settling the mind [citta + vūpasama] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning calming the mind; settling the mind
Construction citta + vūpasama
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cittassa + vūpasama)
Commentary (SNa) cittavūpasamassa cā'ti aṭṭhasamāpattivasena cittavūpasamaṃ sikkheyya.
Sanskrit citta + vyupaśama

Examples

subhāsitassa sikkhetha,
samaṇ'ūpāsanassa ca,
ek'āsanassa ca raho,
cittavūpasamassa cā'ti.

SN 2.1 paṭhamakassapasuttaṃ

dullabhaṃ v'āpi labhanti,
cittavūpasame ratā,
yesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
bhāvanāya rato mano'ti.

SN 2.6 kāmadasuttaṃ
cittavodāna

nt. purification of mind; mental cleansing [citta + vodāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning purification of mind; mental cleansing
Construction citta + vodāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cittassa + vodāna)
Antonym cittasaṃkilesa
Sanskrit citta + vyavadāna

Example

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, abhikkhaṇaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, dīgharattam'idaṃ cittaṃ saṅkiliṭṭhaṃ rāgena dosena mohenā'ti. cittasaṅkilesā, bhikkhave, sattā saṅkilissanti. cittavodānā sattā visujjhanti.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
cittasaṅkappa

masc. intention in mind; purpose in mind [citta + saṅkappa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning intention in mind; purpose in mind
Construction citta + saṅkappa
Compound kammadhāraya (citta + saṅkappa)
Commentary (VIN 1.1.3) cittasaṅkappo'ti maraṇasaññī maraṇacetano maraṇ'ādhippāyo.
Sanskrit citta + saṃkalpa

Examples

iti cittamano cittasaṅkappo anekapariyāyena maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

VIN PAT PA 3 manussaviggahasikkhāpadaṃ

cittasaṅkappo'ti maraṇasaññī maraṇacetano maraṇ'ādhippāyo.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiya pārājikaṃ
cittasaṅkilesa

masc. defilement of mind; mental impurity [citta + saṅkilesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning defilement of mind; mental impurity
Construction citta + saṅkilesa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cittassa + saṅkilesa)
Variant cittasaṃkilesa
Commentary (SNa) cittasaṃkilesā'ti sunhātā'pi hi sattā cittasaṃkilesen'eva saṃkilissanti, malaggahitasarīrā'pi cittassa vodānattā visujjhanti.
Sanskrit citta + saṃkleśa

Example

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, abhikkhaṇaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, dīgharattam'idaṃ cittaṃ saṅkiliṭṭhaṃ rāgena dosena mohenā'ti. cittasaṅkilesā, bhikkhave, sattā saṅkilissanti. cittavodānā sattā visujjhanti.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
cittasaṅkhara

masc. mental motive force; mental activity ✗
cittasaṅkhāra

masc. mental activity; thought formation; (comm) feeling and perception [citta + saṅkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mental activity; thought formation; (comm) feeling and perception
Construction citta + saṅkhāra
Compound kammadhāraya (citta + saṅkhārā)
Commentary (MNa) cittasaṅkhārā'ti saññāvedanā.
Sanskrit citta + saṃskāra

Examples

yv'āyaṃ, āvuso, mato kālaṅ'kato tassa kāyasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, vacīsaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, cittasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, āyu parikkhīṇo, usmā vūpasantā, indriyāni paribhinnāni.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

cittasaṅkhārappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, cittasaṅkhārappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
cittasaṅkhārapaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing mental activity; observing thought formation; sensitive to the mental processes; (comm) conscious of feeling and perception [citta + saṅkhāra + paṭisaṃvedī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning experiencing mental activity; observing thought formation; sensitive to the mental processes; (comm) conscious of feeling and perception
Construction citta + saṅkhāra + paṭisaṃvedī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cittasaṅkhāre + paṭisaṃvedī)
Commentary (VISM) cittasaṅkhāro'ti vedan'ādayo dve khandhā.
Sanskrit citta + saṃskāra + pratisaṃvedin

Example

cittasaṅkhārapaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, cittasaṅkhārapaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati. passambhayaṃ cittasaṅkhāraṃ assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, passambhayaṃ cittasaṅkhāraṃ passasissāmī'ti sikkhati.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
cittasaṅkhārappaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing mental activities [cittasaṅkhāra + paṭisaṃvedī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning experiencing mental activities
Construction cittasaṅkhāra + paṭisaṃvedī
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cittasaṅkhāre + paṭisaṃvedī)
Sanskrit citta + saṃskāra + pratisaṃvedin

Example

cittasaṅkhārappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, cittasaṅkhārappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
cittasantāna

masc. mental continuum ✗
cittasantāpa

masc. sorrow ✗
cittasamatha

masc. collectedness of thought ✗
cittasamādhāna

nt. fixing; stilling of thoughts; profound meditation ✗
cittasamādhi

Meaning mental composure; stillness of mind
Construction citta + samādhi
cittasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgata

Meaning comprised of mental composure based on thought and active effort

Variant cittasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgata
Sanskrit citta + samādhi + praṇidhāna + saṃskāra + samanvāgata

Example

so chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, vīriyasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, cittasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, vīmaṃsāsamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, ussoḷhī'y'eva pañcamī.

MN 16 cetokhilasuttaṃ
cittasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgata

Example

SN 51.15 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ
cittasamuṭṭhāna

cittasambhūtajātaka

nt. Jātaka 498 (JA 498) ✗
cittasaṃkilesa

masc. defilement of mind; mental impurity [citta + saṃkilesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning defilement of mind; mental impurity
Construction citta + saṃkilesa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cittassa + saṃkilesa)
Variant cittasaṅkilesa
Commentary (SNa) cittasaṃkilesā'ti sunhātā'pi hi sattā cittasaṃkilesen'eva saṃkilissanti, malaggahitasarīrā'pi cittassa vodānattā visujjhanti.
Sanskrit citta + saṃkleśa

Example

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, abhikkhaṇaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, dīgharattam'idaṃ cittaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ rāgena dosena mohenā'ti. cittasaṃkilesā, bhikkhave, sattā saṃkilissanti. cittavodānā sattā visujjhanti.

cittassūpasama

masc. calming of the mind; stilling of the heart; tranquillity of mind [cittassa + upasama] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning calming of the mind; stilling of the heart; tranquillity of mind
Construction cittassa + upasama
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cittassa + upasama)
Commentary (THa) cittass'ūpasame ratan'ti cittassa upasamahetubhūte sabbasaṅkhārasamathe, nibbāne, abhirataṃ. (MNa) cittass'ūpasame ratan'ti paṭhamajjhānena pañca nīvaraṇāni vūpasametvā, dutiyajjhānena vitakkavicāre, tatiyajjhānena pītiṃ, catutthajjhānena sukhadukkhaṃ vūpasametvā tasmiṃ cittass'ūpasame rataṃ abhirataṃ.
Sanskrit cittasya + upaśama

Example

manussabhūtaṃ sambuddhaṃ,
attadantaṃ samāhitaṃ,
iriyamānaṃ brahmapathe,
cittass'ūpasame rataṃ.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā
cittassekagga

nt. unification of mind; mental oneness [cittassa + ekagga] ~

Meaning unification of mind; mental oneness

cittassekaggatā

fem. unification of mind; mental oneness [cittassa + ekaggatā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning unification of mind; mental oneness

Commentary (ADHa) cittass'ekaggatā'ti cittassa ekaggabhāvo, samādhiss'etaṃ nāmaṃ.
cittahatthisāriputtaupasampadā

fem. the ordination of Citta, the elephant trainer's son ✗
cittahatthisāriputtapoṭṭhapādavatthu

nt. the story of Citta, the elephant trainer's son, and Poṭṭhapāda ✗
cittahetu

ind. on a whim; impulsively; lit. sake of mind [citta + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning on a whim; impulsively; lit. sake of mind
Construction citta + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cittassa + hetu)
Commentary (THa) cittahetū'ti ekadā nigaṇṭho, ekadā paribbājak'ādiko honto anavaṭṭhitacitto puriso viya cittavasiko hutvā.
Sanskrit citta + hetu

Example

n'āhaṃ alakkhyā ahirikkatāya vā,
na cittahetū na ca dūrakantanā,
ājīvahetū ca ahaṃ na nikkhamiṃ,
kato ca te citta paṭissavo mayā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
cittaṃ ārādheti

idiom. (+dat) is pleasing (to); is acceptable (to); appeals (to); lit. satisfies the mind ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr (+dat)
Meaning is pleasing (to); is acceptable (to); appeals (to); lit. satisfies the mind
Commentary (MNa) cittaṃ ārādhetī'ti cittaṃ sampādeti, paripūreti gaṇhāti pasādetī'ti attho.
Sanskrit cittam + ārādhayati

Example

so anattantapo aparantapo diṭṭh'eva dhamme nicchāto nibbuto sītībhūto sukhappaṭisaṃvedī brahmabhūtena attanā viharati, ayam'eva me puggalo cittaṃ ārādhetī'ti.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ

idiom. the thought should be aroused; the mind should be inclined; lit. mind should be caused to arise ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + ptp
Meaning the thought should be aroused; the mind should be inclined; lit. mind should be caused to arise
Sanskrit citta + utpādayitavya

Examples

tasmā't'iha, cunda, pare vihiṃsakā bhavissanti, mayam'ettha avihiṃsakā bhavissāmā'ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

evaṃ jānanten'āvuso, bhikkhunā na pāpiccho bhavissāmi, na pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato'ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

MN 15 anumānasuttaṃ
cittaṃ uppādeti

idiom. sets the intention; determines; lit. generates the mind ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr
Meaning sets the intention; determines; lit. generates the mind

Examples

sikkhitā kho pana hoti. kām'aññe bhikkhū sikkhantu vā mā vā, aham'ettha sikkhissāmī'ti cittaṃ uppādeti.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

vāhī kho pana hoti. kām'aññe assā vahantu vā mā vā, aham'ettha vahissāmī'ti cittaṃ uppādeti.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
cittaṃ nārādheti

idiom. (+dat) is not pleasing (to); is not acceptable (to); does not appeal (to); lit. does not satisfy the mind ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr, neg (+dat)
Meaning is not pleasing (to); is not acceptable (to); does not appeal (to); lit. does not satisfy the mind
Sanskrit cittam + na + ārādhayati

Example

yv'āyaṃ, bhante, puggalo attantapo attaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ayaṃ me puggalo cittaṃ n'ārādheti. yopāyaṃ, bhante, puggalo parantapo paraparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ayam'pi me puggalo cittaṃ n'ārādheti.

yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave ... citte citt'ānupassī, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ

Example

tayā sudantena avaṭṭhitena hi,
hayena yogg'ācariyo'va ujjunā,
pahomi maggaṃ paṭipajjituṃ sivaṃ,
citt'ānurakkhīhi sadā nisevitaṃ.

cittika

nt. small painting; little picture; little artwork [√citt + a + ika] ✓

Grammar nt, from citta
Meaning small painting; little picture; little artwork
Root Family √citt
Root √citt･8 *e (paint, design)
Construction √citt + a + ika
citta + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Sanskrit citraka
Sanskrit Root √cit √citraya 10 (make variegated)

Example

yathā haritālena makkhitaṃ,
addasa cittikaṃ bhittiyā kataṃ,
tamhi te viparītadassanaṃ,
saññā mānusikā niratthikā.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
cittita

pp. designed; created; devised [√citt + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of citteti
Meaning designed; created; devised
Root Family √citt
Root √citt･8 *e (paint, design)
Construction √citt + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (SNa) citten'eva cittitan'ti cittakārena cintetvā katattā cittena cintitaṃ nāma.
Sanskrit citrita
Sanskrit Root √cit √citraya 10 (make variegated)

Examples

diṭṭhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, caraṇaṃ nāma cittan'ti? evaṃ, bhante. tam'pi kho, bhikkhave, caraṇaṃ nāma cittaṃ citten'eva cittitaṃ. tena'pi kho, bhikkhave, caraṇena cittena cittaññ'eva cittataraṃ.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekanikāyam'pi samanupassāmi evaṃ cittaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā, te'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā citten'eva cittitā, tehi'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatehi pāṇehi cittaññ'eva cittataraṃ.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
cittiṃ katvāna

citt'uppādam'pi kho ahaṃ, cunda, kusalesu dhammesu bahukāraṃ vadāmi, ko pana vādo kāyena vācāya anuvidhīyanāsu.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
cittūpahāra

citte cittānupassī viharati

idiom. one remains within the mind, closely observing the mind ~

Grammar idiom, nt + adj + pr
Meaning one remains within the mind, closely observing the mind
Commentary (PM) [ga] kathaṃ citte citt'ānupassī viharati? idh'ekacco sarāgaṃ cittaṃ aniccato anupassati, no niccato … paṭinissajjati, no ādiyati. aniccato anupassanto niccasaññaṃ pajahati … paṭinissajjanto ādānaṃ pajahati. imehi sattahi ākārehi cittaṃ anupassati. cittaṃ upaṭṭhānaṃ, no sati.
cittekagga

masc. concentration of thought ✗
cittekaggatā

fem. mental unification; oneness of mind [citta + ekaggatā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning mental unification; oneness of mind
Construction citta + ekaggatā

Commentary (MNa) avikkhepalakkhaṇā citt'ekaggatā'ti
Sanskrit citta + ekāgratā

Example

paṭhamaṃ kho, āvuso, jhānaṃ pañc'aṅgikaṃ. idh'āvuso, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa bhikkhuno vitakko ca vattati, vicāro ca pīti ca sukhañ'ca citt'ekaggatā ca.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

cittekaggatālābha

masc. gaining mental unification; attaining oneness of mind ✗

Meaning pleasure of mental unification; happiness of unity of mind

cittekaggamatta

masc. degree of mental unity ✗
citra 1.1

nt. beautiful thing; delightful thing; something wonderful; (comm) various sense objects [√cit + ra] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning beautiful thing; delightful thing; something wonderful; (comm) various sense objects
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 a (mark)
Construction √cit + ra
Derivative kita (ra)
Commentary (SNa) citrānī'ti ārammaṇacittāni.
Sanskrit citra
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

n'ete kāmā yāni citrāni loke,
saṅkapparāgo purisassa kāmo,
tiṭṭhanti citrāni tath'eva loke.
ath'ettha dhīrā vinayanti chandan'ti.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
citra 1.2

adj. varied; different; diverse [√cit + ra] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning varied; different; diverse
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 a (mark)
Construction √cit + ra
Derivative kita (ra)
Synonym citta
Commentary (SNPa) rūp'ādianekappakāravasena citrā.
Sanskrit citra
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

kāmā hi citrā madhurā manoramā,
aviddasū yattha sitā puthujjanā,
te dukkham'icchanti punabbhav'esino,
cittena nītā niraye nirākatā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
citra 1.3

adj. decorated; beautiful; adorned [√cit + ra] ~

Grammar adj
Meaning decorated; beautiful; adorned
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 a (mark)
Construction √cit + ra
Derivative kita (ra)
Synonym citta
Sanskrit citra
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)
citra 1.4

nt. painting, picture [√cit] ✗
citra 1.5

masc. name of a month; March-April [√cit] ✗
citra 2.1

nt. mind, thought [√cit] ✗
citraka

adj. various; different kinds of; diverse [√cit + ra + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from citra
Meaning various; different kinds of; diverse
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 a (mark)
Construction √cit + ra + ka
citra + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (ANa) kaṇḍacitrakānī'ti saralaṭṭhi-sararajju-sarapāsāda-sarasāṇi-sarapokkharaṇi-sarapadumānī'ti anekāni kaṇḍehi kattabbacitrāni.
Sanskrit citraka
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

seyyathā'pi, sāḷha, yodh'ājīvo bahūni ce'pi kaṇḍacitrakāni jānāti, atha kho so tīhi ṭhānehi rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgan't'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati. katamehi tīhi? dūrepātī ca, akkhaṇavedhī ca, mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

AN 4.196 sāḷhasuttaṃ
citrachada

adj. with colourful plumage; with beautiful feathers [citra + chada] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with colourful plumage; with beautiful feathers
Construction citra + chada
Compound kammadhāraya (citra + chada)
Sanskrit citra + chada

Example

nanu ahaṃ citta tay'āmhi yācito,
giribbaje citrachadā vihaṅgamā,
mahindaghosatthanit'ābhigajjino,
te taṃ ramessanti vanamhi jhāyinaṃ.

Synonym cesa, ceso, cetaṃ, cimaṃ, etañca, imañca, panesā

acchariyaṃ, āvuso sāriputta, abbhutaṃ, āvuso sāriputta! yāvasubhāsitaṃ c'idaṃ āyasmatā sāriputtena.

cinanta

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā
cintanaka 1

adj. considerate, thoughtful [√cint] ✗

masc. thinker [√cint] ✗

fem. (+acc) thinking (about); reflecting (over) [√cint] ✗
cintayati

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning thinks (about); reflects (on)
Root Family √cint
Root √cint･8 *aya (think)

Construction cintaya + ti
Synonym cinteti
Sanskrit cintayati
Sanskrit Root √cint 10 (think)

Examples

alīnacitto ca siyā,
na c'āpi bahu cintaye,
nirāmagandho asito,
brahmacariyaparāyaṇo.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

sāsan'atthaṃ samuddiṭṭhaṃ,
may'ākhyātaṃ samāsato,
sakaṃ buddhivisesena,
cintayantu vicakkhaṇā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa
cintayanta

prp. (+acc) thinking (about); reflecting (on) [√cint + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of cintayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning thinking (about); reflecting (on)
Root Family √cint
Root √cint･8 *aya (think)
Base √cint + aya > cintaya
Construction cintaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym cintayamāna
Sanskrit cintayat
Sanskrit Root √cint 10 (think)

Example

atha tvaṃ pavitakkam'āgamā,
manasā diṭṭhigatāni cintayanto,
dhonena yugaṃ samāgamā,
na hi tvaṃ sakkhasi sampayātave'ti.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
cintayamāna

prp. (+acc) thinking (about); reflecting (on) [√cint + *aya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of cinteti, trans (+acc)
Meaning thinking (about); reflecting (on)
Root Family √cint
Root √cint･8 *aya (think)

Construction cintaya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym cintayanta
Sanskrit cintyamāna
Sanskrit Root √cint 10 (think)

Example

idha, bhikkhu, paṇḍito mahāpañño n'ev'attabyābādhāya ceteti na parabyābādhāya ceteti na ubhayabyābādhāya ceteti attahita-parahita-ubhayahita-sabbalokahitam'eva cintayamāno cinteti

BV 2 sumedha patthanā kathā
cintasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.8 (SN56.8) ✗
cintā

fem. thought; speculation; conjecture [√cint + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from cinteti
Meaning thought; speculation; conjecture
Root Family √cint
Root √cint･8 *e (think)
Construction √cint + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Commentary (ANa) lokacintā'ti kena nu kho candimasūriyā katā, kena mahāpathavī, kena mahāsamuddo, kena sattā uppāditā, kena pabbatā, kena ambatālanāḷiker'ādayo'ti evarūpā lokacintā.
Sanskrit cintā
Sanskrit Root √cint 10 (think)

Example

lokacintā, bhikkhave, acinteyyā, na cintetabbā, yaṃ cintento ummādassa vighātassa bhāgī assa.

masc. wish-fulfilling gem ✗

cintita 1

nt. thought; reflection; contemplation; consideration [√cint + ita] ✓

Grammar nt, in comps, pp of cinteti
Meaning thought; reflection; contemplation; consideration
Root Family √cint
Root √cint･8 *e (think)
Construction √cint + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (MNa) sucintitacintī'tiādīni c'ettha manosucarit'ādīnaṃ vasena yojetabbāni.
Sanskrit cintita
Sanskrit Root √cint 10 (think)

Example

tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, paṇḍitassa paṇḍitalakkhaṇāni paṇḍitanimittāni paṇḍit'āpadānāni. katamāni tīṇi? idha, bhikkhave, paṇḍito sucintitacintī ca hoti subhāsitabhāsī ca sukatakammakārī ca.

MN 129 bālapaṇḍitasuttaṃ
cintita 2

pp. thought; devised; invented; imagined [√cint + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of cinteti
Meaning thought; devised; invented; imagined
Root Family √cint
Root √cint･8 *e (think)
Construction √cint + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (MNa) samalehi cintito'ti samalehi chahi satthārehi cintito.
Sanskrit cintita
Sanskrit Root √cint 10 (think)

Examples

pāturahosi magadhesu pubbe,
dhammo asuddho samalehi cintito,
apāpuretaṃ amatassa dvāraṃ,
suṇantu dhammaṃ vimalen'ānubuddhaṃ.

pāturahosi magadhesu pubbe,
dhammo asuddho samalehi cintito,
apāpur'etaṃ amatassa dvāraṃ,
suṇantu dhammaṃ vimalen'ānubuddhaṃ.

VINa 1.V.15 buddhāciṇṇakathā

seṭṭhi, sace me dhītā vijāyissati, tāya naṃ saddhiṃ nivesetvā seṭṭhiṭṭhānassa sāmikaṃ karissāmi. sace me putto vijāyissati, māressāmi nan'ti cintetvā taṃ gehe kāresi.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
cintenta

cimilikā 2

Antonym acira
Sanskrit cira

Examples

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso sakamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā ciravippavuttho assa.

cirakata

Meaning done long ago
Construction cira + kata

Sanskrit cira + kṛta

Example

saddhassa hi, bhante, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ yaṃ satimā bhavissati, paramena satinepakkena samannāgato, cirakatam'pi cirabhāsitam'pi saritā anussaritā.

cirakālaṃ

ciraṭṭhitatthaṃ

ciraṭṭhitika

adj. long lasting; enduring; lit. long standing [cira + ṭhitika] ✓

Meaning long lasting; enduring; lit. long standing
Construction cira + ṭhitika
Compound kammadhāraya (cira + ṭhitika)
Sanskrit cirasthitika

Examples

addhānakkhamo hoti, padhānakkhamo hoti, app'ābādho hoti, asitaṃ pītaṃ khāyitaṃ sāyitaṃ sammā pariṇāmaṃ gacchati, caṅkam'ādhigato samādhi ciraṭṭhitiko hoti. ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca caṅkame ānisaṃsā'ti.

AN 5.29 caṅkamasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pāsāṇe lekhā na khippaṃ lujjati vātena vā udakena vā, ciraṭṭhitikā hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco puggalo abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati. so ca khv'assa kodho dīgharattaṃ anuseti.

ciraṭṭhitisutta

ciratta

nt. long duration ✗
cirattaṃ

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for a long time; for an extended duration
Construction cira + ratta + aṃ
ciraratta > ciratta + aṃ
Phonetic Change rara > ra (contraction)
Commentary (ANa) cirattaṃ anutapissatī'ti cirarattaṃ socissati.
Sanskrit cira + rātra

Example

idha ce naṃ virādheti,
saddhammassa niyāmataṃ,
vāṇijo'va atīt'attho,
cirattaṃ anutapissati.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ
ciranisinna

Meaning sitting for a long time; long seated
Construction cira + nisinna

Sanskrit cira + niṣaṇṇa

Example

atha kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante paṭhame yāme, uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, abhikkantā, bhante, ratti, nikkhanto paṭhamo yāmo, ciranisinno bhikkhusaṅgho.

AN 8.20 uposathasuttaṃ
ciranissina

adj. having sat for a long time ✗
cirapaṭikā

ind. for a long time; long since [cira + paṭika + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, comp, abl sg of cirapaṭika
Meaning for a long time; long since
Construction cira + paṭika + ā
cirapaṭika + ā
Commentary (DNa) cirapaṭik'āhaṃ, bhante'ti cirato ahaṃ, cirato paṭṭhāy'āhaṃ dassanakāmo'ti attho.
Sanskrit cirāt + ?pratigā, ?pratikṛ

Example

cirapaṭikā-ahaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamitu'kāmo, n'atthi ca me kāyasmiṃ tāvatikā balamattā, yāvat'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkameyyan'ti

SN 22.87 vakkalisuttaṃ
cirapabbajita

adj. ordained long ago; of long standing as a monastic [cira + pabbajita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning ordained long ago; of long standing as a monastic
Construction cira + pabbajita
Compound kammadhāraya (cira + pabbajita)
Antonym acirapabbajita, nava
Commentary (ANa) ciraṃ pabbajitānaṃ etesan'ti cirapabbajitā.
Sanskrit cira + pravrājita

Example

ye'pi kho te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā jiṇṇā vuḍḍhā mahallakā addhagatā vayoanuppattā therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇ'ācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
cirappanaṭṭha 1

Meaning long lost; long separated
Construction cira + panaṭṭha
cirappanaṭṭha 2

adj. long disappeared ✗
cirappavāsī

adj. who has lived abroad for a long time; who is long absent from home [cira + pavāsī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has lived abroad for a long time; who is long absent from home
Construction cira + pavāsī
Compound kammadhāraya > bahubbīhi (cira + pavāsī)
Sanskrit cirapravāsin

Example

cirappavāsiṃ purisaṃ,
dūrato sotthim'āgataṃ,
ñātimittā suhajjā ca,
abhinandanti āgataṃ.

DHP 219 piyavaggo
cirabhāsita

adj. said long ago [cira + bhāsita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning said long ago
Construction cira + bhāsita
Compound kammadhāraya (cira + bhāsita)
Commentary (SNa) cirabhāsitan'ti asukasmiṃ ṭhāne asukaṃ nāma bhāsitan'ti evaṃ cirakāle bhāsitaṃ.
Sanskrit cira + bhāṣita

Example

saddhassa hi, bhante, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ yaṃ satimā bhavissati, paramena satinepakkena samannāgato, cirakatam'pi cirabhāsitam'pi saritā anussaritā.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
cirarattasamāhita

Construction ciraratta + samāhita

adj. restrained for a long time; self-moderated for an extended period [ciraratta + saṃvuta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning restrained for a long time; self-moderated for an extended period
Construction ciraratta + saṃvuta
Sanskrit cirarātra + saṃvṛta

Example

yāc'īdha mātā bhaginī sakhī'ti ca,
dāsī ca bhariyā'ti ca sā pavuccati,
sīle ṭhitattā cirarattasaṃvutā,
kāyassa bhedā sugatiṃ vajanti tā'ti.

AN 7.63 bhariyāsuttaṃ
cirarattaṃ

ind. for a long time [cira + ratta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of ciraratta
Meaning for a long time
Construction cira + ratta + aṃ
ciraratta + aṃ
Synonym ciraṃ, cirāya, dīghamaddhānaṃ, dīgharattaṃ
Sanskrit cirarātram

Examples

cirarattaṃ vat'ātāpī,
dhammaṃ anuvicintayaṃ,
samaṃ cittassa n'ālatthaṃ,
pucchaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇe.

TH 250 telakānittheragāthā

ye keci ariyaṃ dhammaṃ,
vigarahantā caranti dummedhā,
upenti roruvaṃ ghoraṃ,
cirarattaṃ dukkhaṃ anubhavanti.

cirasanthuta

cirassa

ind. after a long time; lit. of long [cira + ssa] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, gen sg of cira
Meaning after a long time; lit. of long
Construction cira + ssa
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit cirasya

Example

acir'ūpasampanno kho pan'āyasmā kassapo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto na cirass'eva, yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.

DN 8 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
cirassamāgata

adj. returned after a long time; come back at long last [cirassaṃ + āgata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning returned after a long time; come back at long last
Construction cirassaṃ + āgata
Sanskrit cirasya + āgata

Example

yāc'īdha disvāna patiṃ pamodati,
sakhī sakhāraṃ'va cirassam'āgataṃ,
koleyyakā sīlavatī patibbatā,
yā evarūpā purisassa bhariyā,
sakhī ca bhariyā'ti ca sā pavuccati. sakhī sakhāraṃva cirassamāgataṃ.

AN 7.63 bhariyāsuttaṃ
cirassaṃ

ind. at long last; long time since; after a long time [cira + ssa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, gen sg of cira, irreg
Meaning at long last; long time since; after a long time
Construction cira + ssa + aṃ
cirassa + aṃ
Commentary (SNa) cirassan'ti cirassa kālassa accayenā'ti attho.
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit cirasya

Examples

cirassaṃ vata passāmi,
brāhmaṇaṃ parinibbutaṃ,
appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhaṃ,
tiṇṇaṃ loke visattikan'ti.

SN 1.1 oghataraṇasuttaṃ

etu kho, bhante, bhagavā. svāgataṃ, bhante, bhagavato. cirassaṃ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṃ pariyāyam'akāsi, yadidaṃ idh'āgamanāya

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
cirassuta

adj. long time since one heard; ages since hearing [cira + suta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning long time since one heard; ages since hearing
Construction cira + suta
Compound kammadhāraya (cira + suta)
Sanskrit cira + śruta

Example

cirassutā no, āvuso ānanda, bhagavato sammukhā dhammī kathā. sādhu mayaṃ, āvuso ānanda, labheyyāma bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṃ kathaṃ savanāyā'ti.

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning after a very long time
Construction cirassa + eva
Commentary (UDa) na cirassevā'ti kammaṭṭhān'ārambhato na ciren'eva.
Sanskrit cirasya + eva

Example

acir'ūpasampanno kho pan'āyasmā kassapo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto na cirass'eva, yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.

DN 8 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
ciraṃ

ind. for a long time [cira + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of cira
Meaning for a long time
Construction cira + aṃ
Antonym aciraṃ
Synonym cirarattaṃ, cirāya, dīghamaddhānaṃ, dīgharattaṃ
Commentary (THa) ciraṃ dīgham'addhānaṃ
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit ciram

Examples

evaṃ bho purisa jānāhi,
pāpadhammā asaññatā,
mā taṃ lobho adhammo ca,
ciraṃ dukkhāya randhayuṃ.

DHP 248 malavaggo

ciraṃ jīva mahāvīra,
kappaṃ tiṭṭha mahāmune,
sabbalokassa atthāya,
bhavassu ajarāmaro.

API 17 mahāpajāpatigotamītherīapadānaṃ
cirāciraṃ

ind. after a long time; after a long interval [ciraṃ + cira + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, from cira
Meaning after a long time; after a long interval
Construction ciraṃ > cirā + cira + aṃ
cirācira + aṃ
Phonetic Change aṃ > ā
Commentary (JAa) cirāciran'ti cirakālaṃ vītināmetvā ciraṃ na gacche na upasaṅkameyya.
Sanskrit cira + aciram

Example

tasmā n'ābhikkhaṇaṃ gacche,
na ca gacche cirāciraṃ,
kālena yācaṃ yāceyya,
evaṃ mittā na jīyare.

JA 528 mahābodhi jātakaṃ
cirāya

ind. for a long time [cira + āya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, dat sg of cira
Meaning for a long time
Construction cira + āya
Synonym ciraṃ, cirarattaṃ, dīghamaddhānaṃ, dīgharattaṃ
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit cirāya

Example

tasiṇāya purakkhatā pajā,
parisappanti saso'va bādhito,
saṃyojanasaṅgasattakā,
dukkham'upenti punappunaṃ cirāya.

DHP 342 taṇhāvaggo
cirāyati

pr. (+acc) tarries, delays [cira] ✗

cīvara

nt. robe; cloth; robe-cloth; lit. rags ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning robe; cloth; robe-cloth; lit. rags
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.1) cīvaraṃ nāma channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ, vikappan'upagaṃ pacchimaṃ.
Non IA cīrai (Tamil)
Sanskrit cīvara

Examples

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, santuṭṭhā bhavissāma itarītarena cīvarena, itarītaracīvarasantuṭṭhiyā ca vaṇṇavādino, na ca cīvarahetu anesanaṃ appatirūpaṃ āpajjissāma.

SN 16.1 santuṭṭhasuttaṃ

yesañ'ca mayaṃ cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāma, tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā

VIN PAT PC 32 gaṇabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ

tatth'āyaṃ samayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 46 cārittasikkhāpadaṃ
cīvarakāraka

adj. robe-making [cīvara + kāraka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning robe-making
Construction cīvara + kāraka
Commentary (VINa) cīvarakārake bhikkhū bhattena nimantentī'ti gāme piṇḍāya caritvā cirena cīvaraṃ niṭṭhāpente disvā evaṃ lahuṃ niṭṭhāpetvā cīvaraṃ paribhuñjissantī'ti puññakāmatāya nimantenti.
cīvarakārasamaya

masc. time of making robes; occasion of robe-making [cīvara + kāra + samaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning time of making robes; occasion of robe-making
Construction cīvara + kāra + samaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cīvarakārassa + samaya)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.4.2) cīvarakārasamayo nāma cīvare kayiramāne. cīvarakārasamayo'ti bhuñjitabbaṃ.
Sanskrit cīvara + kāra + samaya

Examples

tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāv'ābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 32 gaṇabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ

tatth'āyaṃ samayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 46 cārittasikkhāpadaṃ
cīvarakālasamaya

masc. time of the robe-season; suitable time (for accepting) robe material [cīvara + kāla + samaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning time of the robe-season; suitable time (for accepting) robe material
Construction cīvara + kāla + samaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cīvarakālassa + samaya)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.3.8) cīvarakālasamayo nāma anatthate kathine vassānassa pacchimo māso, atthate kathine pañcamāsā.
Sanskrit cīvara + kāla + samaya

Examples

accekaṃ maññamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭiggahetvā yāva cīvarakālasamayaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ. tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 28 accekacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ

paramparabhojane aññatra samayā pācittiyaṃ. tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 33 paramparabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ
cīvarakuṭi

fem. hut made of cloth; tent [cīvara + kuṭi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning hut made of cloth; tent
Construction cīvara + kuṭi
cīvaracetāpana

nt. something to be exchanged for robe material; purchase price for robe material ✗
cīvaracetāpanna

nt. robe-fund; account for robe-cloth; lit. robe exchange [cīvara + cetāpanna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning robe-fund; account for robe-cloth; lit. robe exchange
Construction cīvara + cetāpanna
Compound catutthī tappurisa (cīvarassa + cetāpanna)
Variant cīvaracetāpana
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.8) cīvaracetāpannaṃ nāma hiraññaṃ vā suvaṇṇaṃ vā muttā vā maṇi vā pavāḷo vā phaliko vā paṭako vā suttaṃ vā kappāso vā.
Sanskrit cīvara + cetanaka (bsk)

Example

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī'ti

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ
cīvaratthāya

ind. for robes; lit. for the sake of robe cloth [cīvara + attha + āya] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for robes; lit. for the sake of robe cloth
Construction cīvara + attha + āya
cīvarattha + āya
cīvaratthika

adj. wanting a robe; needing robe-cloth [cīvara + atthika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wanting a robe; needing robe-cloth
Construction cīvara + atthika
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cīvaraṃ + atthika)
Sanskrit cīvara + arthika

Example

so ce dūto taṃ bhikkhuṃ evaṃ vadeyya, atthi pan'āyasmato koci veyyāvaccakaro'ti. cīvar'atthikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā veyyāvaccakaro niddisitabbo ārāmiko vā upāsako vā, eso kho, āvuso, bhikkhūnaṃ veyyāvaccakaro'ti.

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ
cīvaradāna

nt. offering robes; giving robe-cloth [cīvara + dāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning offering robes; giving robe-cloth
Construction cīvara + dāna
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cīvare + dāna)
Sanskrit cīvara + dāna

Examples

tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāv'ābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 32 gaṇabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ

tatth'āyaṃ samayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 46 cārittasikkhāpadaṃ
cīvaradānasamaya

masc. time of offering robes; occasion of giving robe-cloth [cīvara + dāna + samaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning time of offering robes; occasion of giving robe-cloth
Construction cīvara + dāna + samaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cīvaradānassa + samaya)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.4.2) cīvaradānasamayo nāma anatthate kathine vassānassa pacchimo māso, atthate kathine pañcamāsā. cīvaradānasamayo'ti bhuñjitabbaṃ.
Sanskrit cīvara + dāna + samaya

Examples

tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāv'ābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 32 gaṇabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ

paramparabhojane aññatra samayā pācittiyaṃ. tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

Meaning rule about offering robes; Pācittiya 25
Construction cīvaradāna + sikkhāpada
cīvaradussa

nt. cloth for robes ✗
cīvaradhāraṇa

nt. wearing of the (ascetic's) robe; keeping a robe ✗
cīvaranidahaka

adj. (one) who keeps or stores the material for robes ✗

nt. rule about exchanging robes [cīvara + parivattana + sikkhāpada] ~

Meaning rule about exchanging robes
Construction cīvara + parivattana + sikkhāpada
cīvarapaviveka

masc. solitude (from mental defilement) regarding robes [cīvara + paviveka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning solitude (from mental defilement) regarding robes
Construction cīvara + paviveka
Commentary (ANa) cīvarapavivekan'ti cīvaraṃ nissāya uppajjanakakilesehi vivittabhāvaṃ. sesadvaye'pi es'eva nayo.
cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsana

nt. robes, alms-food and dwellings [cīvara + piṇḍapāta + senāsana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning robes, alms-food and dwellings
Construction cīvara + piṇḍapāta + senāsana
Compound dvanda (cīvara ca piṇḍapāta ca senāsana ca)
Sanskrit cīvara + piṇḍapāta + śayanāsana
cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra

masc. robes, alms-food, dwellings, support for the sick and medical requisites [cīvara + piṇḍapāta + senāsana + gilānapaccaya + bhesajja + parikkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning robes, alms-food, dwellings, support for the sick and medical requisites
Construction cīvara + piṇḍapāta + senāsana + gilānapaccaya + bhesajja + parikkhāra
Compound dvanda (cīvara ca piṇḍapāta ca senāsana ca gilānapaccaya ca bhesajjaparikkhāra)
Variant cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra
Sanskrit cīvara + piṇḍapāta + śayanāsana + glānapratyaya + bheṣaja + pariṣkāra

Example

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anavasesadohī hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ saddhā gahapatikā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavārenti cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānapaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārehi. tatra bhikkhu mattaṃ na jānāti paṭiggahaṇāya. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anavasesadohī hoti.

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānuppadānatthaṃ

ind. to provide robes, alms-food, dwellings, support for the sick and medical requisites; lit. for the sake of providing .... [cīvara + piṇḍapāta + senāsana + gilānapaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra + anuppadāna + attha + aṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning to provide robes, alms-food, dwellings, support for the sick and medical requisites; lit. for the sake of providing ....
Construction cīvara + piṇḍapāta + senāsana + gilānapaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra + anuppadāna + attha + aṃ
Sanskrit cīvara + piṇḍapāta + śayanāsana + glānapratyaya + bheṣaja + pariṣkāra + anupradāna + artham
cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra

masc. robes, alms-food, dwellings, support for the sick and medical requisites [cīvara + piṇḍapāta + senāsana + gilānappaccaya + bhesajja + parikkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning robes, alms-food, dwellings, support for the sick and medical requisites
Construction cīvara + piṇḍapāta + senāsana + gilānappaccaya + bhesajja + parikkhāra
Compound dvanda (cīvara ca piṇḍapāta ca senāsana ca gilānappaccaya ca bhesajjaparikkhāra)
Variant cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra
Sanskrit cīvara + piṇḍapāta + śayanāsana + glānapratyaya + bheṣaja + pariṣkāra

Examples

ahaṃ kho'mhi lābhī cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na lābhino cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārānan'ti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

upanissāya viharatī'ti tattha paṭibaddhā honti cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārā

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu

ind. for the sake of robes, alms-food, dwellings, support for the sick and medical requisites [cīvara + piṇḍapāta + senāsana + gilānappaccaya + bhesajja + parikkhāra + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, comp
Meaning for the sake of robes, alms-food, dwellings, support for the sick and medical requisites
Construction cīvara + piṇḍapāta + senāsana + gilānappaccaya + bhesajja + parikkhāra + hetu
Compound abyayībhāva (cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra + hetu)
Sanskrit cīvara + piṇḍapāta + śayanāsana + glānapratyaya + bheṣaja + pariṣkāra + hetu

Example

n'āhaṃ taṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ suvaco'ti vadāmi yo cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhāra-hetu suvaco hoti, sovacassataṃ āpajjati. taṃ kissa hetu?

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
cīvarabhājaka

masc. (one) who distributes material for robes ✗
cīvarabhisī

fem. roll for robes ✗
cīvararajju

fem. rope for hanging the robes ✗
cīvaralābha

adj. gaining a robe; acquiring a robe [cīvara + lābha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning gaining a robe; acquiring a robe
Construction cīvara + lābha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cīvaraṃ + lābha)
Sanskrit cīvara + lābha

Example

navaṃ pana bhikkhunā cīvaralābhena tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ ādātabbaṃ, nīlaṃ vā kaddamaṃ vā kāḷasāmaṃ vā.

VIN PAT PC 58 dubbaṇṇakaraṇasikkhāpadaṃ
cīvaralesa

masc. robe as a pretext [cīvara + lesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning robe as a pretext
Construction cīvara + lesa
Compound kammadhāraya (cīvara + lesa)
Commentary (VINa) cīvaraleso nāma gahapaticīvaradharo diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto. aññaṃ gahapaticīvaradharaṃ passitvā codeti, gahapaticīvaradharo mayā diṭṭho.
Sanskrit cīvara + leśa

Example

kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāyā'ti leso nāma dasa lesā, jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, sen'āsanaleso.

cīvarasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.182 (AN5.182) ✗
cīvarahetu

ind. for the sake of a robe [cīvara + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of a robe
Construction cīvara + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cīvarassa + hetu)
Sanskrit cīvara + hetu

Examples

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, att'ādhipateyyaṃ? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho pan'āhaṃ cīvarahetu agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, santuṭṭhā bhavissāma itarītarena cīvarena, itarītaracīvarasantuṭṭhiyā ca vaṇṇavādino, na ca cīvarahetu anesanaṃ appatirūpaṃ āpajjissāma.

SN 16.1 santuṭṭhasuttaṃ
cīvarādithutivacanatthaṃ

ind. for the sake of robes, etc. and words of praise ✗
cīvarāsā

fem. desire for a robe; wish for cloth [cīvara + āsā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning desire for a robe; wish for cloth
Construction cīvara + āsā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (cīvare + āsā)
Commentary (VINa) asukasmiṃ nāma kule cīvaraṃ labhissāmī'ti yā cīvar'āsā uppannā hoti
Sanskrit cīvara + āśā

Example

niṭṭhitacīvarasmin'ti bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ kataṃ vā hoti naṭṭhaṃ vā vinaṭṭhaṃ vā daḍḍhaṃ vā cīvar'āsā vā upacchinnā.

VIN 1.4.1.2 udositasikkhāpadaṃ
cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjati

idiom. causes an alteration to the robe; suggests an improvement of the robe ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + masc + pr
Meaning causes an alteration to the robe; suggests an improvement of the robe
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.8) cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyyā'ti āyataṃ vā hotu vitthataṃ vā appitaṃ vā saṇhaṃ vā.
Sanskrit cīvare + vikalpam + āpadyate

Examples

tatra ce so bhikkhu pubbe appavārito upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya, sādhu vata maṃ āyasmā iminā cīvaracetāpannena evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādehī'ti

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpeyya, tatra ce so bhikkhu pubbe appavārito tantavāye upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya

VIN PAT NP 27 mahāpesakārasikkhāpadaṃ
cujjamāna

prp. being pressed to repay (a debt); lit. being charged [√cud + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of cujjati, pass, intrans
Meaning being pressed to repay (a debt); lit. being charged
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 ya (impel, accuse)
Base √cud + ya > cujja (pass)
Construction cujja + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Sanskrit codyamāna
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Example

yo have iṇam'ādāya,
cujjamāno palāyati,
na hi te iṇamatthī'ti,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
cuṇṇa 1

nt. powder; spice powder [√cuṇṇ + a] ✓

Grammar nt, in comps, from cuṇṇeti
Meaning powder; spice powder
Root Family √cuṇṇ
Root √cuṇṇ･8 *e (grind, crush, powder)
Construction √cuṇṇ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit cūrṇa
Sanskrit Root √cūrṇ 10 (powder)

Examples

dibbāni'pi candanacuṇṇāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṃ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.

DN 16.27 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

kuladūsako'ti kulāni dūseti pupphena vā phalena vā cuṇṇena vā mattikāya vā dantakaṭṭhena vā veḷuyā vā vejjikāya vā jaṅghapesanikena vā.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
cuṇṇa 2

nt. soap; lit. powder [√cuṇṇ + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from cuṇṇeti
Meaning soap; lit. powder
Root Family √cuṇṇ
Root √cuṇṇ･8 *e (grind, crush, powder)
Construction √cuṇṇ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit cūrṇa
Sanskrit Root √cūrṇ 10 (powder)

Example

nahāyeyyā'ti cuṇṇena vā mattikāya vā nahāyati, payoge payoge dukkaṭaṃ. nahānapariyosāne, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.6.7 nahānasikkhāpadaṃ
cuṇṇaka

nt. scented powder [√cuṇṇ] ✗
cuṇṇakacālanī

fem. sieve ✗
cuṇṇakajāta

adj. crumbled to dust; become powder [cuṇṇaka + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning crumbled to dust; become powder
Construction cuṇṇaka + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (cuṇṇaka + jāta)
Commentary (DNa) cuṇṇakajātānī'ti cuṇṇaṃ cuṇṇaṃ hutvā vippakiṇṇāni. sabbattha so imam'evā'ti vuttanayena khajjamān'ādīnaṃ vasena yojanā kātabbā.
Sanskrit cūrṇaka + jāta

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikāni pūtīni cuṇṇakajātāni

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cuṇṇakamakkhita

adj. smeared with powder ✗
cuṇṇacālanī

fem. strainer ✗

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning lump of powder; ball of soap
