Examples

nānappakārakaṃ nāma cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārā, antamaso cuṇṇapiṇḍo'pi dantakaṭṭham'pi dasikasuttam'pi.

VIN 1.4.2.10 kayavikkayasikkhāpadaṃ

piṇḍapāto nāma yāgu'pi bhattam'pi khādanīyam'pi cuṇṇapiṇḍo'pi dantakaṭṭham'pi dasikasuttam'pi, antamaso dhammam'pi bhaṇati.

VIN 1.4.3.7 mahāpesakārasikkhāpadaṃ
cuṇṇavicuṇṇa

adj. crushed to bits, smashed ✗
cuṇṇita

pp. ground, powdered, crushed [√cuṇṇ] ✗
cuṇṇiya

adj. fragmentary, short ✗
cuṇṇiyapada

nt. short quotation ✗
cuṇṇīyati

pr. is ground [√cuṇṇ] ✗
cuṇṇeti

pr. grinds, powders, crushes [√cuṇṇ] ✗
cuṇṇetvā

abs. having ground, having powdered, having crushed [√cuṇṇ] ✗
cuṇṇenta

prp. grinding, powdering [√cuṇṇ] ✗
cuṇṇesi

aor. ground, powdered, crushed [√cuṇṇ] ✗
cuta 1.1

pp. passed away; died [√cu + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of cavati
Meaning passed away; died
Root Family √cu
Root √cu･1 a (shift, fall away, die)
√ In Comps ccu
Construction √cu + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym accuta
Notes cutāse is masc nom pl
Sanskrit cyuta
Sanskrit Root √cyu 1 (move, stir)

Examples

sattānaṃ cuta-upapāta-ñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

kāmesu giddhā pasutā pamūḷhā,
avadāniyā te visame niviṭṭhā,
dukkh'ūpanītā paridevayanti,
kiṃ'sū bhavissāma ito cutāse.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
cuta 1.2

pp. shifted; fallen; fallen down [√cu + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of cavati
Meaning shifted; fallen; fallen down
Root Family √cu
Root √cu･1 a (shift, fall away, die)
√ In Comps ccu
Construction √cu + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym accuta
Sanskrit cyuta
Sanskrit Root √cyu 1 (move, stir)

Examples

addasā kho, bhikkhave, so puriso bahunnaṃ vassānaṃ bahunnaṃ vassasatānaṃ bahunnaṃ vassasahassānaṃ accayena dibbaṃ cakkaratanaṃ osakkitaṃ ṭhānā cutaṃ

DN 26.2 cakkavattisuttaṃ

sace cuto sīlavatato hoti,
pavedhatī kamma virādhayitvā,
pajappatī patthayatī ca suddhiṃ,
satthā'va hīno pavasaṃ gharamhā.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
cuta 2.1

pp. incited, reproved, accused [√cud] ✗
cuti

fem. falling away; passing away; death [√cu + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from cavati
Meaning falling away; passing away; death
Root Family √cu
Root √cu･1 a (shift, fall away, die)
√ In Comps ccu
Construction √cu + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Antonym upapatti
Sanskrit cyuti
Sanskrit Root √cyu 1 (move, stir)

Examples

yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvitindriyassa upacchedo, idaṃ vuccati maraṇaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā jarādhammā jaraṃ anatītā'ti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
cuticitta

nt. death consciousness, last thought moment of life ✗
cutipaṭisandhi

fem. passing away and connecting with the next incarnation; death and conception [cuti + paṭisandhi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning passing away and connecting with the next incarnation; death and conception
Construction cuti + paṭisandhi
cutūpapāta

masc. falling and arising; death and rebirth [cuti + upapāta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning falling and arising; death and rebirth
Construction cuti + upapāta
Compound dvanda (cuti ca upapāta ca)
Sanskrit cyutopapāda

Examples

nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

UD 74 catutthanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā cakkhunā sacchikaraṇīyā? sattānaṃ cut'ūpapāto, bhikkhave, cakkhunā sacchikaraṇīyo.

AN 4.189 sacchikaraṇīyasuttaṃ
cutūpapātañāṇa

nt. knowledge of death and rebirth; lit. knowledge of falling and arising [cuti + upapāta + ñāṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning knowledge of death and rebirth; lit. knowledge of falling and arising
Construction cuti + upapāta + ñāṇa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cutūpapātassa + ñāṇa)
Commentary (DNa) cut'ūpapātañāṇaṃ cutipaṭisandhicchādakaṃ tamaṃ vijjhati, tañ'ca viditaṃ karotī'ti vijjā.
Sanskrit cyutopapāda + jñāna

Example

sattānaṃ cut'ūpapātañāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

Meaning understanding of falling and arising; knowledge of death and rebirth

cuttari

sandhi. and further; and furthermore [ca + uttari] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adv
Meaning and further; and furthermore
Construction ca + uttari
Sanskrit ca + uttarin

Examples

kati chinde kati jahe,
kati c'uttari bhāvaye,
kati saṅg'ātigo bhikkhu,
oghatiṇṇo'ti vuccatī'ti.

SN 1.5 katichindasuttaṃ

pañca chinde pañca jahe,
pañca c'uttari bhāvaye,
pañca saṅg'ātigo bhikkhu,
oghatiṇṇo'ti vuccati.

DHP 370 bhikkhuvaggo
cudakā

sandhi. and from the water [ca + udakā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + nt
Meaning and from the water
Construction ca + udakā
Commentary (THIa) uppalaṃ c'udakā samuggatan'ti ca-kāro nipātamattaṃ, udakato uggataṃ uṭṭhitaṃ accuggamma ṭhitaṃ suphullam'uppalaṃ.
Sanskrit ca + udakāt

Example

uppalaṃ c'udakā samuggataṃ,
yathā taṃ amanussasevitaṃ,
evaṃ tvaṃ brahmacārinī,
sakesaṅgesu jaraṃ gamissasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
cudita

pp. accused; rebuked; charged [√cud + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of codeti
Meaning accused; rebuked; charged
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *e (impel, accuse)
Construction √cud + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Sanskrit codita
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Example

cudito vacībhi satim'ābhinande,
sabrahmacārīsu khilaṃ pabhinde,
vācaṃ pamuñce kusalaṃ n'ātivelaṃ,
janavādadhammāya na cetayeyya.

curādigaṇa

masc. (gram) √cur etc. group; group 8 roots which take the conjugational sign *e and *aya [cura + ādi + gaṇa] ✓

cūḷā

fem. crest; plume; lock of hair ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning crest; plume; lock of hair
Sanskrit cūḍā

Example

bindu cūḷāmaṇ'ākāro,
niggahītan'ti vuccate,
kevalass'āppayogattā,
akāro sannidhīyate.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
cūḷāmaṇi

masc. diadem; crown; ornamental headdress; lit. jewel on the crest [cūḷā + maṇi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning diadem; crown; ornamental headdress; lit. jewel on the crest
Construction cūḷā + maṇi
Compound kammadhāraya (cūḷā + maṇi)
Sanskrit cūḍāmaṇi

Example

bindu cūḷāmaṇi-akāro,
niggahītan'ti vuccate,
kevalass'āppayogattā,
akāro sannidhīyate.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa

card. eighty four (84) [catu + asīti] ~

Phonetic Change catur > cūḷ
Compound dvanda (catu ca asīti ca)
Variant caturāsīti, cullāsīti
Sanskrit caturaśīti

cūḷupaṭṭhāka

masc. minor attendant [cūḷa + upaṭṭhāka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning minor attendant
Construction cūḷa + upaṭṭhāka
ce 1

ind. if ✓

Grammar ind, cond
Meaning if
Synonym sace
Sanskrit ced

Examples

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.

DHP 1 yamakavaggo

kāmaṃ kāmayamānassa,
tassa ce taṃ samijjhati,
addhā pītimano hoti,
laddhā macco yadicchati.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1
ce 2

ind. but; than ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning but; than
Sanskrit ced

Example

dummedhehi pasaṃsā ca,
viññūhi garahā ca yā,
garahāva seyyo viññūhi,
yaṃ ce bālappasaṃsanā.

TH 245 godattattheragāthā
ceke

sandhi. and some [ca + eke] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning and some
Construction ca + eke
Synonym appeke
Sanskrit ca + eke

Example

evam'etaṃ mahāvīra,
yathā samaṇa bhāsasi,
ettha c'eke visīdanti,
paṅkamhi'va jaraggavo.

TH 263 mahāmoggallānattheragāthā
cecca

ind. intentionally; purposefully [√cit + *ya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, ger of cinteti
Meaning intentionally; purposefully
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Construction √cit > cet + *ya
Phonetic Change i > e
ty > cc
Synonym sasaṅkhārena
Commentary (VINa) ceccā'ti vadhakacetanāvasena cetetvā pakappetvā.
Sanskrit cintya
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

sañciccā'ti jānanto sañjānanto cecca abhivitaritvā vītikkamo

VIN 1.1.3 tatiya pārājikaṃ
ceṭa

masc. servant boy ✗
ceṭaka

masc. servant; worthless person; bastard [√ciṭ + *aka] ✓

Grammar masc, derog, dimin of ceṭa
Meaning servant; worthless person; bastard
Root Family √ciṭ
Root √ciṭ×1 a (send, abuse)
Construction √ciṭ > ceṭ + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change i > e
Notes (The Jataka, Vol. III, tr. by H.T. Francis and R.A. Neil, 1897) beggarly vagabond
Sanskrit ceṭaka
Sanskrit Root √ciṭ 1 (send out)

Example

kacchapo, yadi maṃ sahāyakā nenti, tumhākaṃ ettha kiṃ hoti, duṭṭhaceṭakā'ti

cetana

adj. (+gen) having intention (to); with will (to) [√cit + *anā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from ceteti (+gen)
Meaning having intention (to); with will (to)
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Construction √cit > cet + *anā + a
cetanā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cetana
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

cittasaṅkappo'ti maraṇasaññī maraṇacetano maraṇ'ādhippāyo.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
cetanā

fem. intending; willing [√cit + *anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from ceteti
Meaning intending; willing
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Construction √cit > cet + *anā
Derivative kita (*anā)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cetanā
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, nāmarūpaṃ? vedanā, saññā, cetanā, phasso, manasikāro, idaṃ vuccati nāmaṃ. cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāyarūpaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

atha kho, bhikkhave, tassa purisassa ārakā'v'assa cetanā ārakā patthanā ārakā paṇidhi

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
cetanākaraṇīyasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.2 (AN10.2) ✗
cetanākaraṇīyasutta 2

cetanākāyā

masc. categories of intentions; classes of volitional thoughts [cetanā + kāya + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning categories of intentions; classes of volitional thoughts
Construction cetanā + kāya + ā
cetanākāya + ā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cetanānaṃ + kāyā)
Sanskrit cetanā + kāya

Example

katame ca, bhikkhave, saṅkhārā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, cetanākāyā, rūpasañcetanā, saddasañcetanā, gandhasañcetanā, rasasañcetanā, phoṭṭhabbasañcetanā, dhammasañcetanā.

cetanāhaṃ

sandhi. I (say) intention; I (say) volition; lit. I thought [cetanā + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, fem + pron
Meaning I (say) intention; I (say) volition; lit. I thought
Construction cetanā + ahaṃ
Sanskrit cetanā + aham

Example

cetan'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, kammaṃ vadāmi. cetayitvā kammaṃ karoti, kāyena vācāya manasā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
cetapariccañāṇa

nt. knowledge encompassing, comprehending, thoughts (of others) ✗
cetapariya

nt. encompassing, comprehension, of the thoughts (of others) ✗
cetapariyañāṇa

nt. knowledge (that is) encompassing, comprehending, thoughts (of others) ✗
cetapariyāya

masc. way of thought; manner of thinking ✗
cetapharaṇatā

fem. suffusing or pervading the thoughts of others ✗
cetayati 1

pr. (+dat) gives thought (to); cares (about); has concern (for) [√cit + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+dat)
Meaning gives thought (to); cares (about); has concern (for)
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *aya (think, intend)
Base √cit + *aya > cetaya
Construction cetaya + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cetayati
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

cudito vacībhi satim'ābhinande,
sabrahmacārīsu khilaṃ pabhinde,
vācaṃ pamuñce kusalaṃ n'ātivelaṃ,
janavādadhammāya na cetayeyya.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
cetayati 2

pr. (+dat) thinks (about); intends (to) [√cit + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+dat)
Meaning thinks (about); intends (to)
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *aya (think, intend)
Base √cit + *aya > cetaya
Construction cetaya + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant veṭhayati
Sanskrit cetayati
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

na ve aggi cetayati,
ahaṃ bālaṃ ḍahāmī'ti,
bālo ca jalitaṃ aggiṃ,
āsajja naṃ sa ḍayhati.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
cetayamāna

prp. (+dat) thinking (about); having mental activity [√cit + *aya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of ceteti, intrans (+dat)
Meaning thinking (about); having mental activity
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *aya (think, intend)
Base √cit + *aya > cetaya
Construction cetaya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym acetayamāna
Sanskrit cetayamāna
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

yato kho, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu idha sakasaññī hoti, so tato amutra tato amutra anupubbena saññ'aggaṃ phusati. tassa saññ'agge ṭhitassa evaṃ hoti, cetayamānassa me pāpiyo, acetayamānassa me seyyo.

DN 9.3 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, sahetukasaññuppādanirodhakathā

aor. perceived, thought [√cit] ✗
cetayita

pp. perceived, thought [√cit] ✗

abs. having willed; having intended; lit. having thought [√cit + *aya + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of cetayati, intrans
Meaning having willed; having intended; lit. having thought
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *aya (think, intend)
Base √cit + *aya > cetaya
Construction cetaya + itvā

Synonym cetetvā
Sanskrit cetayitvā
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

cetan'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, kammaṃ vadāmi. cetayitvā kammaṃ karoti, kāyena vācāya manasā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
cetarahi

sandhi. and now; and at present; lit. and this day [ca + etarahi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adv
Meaning and now; and at present; lit. and this day
Construction ca + etarahi
Sanskrit ca + etarhi

Example

na c'āhu na ca bhavissati,
na c'eta'r'ahi vijjati,
ek'antaṃ nindito poso,
ek'antaṃ vā pasaṃsito.

DHP 228 kodhavaggo
cetavasippatta

adj. who has become in control of his thoughts, who has attained mastery over his thoughts ✗
cetavimutta

adj. whose thoughts are freed or free (from defilement or obstruction) in or through advanced stages of meditation ✗
cetavimutti

fem. freeing or freedom of thought (from defilement or obstruction) by advanced stages of meditation (a state attained temporarily in meditation and permanently with arahantship ✗
cetavimuttī

adj. whose thoughts are freed or free (in or through advanced stages of meditation) ✗
cetavivaṭṭa

masc. turning away of the thoughts ✗
cetavivaraṇasappāya

adj. beneficial for clearing the thoughts of obstructions ✗
cetas

masc. mind; thought; intention [√cit + *as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group, from ceteti
Meaning mind; thought; intention
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Construction √cit > cet + *as
Derivative kita (*as)
Phonetic Change i > e
Notes ceto in comps
Sanskrit cetas
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

so sace ākaṅkhati, parasattānaṃ parapuggalānaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajāneyyaṃ

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

te'dha bhikkhū aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetaso samannāharitvā ohitasotā dhammaṃ suṇanti

UD 73 tatiya nibbāna paṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ
cetasa

adj. with mind; having mind [√cit + *as + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from cetas
Meaning with mind; having mind
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Construction √cit > cet + *as + a
cetas + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cetaḥ
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe adhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe n'ādhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
cetasa ceto paricca

idiom. grasping, comprehending the thoughts (of others) with one's own thoughts ✗
cetasā

masc. with mind; by mind; with thought; with intention [√cit + *as + ā] ✓

Grammar masc, instr sg of cetas, mano group
Meaning with mind; by mind; with thought; with intention
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Construction √cit > cet + *as + ā
cetas + ā
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cetasā
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

dhammapīti sukhaṃ seti,
vippasannena cetasā,
ariyappavedite dhamme,
sadā ramati paṇḍito.

DHP 79 paṇḍitavaggo

so mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
cetasā ceto paricca

idiom. having encompassed (another’s) mind with (one’s) mind ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + masc + ger
Meaning having encompassed (another’s) mind with (one’s) mind

Example

atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno sabbāvantaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ cetasā ceto paricca manas'ākāsi

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
cetasika 1

adj. mental; related to mind [√cit + *as + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from cetas
Meaning mental; related to mind
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Construction √cit > cet + *as + ika
cetas + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym kāyika
Commentary (ANa) cetasikā'ti manodvāraṃ khobhayamānā. (DSṭ) cetasi niyuttā, cetasā saṃsaṭṭhā vā cetasikā.
Sanskrit cetasika
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, kumāra, api nu tassa gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā uppajjeyyuṃ rāgajā pariḷāhā kāyikā vā cetasikā vā yehi so rāgajehi pariḷāhehi pariḍayhamāno dukkhaṃ sayeyyā'ti? evaṃ, bhante'ti.

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ

n'atthi cetasikaṃ dukkhaṃ,
anapekkhassa gāmaṇi,
atikkantā bhayā sabbe,
khīṇasaṃyojanassa ve.

Grammar nt, abstr, comp

cetaso 1

masc. for (one having such a) mind [√cit + *as + o] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps, dat sg of cetas, mano group
Meaning for (one having such a) mind
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Construction √cit > cet + *as + o
cetas + o
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cetase
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

anavassutacittassa,
ananvāhatacetaso,
puññapāpapahīnassa,
n'atthi jāgarato bhayaṃ.

DHP 39 cittavaggo
cetaso 2

masc. of mind [√cit + *as + o] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of cetas, mano group
Meaning of mind
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Construction √cit > cet + *as + o
cetas + o
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cetasaḥ
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

kāmacchando, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo. byāpādo, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo.

AN 5.51 āvaraṇasuttaṃ

samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, etha tumhe, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjh'aṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā'ti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
cetaso parivitakko

idiom. train of thought; state of mind; mental process ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + masc
Meaning train of thought; state of mind; mental process
Sanskrit cetas + parivitarka

Examples

idha mayhaṃ, āvuso, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi, ariyo tuṇhībhāvo, ariyo tuṇhībhāvo'ti vuccati.

SN 21.1 kolitasuttaṃ

atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi

DN 14.10 mahāpadānasuttaṃ
cetasovinibaddha

nt. shackle of the mind; fetter of the heart [cetaso + vinibaddha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning shackle of the mind; fetter of the heart
Construction cetaso + vinibaddha
cetasovinibandha

masc. shackle of the mind; fetter of the heart [cetaso + vinibandha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning shackle of the mind; fetter of the heart
Construction cetaso + vinibandha
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cetaso + vinibandha)
Variant cetasovinibaddha, cetovinibaddha
Commentary (MNa) cetaso vinibandhā'ti cittaṃ bandhitvā muṭṭhiyaṃ katvā viya gaṇhantī'ti cetaso vinibandhā
Sanskrit cetasaḥ + vinibandha

Example

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pañca cetokhilā appahīnā, pañca cetasovinibandhā asamucchinnā, so vat'imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

MN 16 cetokhilasuttaṃ
cetasovinibandhasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.72 (AN9.72) ✗
cetasovinibandhasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.82 (AN9.82) ✗
cetasovinibandhasutta 3

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.92 (AN9.92) ✗
cetasovipariyāsa

masc. out of one's mind, mental derangement ✗
cetaṃ 1

sandhi. and this [ca + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning and this
Construction ca + etaṃ
Synonym cesa, ceso, cidaṃ, cimaṃ, etañca, imañca, panesā
Sanskrit ca + etam

Example

yo c'etaṃ sahate jammiṃ,
taṇhaṃ loke duraccayaṃ,
sokā tamhā papatanti,
udabindu'va pokkharā.

DHP 336 taṇhāvaggo
cetaṃ 2

sandhi. if this [ce + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning if this
Construction ce + etaṃ
Synonym imañce
Sanskrit ced + etam

Examples

yassa c'etaṃ samucchinnaṃ,
mūlaghaccaṃ samūhataṃ,
sa ve divā vā rattiṃ vā,
samādhim'adhigacchati.

DHP 250 malavaggo

akusalaṃ, bhikkhave, pajahatha. sakkā, bhikkhave, akusalaṃ pajahituṃ. no c'etaṃ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa akusalaṃ pajahituṃ, n'āhaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, akusalaṃ, bhikkhave, pajahathā'ti.

AN 2.19 adhikaraṇavaggo
cetā 1.1

sandhi. and these [ca + etā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning and these
Construction ca + etā
Synonym panete, panimāni
Sanskrit ca + etāḥ

Example

yattha c'etā nirujjhanti,
maggañ'ca khayagāminaṃ,
vedanānaṃ khayā bhikkhu,
nicchāto parinibbuto'ti.

SN 36.1 samādhisuttaṃ
cetā 1.2

sandhi. and these woman [ca + esā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning and these woman
Construction ca + esā
Commentary (THa) yo cetā'ti yo pana puggalo etā itthiyo tattha chandarāgassa vikkhambhanena vā samucchindanena vā attano pādena sappassa siraṃ viya parivajjeti, so sabbaṃ lokaṃ visajitvā ṭhitattā loke visattikāsaṅkhātaṃ taṇhaṃ sato hutvā samativattati.
Sanskrit ca + eṣā

Example

yo c'etā parivajjeti,
sappass'eva padā siro.
so'maṃ visattikaṃ loke,
sato samativattati.

TH 223 sabbakāmittheragāthā
cetā 2.1

masc. name of a people [ceta] ✗
cetāpaka

masc. exchanger; trader [√cit + *āpe + aka] ~

Grammar masc, agent, from cetāpeti, caus
Meaning exchanger; trader
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 *āpe (mark)
Base √cit + *āpe > cetāpe (caus)
Construction cetāpe + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cetanaka (price) (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)
cetāpana

nt. exchanging; basis for exchange or purchase; asking for [√cit] ✗
cetāpanā

fem. exchanging; basis for exchange or purchase; asking for [√cit] ✗
cetāpanna

nt. fund; account; lit. exchanging; bartering [√cit + *āpe + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from cetāpeti, caus
Meaning fund; account; lit. exchanging; bartering
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 *āpe (mark)
Base √cit + *āpe > cetāpe (caus)
Construction cetāpe + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant cetāpana
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.8) cīvaracetāpannaṃ nāma hiraññaṃ vā suvaṇṇaṃ vā muttā vā maṇi vā pavāḷo vā phaliko vā paṭako vā suttaṃ vā kappāso vā.
Sanskrit cetanaka (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī'ti

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ
cetāpita

pp. asked for; exchanged; bought [√cit] ✗
cetāpetabba

ptp. should be swapped; should be exchanged; should be traded; lit. to be caused to exchange [√cit + *āpe + tabba] ~

Grammar ptp of cetāpeti, caus
Meaning should be swapped; should be exchanged; should be traded; lit. to be caused to exchange
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 *āpe (mark)
Base √cit + *āpe > cetāpe (caus)
Construction cetāpe + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)
cetāpeti

pr. (+acc and +dat) swops (for); exchanges (for); trades (for); buy (for) [√cit + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of √cit, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning swops (for); exchanges (for); trades (for); buy (for)
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 *āpe (mark)
Base √cit + *āpe > cetāpe (caus)
Construction cetāpe + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cetayati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu ūnapañcabandhanena pattena aññaṃ navaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 22 ūnapañcabandhanasikkhāpadaṃ

pubbe appavārito'ti pubbe avutto hoti, kīdisena te, bhante, cīvarena attho, kīdisaṃ te cīvaraṃ cetāpemī'ti?

VIN 1.4.1.8 upakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ
cetāpetukāma

adj. wishing to buy [cetāpetuṃ + kāma] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wishing to buy
Construction cetāpetuṃ + kāma
Commentary (VINa) mah'agghaṃ cetāpetu'kāmassa appagghaṃ cetāpetī'ti gahapatissa vīsatiagghanakaṃ cīvaraṃ cetāpetu'kāmassa alaṃ mayhaṃ etena, das'agghanakaṃ vā aṭṭh'agghanakaṃ vā dehī'ti vadati anāpatti.
cetāpetuṃ

inf. (+acc and +dat) to swap (for); to exchange (for); to trade (for); to buy [√cit + *āpe + tuṃ] ~

Grammar inf of cetāpeti, caus, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning to swap (for); to exchange (for); to trade (for); to buy
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 *āpe (mark)
Base √cit + *āpe > cetāpe (caus)
Construction cetāpe + tuṃ
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (VINa) mah'agghaṃ cetāpetu'kāmassa appagghaṃ cetāpetī'ti gahapatissa vīsatiagghanakaṃ cīvaraṃ cetāpetu'kāmassa alaṃ mayhaṃ etena, das'agghanakaṃ vā aṭṭh'agghanakaṃ vā dehī'ti vadati anāpatti.
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)
cetāpetvā

abs. (+acc) having exchanged; having bartered; having traded; having bought [√cit + *āpe + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of cetāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having exchanged; having bartered; having traded; having bought
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 *āpe (mark)
Base √cit + *āpe > cetāpe (caus)
Construction cetāpe + tvā
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.8) cetāpetvā'ti parivattetvā.
Sanskrit cetayati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī'ti

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ

sādhu vata maṃ āyasmā iminā cīvaracetāpannena evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādehī'ti kalyāṇakamyataṃ upādāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ
cetāpenta

prp. (+acc) swapping; exchanging; trading [√cit + *āpe + nta] ~

Grammar prp of cetāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning swapping; exchanging; trading
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･1 *āpe (mark)
Base √cit + *āpe > cetāpe (caus)
Construction cetāpe + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cetayat (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √cit 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)
cetiya

nt. pagoda; stupa; burial mound; shrine [√ci + ti + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, from citi
Meaning pagoda; stupa; burial mound; shrine
Root Family √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Construction √ci > ce + ti + *ya
citi + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit caitya
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Examples

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati gotamake cetiye. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca.

AN 3.126 gotamakacetiyasuttaṃ

niyyānikaṃ vata buddhasāsanan'ti pasīditvā yojanikaṃ suvaṇṇacetiyaṃ kambalakañcukena parikkhipitvā tattha tattha rathacakkappamāṇehi suvaṇṇapadumehi alaṅ'kari.

ANa 1.14.1 mahākassapatthera vatthu
cetiyagabbha

masc. dome of a pagoda ✗
cetiyaghara

nt. pagoda building [cetiya + ghara] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning pagoda building
Construction cetiya + ghara
cetiyaṅgaṇa

nt. pagoda courtyard; area around a stupa [cetiya + aṅgaṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning pagoda courtyard; area around a stupa
Construction cetiya + aṅgaṇa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cetiyassa + aṅgaṇa)
Sanskrit caitya + aṅgaṇa

Example

paṭipadāya na saṇṭhātī'ti paṭipattiyaṃ na tiṭṭhati, vattaṃ ajānitvā apucchitabbaṭṭhāne pucchatī'ti attho. ayaṃ pañho nāma cetiy'aṅgaṇe pucchitena na kathetabbo, tathā bhikkhācāramagge gāmaṃ piṇḍāya caraṇakāle.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā
cetiyaṅgaṇabodhiyaṅgaṇavatta

Grammar nt, comp

Construction cetiyaṅgaṇa + bodhiyaṅgaṇa + vatta
cetiyaṅgaṇasammajjana

nt. sweeping the pagoda courtyard [cetiyaṅgaṇa + sammajjana] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning sweeping the pagoda courtyard
Construction cetiyaṅgaṇa + sammajjana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cetiyaṅgaṇaṃ + sammajjana)
Sanskrit caitya + aṅgaṇa + sammārjana
cetiyacārikā

fem. pilgrimage to a pagoda; journey to a sacred place [cetiya + cārikā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning pilgrimage to a pagoda; journey to a sacred place
Construction cetiya + cārikā
Commentary (DNa) tattha cetiyacārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā'ti ye ca tāva tattha tattha cetiy'aṅgaṇaṃ sammajjantā, āsanāni dhovantā bodhimhi udakaṃ siñcantā āhiṇḍanti, tesu vattabbam'eva n'atthi asukavihāre cetiyaṃ vandissāmā'ti nikkhamitvā pasannacittā antarā kālaṅkarontā'pi anantarāyena sagge patiṭṭhahissanti yevā'ti dasseti.
Sanskrit caitya + cārikā
cetiyajātaka

nt. Jātaka 422 (JA 422) ✗

Meaning devotional offering to a pagoda

masc. tree that is an object of veneration, sacred tree ✗

Meaning to worship a shrine; lit. for the purpose of paying respect to a shrine

cetiyavandanattha + āya
cetiyavaṃsā

masc. people from Ceta and Vaṃsa ✗
cetiyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 51.10 (SN51.10) ✗
cetiyā

masc. name of the people from Ceta [ceta] ✗
cetivaṃsā

masc. people of Ceta and Vaṃsa ✗
cetī

masc. name of the people from Ceta [ceta] ✗
cete

sandhi. but (where) these [ca + ete] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning but (where) these
Construction ca + ete
Sanskrit ca + ete

Example

sadevakassa lokassa,
ete vo sukhasammatā,
yattha c'ete nirujjhanti,
taṃ nesaṃ dukkhasammataṃ.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
ceteti 1

pr. (+dat) thinks (about) [√cit + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+dat)
Meaning thinks (about)
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Base √cit + *e > cete
Construction cete + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cintayati
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

phuṭṭho, bhikkhave, vedeti, phuṭṭho ceteti, phuṭṭho sañjānāti. itth'ete'pi dhammā calā c'eva byathā ca aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino.

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ
ceteti 2

pr. (+dat) intends; will (to) [√cit + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+dat)
Meaning intends; will (to)
Root Family √cit
Root √cit･8 *e (think, intend)
Base √cit + *e > cete
Construction cete + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit cintayati
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

idha, bhikkhu, paṇḍito mahāpañño n'ev'attabyābādhāya ceteti na parabyābādhāya ceteti na ubhayabyābādhāya ceteti attahitaparahitaubhayahitasabbalokahitam'eva cintayamāno cinteti

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ

asañcetanikaṃ, bhante, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto no mahāsāvajjaṃ paññapetī'ti. sace pana, gahapati, cetetī'ti? mahāsāvajjaṃ, bhante, hotī'ti.

cetokhila

masc. barrenness of mind; unproductive state of mind [ceto + khila] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning barrenness of mind; unproductive state of mind
Construction ceto + khila
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cetaso + khila)

Sanskrit cetas + khila

Example

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pañca cetokhilā appahīnā, pañca cetasovinibandhā asamucchinnā, so vat'imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

cetoparicca

Grammar ger, comp vb
Meaning encompassing another's mind; knowing another's thoughts
Construction ceto + paricca
cetopariññāyañāṇa

nt. knowledge obtained by the complete comprehension of another's mind ✗
cetopariya

masc. reading the mind; encompassing the mind [ceto + pariya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning reading the mind; encompassing the mind
Construction ceto + pariya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cetaṃ + pariya)
Variant cetopariyāya
Sanskrit ceto + paryāya

Example

n'eva pubbenivāsāya,
na'pi dibbassa cakkhuno,
cetopariyāya iddhiyā,
cutiyā upapattiyā,
sotadhātuvisuddhiyā,
paṇidhī me na vijjati.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā
cetopariyañāṇa

nt. knowledge by mind reading [cetopariya + ñāṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning knowledge by mind reading
Construction cetopariya + ñāṇa
cetopariyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 52.14 (SN52.14) ✗
cetopariyāya

masc. (+gen) reading the mind (of); encompassing the mind (of) [ceto + pariyāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+gen)
Meaning reading the mind (of); encompassing the mind (of)
Construction ceto + pariyāya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (cetaṃ + pariyāya)
Variant cetopariya
Commentary (MNa) cetopariyāyan'ti cittavāraṃ cittaparicchedaṃ.
Sanskrit ceto + paryāya

Example

vīmaṃsakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā parassa cetopariyāyaṃ ajānantena tathāgate samannesanā kātabbā sammāsambuddho vā no vā iti viññāṇāyā'ti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
cetopariyāyakovida

adj. skilled in reading the mind; expert in encompassing (another's) mind [cetopariyāya + kovida] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilled in reading the mind; expert in encompassing (another's) mind
Construction cetopariyāya + kovida
Commentary (SNa) cetopariyāyakovidā'ti paresaṃ cittācāre kusalā.
cetopariyāyañāṇa

nt. knowledge obtained by encompassing the mind of another ✗
cetoparivitakka

masc. train of thought; state of mind; mental process [ceto + parivitakka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning train of thought; state of mind; mental process
Construction ceto + parivitakka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cetaso + parivitakka)
Sanskrit cetas + parivitarka + ājñāya

Example

atha kho bhagavā āyasmato soṇassa cetasā cetoparivitakkam'aññāya ... gijjhakūṭe pabbate antarahito sītavane āyasmato soṇassa sammukhe pāturahosi.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
cetoparivitakkamaññāya

ger. reading (another’s) state of mind; understanding (another’s) train of thought; comprehending (another’s) mental processes [ceto + parivitakkaṃ + aññāya] ✓

Grammar ger, comp vb
Meaning reading (another’s) state of mind; understanding (another’s) train of thought; comprehending (another’s) mental processes
Construction ceto + parivitakkaṃ + aññāya
Compound comp verb (cetoparivitakkaṃ + aññāya)
Sanskrit cetas + parivitarka + ājñāya

Examples

atha kho bhagavā āyasmato soṇassa cetasā cetoparivitakkam'aññāya ... gijjhakūṭe pabbate antarahito sītavane āyasmato soṇassa sammukhe pāturahosi.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

atha khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, bakassa brahmuno cetasā cetoparivitakkam'aññāya, seyyathā'pi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya, evam'eva, ukkaṭṭhāyaṃ subhagavane sālarājamūle antarahito tasmiṃ brahmaloke pāturahosiṃ.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
cetopasāda

masc. gladdening of heart ✗
cetopasādahetu

ind. due to mental clarity; due to bright mentality [ceto + pasāda + hetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to mental clarity; due to bright mentality
Construction ceto + pasāda + hetu
Antonym cetopadosahetu
cetopharaṇatā

fem. suffusion with mind; mental pervasion [ceto + pharaṇatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning suffusion with mind; mental pervasion
Construction ceto + pharaṇatā
cetomuni

nt. mental sagacity [ceto + muni] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning mental sagacity
Construction ceto + muni
Commentary (ANa) kāyamunin'ti kāyadvāre muniṃ uttamaṃ parisuddhaṃ, kāyena vā muniṃ. sesadvaye'pi es'eva nayo.
cetovasippatta

adj. who has attained mental mastery; in control of one’s mind [ceto + vasī + patta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has attained mental mastery; in control of one’s mind
Construction ceto + vasī + patta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cetaso + vasippatta)
Commentary (ANa) cetovasippatto'ti cittavasībhāvaṃ patto. evarūpo khīṇ'āsavo hoti, idha pana anāgāmī kathito. (ANa) iddhimā cetovasippatto'ti iddhisampanno cittassa vasibhāvapatto khīṇ'āsavo.
Sanskrit cetas + vaśiprāpta

Examples

yo ve kilesāni pahāya pañca,
paripuṇṇasekho aparihānadhammo,
cetovasippatto samāhit'indriyo,
sa ve ṭhit'atto'ti naro pavuccati.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ

tassa tattha na h'eva kho sukhino dhammapadā plavanti, api ca kho bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti. tassa evaṃ hoti, ayaṃ vā so dhammavinayo, yatth'āhaṃ pubbe brahmacariyaṃ acarin'ti.

AN 4.191 sotānugatasuttaṃ
cetovicāraṇasappāya

adj. beneficial for managing the mind [ceto + vicāraṇa + sappāya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning beneficial for managing the mind
Construction ceto + vicāraṇa + sappāya
cetovinibaddha

nt. shackle of the mind; fetter of the heart [ceto + vinibaddha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning shackle of the mind; fetter of the heart
Construction ceto + vinibaddha
cetovinīvaraṇasappāya

adj. conducive to a hindrance-free mind [ceto + vinīvaraṇa + sappāya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning conducive to a hindrance-free mind
Construction ceto + vinīvaraṇa + sappāya
cetovimutta

adj. mentally liberated; who has emancipation of heart [ceto + vimutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning mentally liberated; who has emancipation of heart
Construction ceto + vimutta
cetovimutti 1

fem. mental liberation; emancipation of heart; (comm) samadhi obtained from fruition [ceto + vimutti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning mental liberation; emancipation of heart; (comm) samadhi obtained from fruition
Construction ceto + vimutti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cetaso + vimutti)
Commentary (ANa) rāgavirāgā cetovimuttī'ti rāgassa khayavirāgena cetovimutti nāma hoti. phalasamādhiss'etaṃ nāmaṃ. (DNa) akuppā cetovimuttī'ti arahattaphalavimutti.
Sanskrit ceto + vimukti

Examples

akuppā cetovimutti etadattham'idaṃ brāhmaṇa brahmacariyaṃ

MN 30 cūḷasāropamasuttaṃ

khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti. so ca āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati. āsavānaṃ khayā samaṇo hoti.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
cetovimutti 2

fem. meditation attainment; (comm) intention; determination [ceto + vimutti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning meditation attainment; (comm) intention; determination
Construction ceto + vimutti
Compound kammadhāraya (ceto + vimutti)
Commentary (MNa) cetovimutti parihāyī'ti ettha cetovimutti nāma araññe vasissāmā'ti uppann'ājjhāsayo, so parihāyī'ti attho.
Sanskrit ceto + vimukti

Example

tesaṃ gimhānaṃ pacchime māse, tiṇ'odakasaṅkhaye, adhimattakasimānaṃ patto kāyo hoti. tesaṃ adhimattakasimānaṃ pattakāyānaṃ balavīriyaṃ parihāyi. balavīriye parihīne cetovimutti parihāyi.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
cetovimuttiphala

adj. with mental liberation as fruit; with emancipation of heart as result [cetovimutti + phala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with mental liberation as fruit; with emancipation of heart as result
Construction cetovimutti + phala
Compound kammadhāraya (cetovimutti + phala)
Commentary (MNa) phalakkhaṇe nibbattā cetovimutti phalaṃ assā'ti cetovimuttiphalā. tadeva cetovimuttisaṅkhātaṃ phalaṃ ānisaṃso assā'ti cetovimuttiphalānisaṃsā.
Sanskrit ceto + vimukti + phala

Example

katihi pan'āvuso, aṅgehi anuggahitā sammādiṭṭhi cetovimuttiphalā ca hoti cetovimuttiphal'ānisaṃsā ca, paññāvimuttiphalā ca hoti paññāvimuttiphal'ānisaṃsā cā'ti?

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
cetovimuttiphalānisaṃsa

adj. with mental liberation as fruit and benefit; with emancipation of heart as result and advantage [cetovimutti + phala + ānisaṃsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with mental liberation as fruit and benefit; with emancipation of heart as result and advantage
Construction cetovimutti + phala + ānisaṃsa
Compound kammadhāraya (cetovimutti + phalānisaṃsa)
Commentary (MNa) phalakkhaṇe nibbattā cetovimutti phalaṃ assā'ti cetovimuttiphalā. tadeva cetovimuttisaṅkhātaṃ phalaṃ ānisaṃso assā'ti cetovimuttiphalānisaṃsā.
Sanskrit ceto + vimukti + phala + anuśaṃsa

Example

katihi pan'āvuso, aṅgehi anuggahitā sammādiṭṭhi cetovimuttiphalā ca hoti cetovimuttiphal'ānisaṃsā ca, paññāvimuttiphalā ca hoti paññāvimuttiphal'ānisaṃsā cā'ti?

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
cetovimuttisampanna

adj. accomplished in mental liberation; endowed with emancipation of heart [cetovimutti + sampanna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning accomplished in mental liberation; endowed with emancipation of heart
Construction cetovimutti + sampanna
cetovimuttihīna

adj. lost mental liberation; lacking emancipation of heart [cetovimutti + hīna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning lost mental liberation; lacking emancipation of heart
Construction cetovimutti + hīna
cetovimuttī

adj. mentally liberated [ceto + vimuttī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning mentally liberated
Construction ceto + vimuttī
cetovivaṭṭakusala

adj. skilled in the expansion of mind [ceto + vivaṭṭa + kusala] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilled in the expansion of mind
Construction ceto + vivaṭṭa + kusala
cetovivaraṇasappāya

adj. conducive to opening the heart; beneficial for expanding the mind [ceto + vivaraṇa + sappāya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning conducive to opening the heart; beneficial for expanding the mind
Construction ceto + vivaraṇa + sappāya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (cetovivaraṇassa + sappāya)
Commentary (ANa) samathavipassanācittassa vivaraṇe sappāyā upakārakā'ti cetovivaraṇasappāyā.
Sanskrit ceto + vivaraṇa + sāṃpreya

Example

puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu y'āyaṃ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā... evarūpiyā kathāya nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.

AN 9.1 sambodhisuttaṃ
cetosamatha

masc. peace of mind; mental peace; tranquillity of mind; (or) balanced mind [ceto + samatha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning peace of mind; mental peace; tranquillity of mind; (or) balanced mind
Construction ceto + samatha
Compound kammadhāraya (ceto + samatha)
Sanskrit ceto + śamatha

Examples

so tāya dhammapariyattiyā na divasaṃ atināmeti, n'āpi riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, anuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bhikkhu dhammavihārī hoti.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo c'assaṃ manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā'ti, sīlesv'ev'assa paripūrakārī ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno vipassanāya samannāgato brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ.

AN 10.71 ākaṅkhasuttaṃ
cetosamathamanuyutta

adj. devoted to tranquillity of mind; practising internal peace [cetosamathaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to tranquillity of mind; practising internal peace
Construction cetosamathaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (cetosamathaṃ + anuyutta)
Commentary (MNa) ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto'ti attano cittasamathe yutto, ettha hi ajjhattanti vā attano'ti vā etaṃ ekatthaṃ, byañjanam'eva nānaṃ. bhummatthe pan'etaṃ samathan'ti upayogavacanaṃ. anū'ti iminā upasaggena yoge siddhaṃ.
Sanskrit ceto + śamatha + anuyukta (bsk)

Examples

ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca assaṃ manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā'ti, sīlesv'ev'assa paripūrakārī ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno vipassanāya samannāgato brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ.

MN 6 ākaṅkheyyasuttaṃ

idh'āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhu paṭisallān'ārāmo hoti paṭisallānarato, ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno, vipassanāya samannāgato, brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ. evarūpena kho, āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā gosiṅgasālavanaṃ sobheyyā'ti.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ
cetosamathasāmīci

fem. proper way conducive to peace of mind; correct course for tranquillity of mind; proper procedure for mental peace [cetosamatha + sāmīci] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning proper way conducive to peace of mind; correct course for tranquillity of mind; proper procedure for mental peace
Construction cetosamatha + sāmīci
Commentary (ANa) cetosamathasāmīcin'ti cittasamathassa anucchavikaṃ paṭipadaṃ.
cetosamādhi

masc. stability of mind; stillness of mind; mental composure [ceto + samādhi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning stability of mind; stillness of mind; mental composure
Construction ceto + samādhi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (cetaso + samādhi)
Sanskrit cetosamādhi (bsk)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā ātappam'anvāya padhānam'anvāya anuyogam'anvāya appamādam'anvāya sammāmanasikāram'anvāya tathārūpaṃ cetosamādhiṃ phusati yathāsamāhite citte anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarati

DN 1.6 brahmajālasuttaṃ

katamo eko dhammo duppaṭivijjho? ānantariko cetosamādhi. ayaṃ eko dhammo duppaṭivijjho.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ
cetosamphassaja

adj. caused by mental contact; produced by mental impressions [ceto + samphassa + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning caused by mental contact; produced by mental impressions
Construction ceto + samphassa + ja
Synonym manosamphassaja
Commentary (ADHa) cetosamphassajan'ti cittasamphasse jātaṃ.
Sanskrit cetas + saṃsparśa + ja

Example

tattha katamaṃ domanassaṃ? yaṃ cetasikaṃ asātaṃ, cetasikaṃ dukkhaṃ, cetosamphassajaṃ asātaṃ dukkhaṃ vedayitaṃ, cetosamphassajā asātā dukkhā vedanā.

VIBH 4.1.1 dukkhasaccaṃ
cetosukha

nt. mental pleasure; happiness; lit. mind ease [ceto + sukha] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning mental pleasure; happiness; lit. mind ease
Construction ceto + sukha
cetosuci

nt. purity of mind [ceto + suci] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning purity of mind
Construction ceto + suci
Synonym manosoceyya
cettha 1

sandhi. and there; but there [ca + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adv
Meaning and there; but there
Construction ca + ettha
Sanskrit ca + atra

Examples

telappadīpo c'ettha jhāyeyya, catasso ca pajāpatiyo manāpamanāpena paccupaṭṭhitā assu. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, kumāra, sukhaṃ vā so sayeyya no vā? kathaṃ vā te ettha hotī'ti?

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ

sace te, bhaggava, agaru viharemu āvesane ekarattan'ti. na kho me, bhante, garu. atthi c'ettha pabbajito paṭhamaṃ vās'ūpagato. sace so anujānāti, viharatha, bhante, yathāsukhan'ti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
cettha 2

sandhi. and in this case; if here [ca + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adv
Meaning and in this case; if here
Construction ca + ettha
Sanskrit ca + atra

Example

yo'pi c'ettha katakusalo hoti, tam'pi ñātirogabhogabyasan'ādīnaṃ aññatarena byasanena samannāgataṃ disvā vā sutvā vā tesaṃ abhāve'pi vaṭṭadukkhaṃ anatikkantattā, dukkhito'va ayan'ti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
cetya

nt. shrine [√ci + ti + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, from citi
Meaning shrine
Root Family √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Construction √ci > ce + ti + *ya
citi + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant cetiya
Sanskrit caitya
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Examples

bahuṃ ve saraṇaṃ yanti,
pabbatāni vanāni ca,
ārāmarukkhacetyāni,
manussā bhayatajjitā.

DHP 188 buddhavaggo

ārāmacetyā vanacetyā,
pokkharañño sunimmitā,
manussarāmaṇeyyassa,
kalaṃ n'āgghanti soḷasiṃ.

SN 11.15 rāmaṇeyyakasuttaṃ
cedaṃ

sandhi. if this thing [ce + idaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning if this thing
Construction ce + idaṃ
Sanskrit ced + idam

Example

kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvetha. sakkā, bhikkhave, kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ. no ce'daṃ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ, n'āhaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvethā'ti.

AN 2.19 adhikaraṇavaggo
cenaṃ

sandhi. and this; and him [ca + enaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning and this; and him
Construction ca + enaṃ
Sanskrit ca + etam

Examples

kiṃsu dutiyā purisassa hoti,
kiṃsu c'enaṃ pasāsati,
kissa c'ābhirato macco,
sabbadukkhā pamuccatī'ti.

SN 1.59 dutiyasuttaṃ

saddhā dutiyā purisassa hoti,
paññā c'enaṃ pasāsati,
nibbān'ābhirato macco,
sabbadukkhā pamuccatī'ti.

SN 1.59 dutiyasuttaṃ
cepi

sandhi. even if [ce + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning even if
Construction ce + api
Antonym no cepi
Synonym sacepi
Sanskrit ced + api

Examples

appaṃ vata jīvitaṃ idaṃ,
oraṃ vassasatā'pi miyyati,
yo ce'pi aticca jīvati,
atha kho so jarasāpi miyyati.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6

ettako ce'pi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
cela 1

nt. cloth; sheet [√cil + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from cilati
Meaning cloth; sheet
Root Family √cil
Root √cil･1 a (clothe)
Construction √cil > cel + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym acela
Commentary (MNa) celaṃ vuccati vatthaṃ
Sanskrit cela
Sanskrit Root √cil 6 (put on clothes)

Example

cel'aṇḍukena ce'pi sabrahmacārī āyasmantaṃ puṇṇaṃ mantāṇiputtaṃ muddhanā pariharantā labheyyuṃ dassanāya, labheyyuṃ payirūpāsanāya, tesam'pi lābhā tesam'pi suladdhaṃ

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
cela 2

nt. clothes; garment [√cil + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from cilati
Meaning clothes; garment
Root Family √cil
Root √cil･1 a (clothe)
Construction √cil > cel + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym acela
Commentary (MNa) celaṃ vuccati vatthaṃ
Sanskrit cela
Sanskrit Root √cil 6 (put on clothes)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ādittacelo vā ādittasīso vā, tass'eva celassa vā sīsassa vā nibbāpanāya adhimattaṃ chandañ'ca vāyāmañ'ca ussāhañ'ca ussoḷhiñ'ca appaṭivāniñ'ca satiñ'ca sampajaññañ'ca kareyya.

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ
celaka

masc. standard bearer; ensign bearer; bannerman; lit. related to cloth [√cil + *a + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from cela
Meaning standard bearer; ensign bearer; bannerman; lit. related to cloth
Root Family √cil
Root √cil･1 a (clothe)
Construction √cil > cel + *a + ka
cela + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (ANa) celakā'ti ye yuddhe jayaddhajaṃ gahetvā purato gacchanti.
Sanskrit celaka
Sanskrit Root √cil 6 (put on clothes)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño paccantime nagare bahubalakāyo paṭivasati, seyyath'idaṃ, hatth'ārohā ass'ārohā rathikā dhanuggahā celakā calakā piṇḍadāyakā uggā rājaputtā pakkhandino mahānāgā sūrā cammayodhino dāsakaputtā.

AN 7.67 nagaropamasuttaṃ
celaṇḍaka

Meaning cloth pad; pad placed on the head for carrying heavy items; lit. cloth egg

Commentary (MNa) celaṇḍupakenā'ti ettha celaṃ vuccati vatthaṃ, aṇḍupakaṃ cumbaṭakaṃ. vatthacumbaṭakaṃ sīse katvā
Sanskrit cela + aṇḍuka (scrotum)

Example

cel'aṇḍukena ce'pi sabrahmacārī āyasmantaṃ puṇṇaṃ mantāṇiputtaṃ muddhanā pariharantā labheyyuṃ dassanāya, labheyyuṃ payirūpāsanāya, tesam'pi lābhā tesam'pi suladdhaṃ

celukkhepa

masc. waving of garments (as a sign of applause) ✗
ceva 1

Meaning only if; if just
Construction ce + eva

Examples

so paṭisaṃharati c'eva na ca vitakketi na ca vicāreti

SN 47.10 bhikkhunupassayasuttaṃ

sandiṭṭhiyā c'eva vīvadātā,
saṃsuddhapaññā kusalā mutīmā,
na tesaṃ koci parihīnapañño,
diṭṭhī hi tesam'pi tathā samattā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
ceva 2

sandhi. and even; as well as [ca + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning and even; as well as
Construction ca + eva
Antonym na ceva
Sanskrit ca + eva

Examples

paññā c'eva sati yañ'ca
nāmarūpañ'ca mārisa,
etaṃ me puṭṭho pabrūhi,
katth'etaṃ uparujjhati.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1

na hi pana taṃ, gahapati, paṭibhāsi bhagavantaṃ uttariṃ paṭipucchituṃ, kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, āturakāyo c'eva hoti āturacitto ca, kittāvatā ca pana āturakāyo hi kho hoti no ca āturacitto'ti?

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
ceva 3

sandhi. but then [ca + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning but then
Construction ca + eva
Antonym na ceva
Sanskrit ca + eva

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye thullaphusitake deve vassante udake udakabubbuḷaṃ uppajjati c'eva nirujjhati ca.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso parittaṃ aggiṃ ujjāletukāmo assa. so tattha allāni c'eva tiṇāni pakkhipeyya, allāni ca gomayāni pakkhipeyya, allāni ca kaṭṭhāni pakkhipeyya

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
ceva 4

sandhi. and just [ca + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning and just
Construction ca + eva
Antonym na ceva
Sanskrit ca + eva

Examples

sappāyāni c'eva bhojanāni bhuñjeyyāsi, mā te asappāyāni bhojanāni bhuñjato vaṇo assāvī assa.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

atha ca pana tvaṃ, moghapurisa, attanā duggahitena amhe c'eva abbhācikkhasi, attānañ'ca khanasi, bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavasi. tañ'hi te, moghapurisa, bhavissati dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāyā'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
cevassa

sandhi. and his alone; but just his [ca + eva + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + pron
Meaning and his alone; but just his
Construction ca + eva + assa
Sanskrit ca + eva + asya

Example

jayaṃ ve maññati bālo,
vācāya pharusaṃ bhaṇaṃ,
jayañ'c'ev'assa taṃ hoti,
yā titikkhā vijānato.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ
cevetassa

sandhi. and just of this; and exactly of this [ce + eva + etassa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + pron
Meaning and just of this; and exactly of this
Construction ce + eva + etassa
Sanskrit ca + eva + etasya

Example

maṃ ce'pi tumhe, bhikkhave, etam'atthaṃ paṭipuccheyyātha, aham'pi taṃ evam'evaṃ byākareyyaṃ yathā taṃ ānandena byākataṃ. eso c'ev'etassa attho. evañ'ca naṃ dhāreyyāthā'ti.

SN 35.117 kāmaguṇasuttaṃ
cevettha

sandhi. and now here; and in this regard just [ca + eva + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + adv
Meaning and now here; and in this regard just
Construction ca + eva + ettha
Sanskrit ca + eva + atra

Example

upamā kho my'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, katā atthassa viññāpanāya. ayaṃ c'ev'ettha attho, samatittiko telapatto'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya etaṃ satiyā adhivacanaṃ.

SN 47.20 janapadakalyāṇīsuttaṃ
cesa 1

sandhi. even if he [ce + esa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning even if he
Construction ce + esa
Sanskrit ced + etaḥ

Example

samaṇo kho daharo'ti na uññātabbo na paribhotabbo. daharo'pi c'esa samaṇo gotamo mah'iddhiko hoti mah'ānubhāvo, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ime pañhe puccheyyan'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
cesa 2

sandhi. and this [ca + esa] ~

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning and this
Construction ca + esa
Synonym ceso, cetaṃ, cidaṃ, cimaṃ, etañca, imañca, panesā
Sanskrit ca + etaḥ
ceso

sandhi. and this [ca + eso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning and this
Construction ca + eso
Synonym cesa, cetaṃ, cidaṃ, cimaṃ, etañca, imañca, panesā
Sanskrit ca + etaḥ

Examples

te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ m'āyasmanto etaṃ bhikkhuṃ kiñci avacuttha, dhammavādī c'eso bhikkhu, vinayavādī c'eso bhikkhu, amhākañ'c'eso bhikkhu chandañ'ca ruciñ'ca ādāya voharati

VIN PAT SA 11 bhedānuvattakasikkhāpadaṃ

sabhayo c'eso maggo sappaṭibhayo ca sakaṇṭako ca sagahano ca ummaggo ca kummaggo ca duhitiko ca. asappurisasevito c'eso maggo, na c'eso maggo sappurisehi sevito.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ
coca

masc. banana ✗
cocapāna

nt. sweet drink made of banana ✗
codaka 1

masc. plaintiff; accuser; complainant; rebuker [√cud + *aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from codeti
Meaning plaintiff; accuser; complainant; rebuker
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *e (impel, accuse)
Construction √cud > cod + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit codaka
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno codakaṃ'y'eva paṭippharati, kiṃ nu kho tuyhaṃ bālassa abyattassa bhaṇitena!

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

codakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetu'kāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitvā pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ
codaka 2

masc. advisor; admonisher; encourager [√cud + *aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from codeti
Meaning advisor; admonisher; encourager
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *e (impel, accuse)
Construction √cud > cod + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (SNa) codako'ti vatthusmiṃ otiṇṇe vā anotiṇṇe vā vītikkamaṃ disvā, āvuso, bhikkhunā nāma evaṃ nivāsetabbaṃ, evaṃ pārupitabbaṃ, evaṃ gantabbaṃ, evaṃ ṭhātabbaṃ, evaṃ nisīditabbaṃ, evaṃ khāditabbaṃ, evaṃ bhuñjitabban'ti tantivasena anusiṭṭhiṃ deti.
Sanskrit codaka
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Example

āraddhavīriyo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vattā, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vacanakkhamo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. codako, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. pāpagarahī, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.

codanā 1

codanā 2

fem. reprimanding; criticising; blaming [√cud] ✗
codanā 3

fem. accusing; charging [√cud] ✗
codanāraha

adj. blameworthy; worthy of reprimand ✗
codanāvatthu

nt. ground for criticism or accusation ✗
codanāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.167 (AN5.167) ✗
codayati 1

pr. (+acc) accuses; rebukes; charges [√cud + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning accuses; rebukes; charges
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *aya (impel, accuse)
Base √cud + *aya > codaya
Construction codaya + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit codayati
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Example

attanā coday'attānaṃ,
paṭimaṃsetha attanā,
so attagutto satimā,
sukhaṃ bhikkhu vihāhisi.

DHP 379 bhikkhuvaggo
codayati 2

pr. (+acc) impels; incites; encourages; spurs on [√cud + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning impels; incites; encourages; spurs on
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *aya (impel, accuse)

Construction codaya + ti

Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Example

ujumaggamhi akkhāte,
gacchatha mā nivattatha,
attanā coday'attānaṃ,
nibbānam'abhihāraye.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā
codayamāna 1

prp. (+acc) prompting; urging; encouraging; impelling [√cud + *aya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of codeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning prompting; urging; encouraging; impelling
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *aya (impel, accuse)
Base √cud + *aya > codaya
Construction codaya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit codayamāna
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Example

dvattikkhattuṃ codayamāno sārayamāno taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, icc'etaṃ kusalaṃ, no ce abhinipphādeyya, catukkhattuṃ pañcakkhattuṃ chakkhattu'paramaṃ tuṇhībhūtena uddissa ṭhātabbaṃ

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ
codayamāna 2

prp. (+acc) reproving [√cud] ✗
codāpeti

pr. (+acc) causes to charge; makes accuse [√cud + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of codeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes to charge; makes accuse
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *āpe (impel, accuse)
Base √cud + *āpe > codāpe (caus)
Construction codāpe + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (VINa) codāpetī'ti attanā samīpe ṭhatvā aññaṃ bhikkhu āṇāpeti, so tassa vacanena taṃ codeti, codāpakass'eva vācāya vācāya saṅghādiseso.
Sanskrit cud
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Example

anuddhaṃseyyā'ti codeti vā codāpeti vā.

VIN 1.2.8 duṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
codita 1

pp. accused; rebuked; charged; blamed [√cud + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of codeti
Meaning accused; rebuked; charged; blamed
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *e (impel, accuse)
Base √cud + *e > code
Construction code + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym acodita
Variant cudita
Sanskrit codita
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Examples

atha satthāni kurute,
paravādehi codito,
esa khv'assa mahāgedho,
mosavajjaṃ pagāhati.

SNP 45 tissametteyyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 7

puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ paṭippharati. yam'p'āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ paṭippharati, ayam'pi dhammo dovacassakaraṇo.

MN 15 anumānasuttaṃ
codita 2

pp. impelled; incited; exhorted [√cud + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of codeti
Meaning impelled; incited; exhorted
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *e (impel, accuse)
Base √cud + *e > code
Construction code + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit codita
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchato paṭikkamati, piṭṭhito rathaṃ pavatteti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo assadoso.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

yo ve buddhena codito,
bhikkhu saṅghassa pekkhato,
migāramātupāsādaṃ,
pād'aṅguṭṭhena kampayi.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
coditabba

ptp. should be accused; should be charged; lit. to be accused [√cud + *e + itabba] ~

Grammar ptp of codeti
Meaning should be accused; should be charged; lit. to be accused
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *e (impel, accuse)
Base √cud + *e > code
Construction code + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)
codiya 1

ger. inciting [√cud] ✗
codiya 2

ger. reproving, accusing [√cud] ✗
codiyamāna

prp. (+instr) being accused (by); being charged (by); being blamed (by) [√cud + *e + iya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of codiyati, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being accused (by); being charged (by); being blamed (by)
Root Family √cud
Root √cud･8 *e + iya (impel, accuse)
Base √cud + *e + iya > codiya (pass)
Construction codiya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit codyamāna
Sanskrit Root √cud 1 (impel)

Example

katame ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭha purisakhaḷuṅkā aṭṭha ca purisadosā? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno, na sarāmī'ti asatiyā nibbeṭheti.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ
codetabba 1

ptp. should be accused; could be charged; lit. to be accused [√cud + *e + tabba] ✓

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ
codetabba 2

cīvar'atthikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā veyyāvaccakaro upasaṅkamitvā dvattikkhattuṃ codetabbo sāretabbo, attho me, āvuso, cīvarenā'ti

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

paṭicchādeyyā'ti, imaṃ jānitvā codessanti, sāressanti khuṃsessanti, vambhessanti, maṅkuṃ karissanti n'ārocessāmī'ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte, āpatti pācittiyassa.

Meaning wanting to accuse; wishing to lay a charge

Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (codetuṃ + kāma)

Example

codakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetu'kāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, parisuddhakāyasamācāro nu kho'mhi, parisuddhen'amhi kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena.

copana

nt. stirring, motor activity [√cup] ✗
copeti

pr. moves (transitive) [√cup] ✗
cora

masc. thief; robber [√cur + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from coreti
Meaning thief; robber
Root Family √cur
Root √cur･8 *e (steal)
Construction √cur > cor + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (VIN 1.1.2) coro nāma yo pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati. eso coro nāma.
Sanskrit cora
Sanskrit Root √cur 3, 10 (steal)

Examples

dinnaṃ sukhaphalaṃ hoti,
n'ādinnaṃ hoti taṃ tathā,
corā haranti rājāno,
aggi ḍahati nassati.

SN 1.41 ādittasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici kulāni bahu'tthikāni appapurisāni tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi.

corakathā

fem. talk about thieves; gangster stories [cora + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk about thieves; gangster stories
Construction cora + kathā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (corānaṃ + kathā)
Sanskrit cora + kathā

Example

seyyath'idaṃ, rājakathaṃ corakathaṃ mahāmattakathaṃ senākathaṃ bhayakathaṃ yuddhakathaṃ annakathaṃ pānakathaṃ vatthakathaṃ sayanakathaṃ mālākathaṃ gandhakathaṃ ñātikathaṃ yānakathaṃ

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
corakantāra

masc. wasteland with thieves; desert with robbers [cora + kantāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wasteland with thieves; desert with robbers
Construction cora + kantāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (corānaṃ + kantāra)
Sanskrit cora + kāntāra

Example

bhāyeyya vā so na vā bhāyeyya, āpatti pācittiyassa. corakantāraṃ vā vāḷakantāraṃ vā pisācakantāraṃ vā ācikkhati. bhāyeyya vā so na vā bhāyeyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.6.5 bhiṃsāpanasikkhāpadaṃ
coragāmaṇika

masc. chief thief; lead robber [cora + gāmaṇika] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning chief thief; lead robber
Construction cora + gāmaṇika
Commentary (VINa) coragāmaṇiko'ti corajeṭṭhako.
coragāmanī

masc. leader of thieves; leader of bandits ✗
coraghāta

masc. executioner; lit. thief killer [cora + ghāta] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning executioner; lit. thief killer
Construction cora + ghāta
Compound kammadhāraya (cora + ghāta)
Synonym coraghātaka
Sanskrit cora + ghāta

Example

labheyya nu kho so coro coraghātesu, āgamentu tāva bhavanto coraghātā, amukasmiṃ me gāme vā nigame vā mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā, yāvāhaṃ tesaṃ uddisitvā āgacchāmī'ti

DN 23.5 pāyāsisuttaṃ
coraghātaka

masc. executioner; lit. thief killer [cora + ghātaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning executioner; lit. thief killer
Construction cora + ghātaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (core + ghātaka)
Synonym coraghāta
Sanskrit cora + ghātaka

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo orabbhiko hoti sūkariko sākuṇiko māgaviko luddo macchaghātako coro coraghātako goghātako bandhan'āgāriko, ye vā pan'aññe'pi keci kurūrakammantā.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena kaṇh'ābhijāti paññattā, orabbhikā sūkarikā sākuṇikā māgavikā luddā macchaghātakā corā coraghātakā bandhan'āgārikā ye vā pan'aññe'pi keci kurūrakammantā.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
corantarāya

masc. danger posed by thieves ✗
corapaccatthika

masc. enemy thief; hostile bandit [cora + paccatthika] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning enemy thief; hostile bandit
Construction cora + paccatthika
Commentary (VINa) corā eva paccatthikā corapaccatthikā.
corapapāta

masc. thieves' cliff ✗
coraparissaya

masc. danger of thieves [cora + parissaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning danger of thieves
Construction cora + parissaya
corabhaya

nt. danger of thieves; peril of criminals [cora + bhaya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning danger of thieves; peril of criminals
Construction cora + bhaya
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (corehi + bhaya)
Sanskrit cora + bhaya

Example

āgantukassa bhattaṃ āgantukabhattaṃ, methunā apeto methun'āpeto, corā bhayaṃ corabhayaṃ, rañño putto rājaputto, dhaññānaṃ rāsi dhaññarāsi, rūpe saññā rūpasaññā, saṃsāre dukkhaṃ saṃsāradukkhaṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 327
corasādhāraṇa

adj. vulnerable to thieves; lit. shared with thieves [cora + sādhāraṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning vulnerable to thieves; lit. shared with thieves
Construction cora + sādhāraṇa
corasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.84 (AN8.84) ✗
corābhinīta

adj. because of the bandits; driven (to it) by thieves; lit. lead by thief ✗
corāsaṅkā

fem. suspicion of thieves [cora + āsaṅkā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning suspicion of thieves
Construction cora + āsaṅkā
corikā

fem. theft [√cur] ✗
corikāya

ind. by stealing, by robbing; clandestinely ✗
corisañña

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as a female thief [corī + sañña] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as a female thief
Construction corī + sañña
corī

fem. female thief [√cur + a + *ī] ~

Grammar fem, from cora
Meaning female thief
Root Family √cur
Root √cur･8 *e (steal)
Construction √cur > cor + a + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit corī
Sanskrit Root √cur 3, 10 (steal)
corīvaṭṭhāpana

nt. ordaining a (female) thief ✗
corīvuṭṭhāpikāsikkhāpada

nt. rule about ordaining thieves [corī + vuṭṭhāpikā + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about ordaining thieves
Construction corī + vuṭṭhāpikā + sikkhāpada
corīsama

adj. like a robber; similar to a thief [corī + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a robber; similar to a thief
Construction corī + sama
Compound kammadhāraya (corī + sama)
Sanskrit corī + sama

Example

vadhakasamā, corīsamā, ayyasamā, mātāsamā, bhaginīsamā, sakhīsamā, dāsīsamā. imā kho, sujāte, satta purisassa bhariyāyo.

AN 7.63 bhariyāsuttaṃ
corupaddava

masc. attack from robbers ✗
coreti

pr. (+acc) steals; robs [√cur + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning steals; robs
Root Family √cur
Root √cur･8 *e (steal)
Base √cur + *e > core
Construction core + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit corayati
Sanskrit Root √cur 3, 10 (steal)

Example

cura'icc'evam'ādito dhātugaṇato ṇe ṇaya'icc'ete paccayā honti kattari, kāritasaññā ca. coreti, corayati, cinteti, cintayati, manteti, mantayati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 452
corenta

prp. (+acc) stealing; robbing [√cur + *e + nta] ~

Grammar prp of coreti, trans (+acc)
Meaning stealing; robbing
Root Family √cur
Root √cur･8 *e (steal)
Base √cur + *e > core
Construction core + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit corayat
Sanskrit Root √cur 3, 10 (steal)
corehyahāriya

adj. unable to be stolen by thieves [corehi + ahāriya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning unable to be stolen by thieves
Construction corehi + ahāriya
Compound alutta tatiyā tappurisa (corehi + ahāriya)
Sanskrit coraiḥ + ahārya

Examples

kiṃsu ajarasā sādhu,
kiṃsu sādhu adhiṭṭhitaṃ,
kiṃsu narānaṃ ratanaṃ,
kiṃsu corehy'ahāriyan'ti.

SN 1.52 ajarasāsuttaṃ

sīlaṃ ajarasā sādhu,
saddhā sādhu adhiṭṭhitā,
paññā narānaṃ ratanaṃ,
puññaṃ corehy'ahāriyan'ti.

SN 1.52 ajarasāsuttaṃ
corosi

sandhi. you are a thief!; you are a robber! [coro + asi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + pr
Meaning you are a thief!; you are a robber!
Construction coro + asi
Synonym thenosi
Sanskrit coraḥ + asi

Example

coro'si bālo'si mūḷho'si theno'sī'ti, tathārūpaṃ bhikkhu adinnaṃ ādiyamāno ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

VIN PAT PA 2 adinnādānasikkhāpadaṃ
colaka

nt. piece of cloth; small rag [coḷa + ka] ~

Grammar nt, dimin of coḷa
Meaning piece of cloth; small rag
Construction coḷa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Variant coḷaka
Sanskrit colaka (jacket)
coḷa 1

masc. cloth; rag ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning cloth; rag
Sanskrit cola (jacket)

Examples

sace enti manussattaṃ,
dalidde jāyare kule,
coḷaṃ piṇḍo ratī khiḍḍā,
yattha kicchena labbhati.

SN 1.49 maccharisuttaṃ

bhisi nāma pañca bhisiyo, uṇṇabhisi, coḷabhisi, vākabhisi, tiṇabhisi, paṇṇabhisi.

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
coḷa 2

nt. cloth; rag ~

Grammar nt
Meaning cloth; rag
Sanskrit cola (jacket)

Sanskrit colaka (jacket)
coḷapaṭṭa

Meaning cloth cushion; rag mattress
